text: Delicious tripel. Fruity, with soft esters, some Belgian spice and clove. They know their business.

330 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 for this fucking book. The pour is a hazy golden yellow color. This is a lot foggier than I would ever expect a tripel to be. There is an off white head and a pretty good amount of lace as it falls. The aroma is full of banana and clove. There is a strong yeastiness and a light funk with a touch of tartness on the nose. Its got a very tripel thing happening. The flavor is a little better and more balanced. The banana and clove are pretty hard to get past, especially when backed up by the yeast. The subtleties slowly come in with a light fruitiness, a hint of dustiness and a good balance. The mouth feel is light and clean with a bright carbonation and a lingeringly clove and fruit on the finish. This is further proof that tripels arent my jam, at all. 6 3 6 4 13

Bottle from Merchants. Bottle shared with koleminer20, for the book. Aroma is fruity, very yeasty, slight clove, dry, straw, wheat. Appearance is hazy, golden, off white head. Taste is slightly tart, banana, clove, yeast, dry, barnyard, fruity and good. Mouthfeel is medium body, light crisp carbonation, fruity dry clove aftertaste. Overall, enjoyable for the style.
330ml bottle from Pinta's in Moscow. Pours gold with a large white head. Aroma is peach, banana, yeast, spices. Taste is yeast, spices, dough, light sourness, a little bit boozey.
About as classic as can get. White foam, medium carbonation. Lots of flowery esters. Clean.

Golden coloured ale with a nice white head.

Aroma: malty, spicy some white bread and somme fruitiness. 

Taste: fruity, spicy, malty and yeasty.

Light golden, very much like a classical lager. Not the aroma, though, which is slightly yeasty with a dominance of honey without strong sweetness ( is there such a thing?). Taste is quite dry and end with a moderate bitterness. Very nice tripel.

Belgian tripel ale. 8%ABV. Good foamy head, cloudy from sediment. Palate and taste has the typical sweetness from a Belgian Abby ale. 

Ian

Bottle 33cl. Yellow gold with a white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma of fruits (grapefruit?), hops and grain. The taste is bitter, at first slightly but stronger near the aftertaste. Not too complex, but good.

Bottle of 33cl, in a Trappist glass; from the fridge.

Really a good Triple beer. A beautiful yellow/amber colour with a nice white head. Yeasty aroma and taste, but not overwhelming.

Real good beer
First tried some years ago, still one of my favorite Tripels. Pours a golden brownish color. Aroma/Taste: dark and tropical fruits, Belgian yeast and citrus. Very well balanced.

330ml bottle bought at ICBeer in Kwun Tong.
Looks: Translucent light golden colour with a ring of dirt-like yeast sediments; Three finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 4 minutes; Beautiful sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragrant and sweet Pils malt, with strong orange, pineapples, bananas, vanilla, strong bubblegum, waffles, floral, sugar, cloves, spices, herbs, strong Bel yeast, lemon and strong grass. Very nice!

Taste: Medium sweet Pils malt, with strong metallic, tartness, orange, floral, sugar, light spices, light herbs, Bel yeast, biscuits, lemon, mid to strong bitter hops and sharp grass.

Body: Mid to full body. Slick palate.

Mouth Feel: Solid Pils maltyness in a slightly thinned background. Still slick and smooth. Strong Bel yeast imprints with nice orange ester, flowery with nice strong sweetness with is balanced by subtle tartness. 8% booze is very well hidden. Notable hops presence with fair herbs and light spices. Biscuity with quite strong lemon to round. Very nice!

Hoppiness: Floral, spices, herbs, lemon and strong grass in nose and taste; Bitterness is quite strong for a lasting, close to high astringent sweet-bitter orangey malty finish. 

After Taste: Fairly dry. Herbal hoppy and bitter to mouth.

Comments: This one has good looks and head, wonderfully fruity Bel yeasty aroma, a pretty well attenuated body with good sweetness and nice yeasty spicyness rounded with sublime herbal hops. Impressively tasted with an refreshing edge like a Saison, I cant help to think St. Bernardus can wave its magic wand to impress with any style at any level. A real joy!

Aroma: spiciness, alcohol, fruity esters: pear, peach.
Appearance: yellow, creamy head.
Taste: fruity, soft alcohol, citrus, spicy.
Palate: smooth, medium body, high carbonated, long sweet finish.

For some bizarre reason I seem to be drawn to Belgian beers like a moth to a flame and each time, like a moth, I end up getting burnt. The top was a bit dodgy which makes me suspicious about the taste There was a nice flavour of hops and that typical Belgian yeast, but there was also, to me anyway, an overpowering sourness to the beer. I am no fan of sour beers, but I persevered. It was better with food (finished while eating grilled pork chops) than on its own. Overall nice colour, good head, nice low carbonation and definite malt hops and yeast, but too sour for me.
Still my favourite Tripel. Strong, but very drinkable. Slightly bitter finish, not too sweet at the beginning in the first place. Still need cheese as a side though :>
Color muy claro y sabor muy light para ser una belgium Tripel, mas bien parece una wheat Ale

Originally rated on 12/25/08. This poured a apricot colored body with a mid sized white cap that left good lace. Aromas and flavors of orange, spices, and yeast. Mouthfeel was slightly spicy because of the carbonation, yet it went down smooth. Not my favorite triple because i felt it wasnt assertive enough, however it is still a pretty good brew, thats worth a try.

Slightly hazy deep golden color. High carbonation, with an unstable head. Fruity yeast aromas of banana and some light malts. Has a bright flavor, a bit of acidity, like green bananas. Spicy hops. Alcoholic and sweet in the aftertaste, very pleasant finish actually. Leaves a numbing sensation on the tongue. Could it be possible orange peel? Exemplary triple!

0.33l bottle. Malty aroma, light yeasty notes, alcohol notes. Hazy golden color, white head. Malty taste, yeasty notes, light sour, light bitter. Full body, slick texture, soft to average carbonation and malty, light bitter finish with alcohol notes. Good.

0.33l bottle. Slightly hazy orange body with a huge white head. Aroma of sugar syrup, peach, apricot, coriander and even a hint of banana. Taste of sugar syrup, coriander, peach, floral hops with a slight medicinal character. Great tripel that is fruitier than the average.

Fluffy, creamy white head stayed well on a hazy light orange coloured body. 
Bitter/Sweet aroma with citrus, orange, spice & yeast.
Medium bodied, sharp, clean, crisp & very dry
Bitter citrus, yeast, lemon, spice, sweet orange & a long tangy finish
This is up there with Westmalle Tripel & Tripel Karmeliet.

Bottle. Unclear golden body with a small off-white head. A bit light on aroma, feels like sweet citric fruit and spicy yeast. Flavor has a light, mild pale malt and fruit sweetness, spices and low bitterness. Fine balanced body and average aftertaste. Sure a balanced beer with qualities put nothing outstanding really.
Aus der Flasche getrunken (Händlerlieferung). Sehr helles Amber. Ein gutes Tripel, aber kein Außergewöhnliches.
Butelka 0,33l. pite w domu. Zamglony pomarańczowy kolor z małą czapą piany, która szybko opada. Aromaty kwiatowe , ziołowe z karmelem i chlebem, to samo w smaku. Piwo lekkie pomimo dużego alkoholu

Unsurprisingly, Watous St. Bernardus Tripel drinks like a true Belgian Tripel. Golden orange color with a white, foamy head. Champagne-like yeast esters on the nose with some stone fruit and herbal hops. Flavor follows the nose. This beer finishes with a moderately grassy hop bitterness. Acohol is hidden well, and the taste is refreshing and crisp.
Złociste, mętne. Aromat słaby i mało ciekawy, głównie słody i trochę karmelu. W smaku dodatkowo trochę owoców i przypraw. Dość wysokie wysycenie.
Got this one part of the holiday season 6 pack. Gotta love those clergymen brewing great beers. This type of great abbey ale rekindles my faith in christianity. ;)

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 Cult tripel with a great herbal / spiced and hoppy aroma and taste. Apple boujee bouquet. To be fair I could tire of it after a while and the head dissipates quickly enough but nonetheless an Essential Beer I keep coming back to.

Tomada en el Kraken.
Rubia triple belga.

Alcoholica. Potente.
Buena en su estilo
Pours hazy orange with lively carbonation and a white head. Aroma is carmel fruit and floral. Carmel malts, bread, pear, and herbal flavours with a light body. Very well done.
33 cl bottle purchased @ La caisse de bière. Triple bien réussie et très fruitée.

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy golden pour with two finger creamy white head. Excellent head retention, very persistent, very thick. Nice. Lots of yeast floating in the glass. Therefore, nose is very yeast. Good malt character. Flowery and herbal, very pleasant.

Medium body, softly carbonated. Light palate. Nicely balanced taste, malty sweetness, alcohol bitterness. Aroma of belgian yeast and caramel malts. Subtle cake-like presence. Herbal. Grassy. Liquory. Some earthy hops. Alcohol bitterness in the aftertaste. Long finish, dry with notable alcohol presence.

Overall, nice tripel. Tasty.

0,33 l bottle. Pours hazy golden with big frothy white head. Aroma of malt some caramel, yeast and plenty of different fruit, pears mainly, some apples. Some noble hop notes in the background. Aroma is also a bit funky. Flavor is similar, good malt and caramel base with some yeast and fruit. Very complex, but gentle flavors with pleasant carbonation kick. Body is full, starts medium sweet complemented with some light sourness that goes into pleasant mellow spicy bitterness and long finish. Well rounded and complex beer. Alcohol is hardly noticeable. Proper treat.

330ml bottle pours light orange-brown with a long-lasting foamy white head. Aromas of caramel malt, stone fruit and a little yeast. Beautifully balanced flavours of caramel malt, pear, bread and floral characters. Does not have all of the depth of other similar abbey ales so does not hide the alcohol as well, but the simplicity and high-quality ingredients are evident.
Aromat ujdzie, wygląd średni, a smak bardzo ciekawy - lekko przyprawowy, pijalne.

A fortunate purchase at Total Wine in Frisco, TX. The 750 ml bottle gives up a hazy yellow-gold body. The head is a persistent white foam. The nose is a delight, I detect a light fruitiness with spice undertones. A drink gives me yellow raisin, apricot and a bit of clove. Rather nice. The taste ends with a dry bitterness, quite interesting. Quads are more to my liking but this is a top level tripel.

Aromat - pomarańcze z koglem moglem. 
Piana - niska, biała, średnia i drobna.
Wysycenie średnio wysokie. W smaku rozcieńczony sok z cukrem w stylu waty cukrowej z niewielkim dodatkiem bananów.
Barwa jasna. Piękna piana. Gęsta, drobna, bardzo obfita. Aromat średnio intensywny. Głównie zioła i cytrusy. W smaku lekka słodycz. Alkohol dobrze ukryty. bardzo fajny Tripel.

Bottle.

A- Cloves, yeasty, spice.

A- Yellow color, cloudy liquid, white head.

T- Spices, yeasty.

P- Medium body, average texture, average carbonation, boring finish.

O- Okay, a bit boring though. Needs more complexity. Been a tad let down in all of these St. Bernardus beers.

Backlog: Bottle at PaterMarcus. Pours a hazy golden-orange colour, thin white head disappears quickly. Aroma of citrus, herbs, some tangerine, and maybe a bit of caramel. Taste is bitter and fruity, with medium carbonation. A very well balanced, hoppy beer, an enjoyable drink.
Nice amber colour with a big white head. Well balanced taste fruity bitter nuts and hops.

Pours hazy golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is caramel, cinnamon, sourish fruits, some citrus, melon, berries, toffee, light vanilla cream. Taste is quite same, some spices added. Very nice beer!

11.2oz bottle. Pours yellow-amber with a large, foamy white head. Aroma is pear, green apple, bread, flowers, and clove. Taste is sweet with a light acidity; yeast, spice, apple, banana, toffee malt, grain, and earth. Some alcohol. Semi-dry Trappist yeast and big, lingering earthy hop finish. Just a touch of bitterness. Full body. Medium, prickly carbonation. Slick, sudsy mouthfeel.

Pours hazy yellow/orange with a foamy, dissipating, slightly off-white head. The aroma contains malt, yeast, fruits (pear, banana), spices and dough. It tastes medium fruity sweet at first, then medium spicy bitter but with a lingering fruitiness in the dry, dough-like finish. Fizzy carbonation, creamy texture, warming alcohol. Comparable to Westmalle Tripel but less dry and sweeter. Great balance overall.
Luxurious Belgian yeast aroma , with some grassy hops too. A very clean tasting tripel , the starting point for most craft beers .

.33l bottle at Proeflokaal t Paultje Den Bosch, poured a sloghtly hazy golden beer with thin soapy white head. Aroma: citrus
Taste: sweet, malty, spicy, good overall taste
Palate: medium carbonation
Yellow and cloudy. Floral notes , its kind of funky. Easy drink and nice and sweet, banana-like. Uncomplicated!

Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Yeasty bread aroma. Spicy bread yeasty middle with a hint of citrus. A great triple 

---Rated via Beer Buddy

Cloudy, pale dark yellow pour with moderate, lasting foam. Yeasty and fruity in the nose, with spices. Tasting brings out the orange and lemon. The malt is caramel / toffee. Medium body, very smooth texture. Slightly bitter finish.

33cl bottle at home. Appearance: clear pale straw with medium white head. Aroma: malts, grains, apricot, fruits, bread, spices and something "barrel aged" liek aroma. Unfortunately also some metal in the back. Taste: medium sweetness and medium bitterness. Notes of apricot, bread, fruits and spices. Palate: medium bodied, oily / sticky texture and lively carbonation.

Draft Half Pint at White Horse, Parsons Green, London in Aug 2009 - And Bottle - Cloudy Yellowy-Orange in colour. Very Yeasty and Spicy. Fruity; orange and lemon citrus, orange peel. Malty; caramel, toffee. Hoppy; spicy, flowery hops. Very smooth. Moderately bitter spicy fruity throughout. Tangy. Tasty. Very drinkable. Nice beer! (2009-08)
very thick and massive, white foam and it has some particules in it golden, hazy, hay, toast, barnyard, cereal, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, umami, full body, oily feel, lively, bitter,
bottle. slightly sweet taste, floral and slightly fruity. highly carbonated. warming finish is nice.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden with big white head. Aroma is a bit sour with some yeast and Belgian hops. Taste is yeast and fruits. Great.

Bottle that Justin shared- cheers! Cloudy yellow with a thin white heaf and a light fizz. Tastes wheaty and a little powdery with floral notes and foam banana sweets. A pretty standard Belgian brew that is rather lightly-flavoured for the strength.

Aromas of bread, apple, fruit and spice. Pours a cloudy amber with a small white head with notable particulates. Taste of raisin and fruit with a slightly metallic finish. This is very good, complex and interesting.

Btl pours a hazy golden color with an orange hue. Big fluffy white head lingers, leaving strands of lace on glass with each sip. Aromas of ripe fruit, flowers, spice and cookie dough. Tastes of banana,tangerine, pepper,wheat grains, yeast and a hint of alcohol. Medium body, slightly above average carbonation, soft smooth mouthfeel and a spicy, effervescent finish. This is a really nice abbey ale. I like that it does not feel heavy even though its a big beer. The flavors and aromas meld perfectly to create a smooth delicate easy to drink brew. Very refreshing!
Solid tripel but didnt find anything especially noteworthy. Lightly flowerly nose. Good bright yellow color and fluffy white head. Full body but one dimensional boozy flavors.
A very flowery, sweet brew. Another tasty beer from st. Bernardus. A tripple for the summer.
Clear golden in appearance with a white head. Spices, slightly grainy sweet with honey.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.
12 oz bottle from sample pack, pours a light gold with white head not much lacing, quite a bit of sediment flowery aroma with a fruit and spice flavor.

0,33l bottle from Belgiuminabox. Pours yellow colour with a lot of head. Aroma of belgian yeast, citrus, sweetness, banana, fruits, a bit spiceness as well. Medium body, balanced taste, sweet aftertaste.

Etant un grand amateur de la St Bernardus ABT 12 qui reste et restera une de mes bières de chevet, jattaquais la dégustation de cette Tripel avec un certain allant, voir un allant certain. A la versée, blonde troublée avec une mousse à bulles multiples stabilisée sur 3 millimètres. 5/5, lapparence mimporte peu de toute façon, donc cest le même tarif pour tout le monde. Nez sur les agrumes, citron vert et pamplemousse en tête, du caramel bien net, de la prune, de la mirabelle, des fruits jaunes (ananas notamment), du malt chocolat à petite dose, des arômes de cuir et de bois résineux assez perceptibles. Bon nez, pas très complexe, pas non plus quelconque mais un peu trop banal à mon goût. En bouche, texture souple, amertume sur la fin uniquement, la carbonatation est moyenne, lalcool reste sobre. Les saveurs sont vraiment sur les céréales et le caramel, un peu trop dailleurs. Malheureusement, cette Tripel est en cela très limité au niveau gustatif, le final est plat, sans relief. Il manque clairement quelque(s) chose(s) à cette bière pour en faire un breuvage digne dintérêt. Je suis dautant plus surpris par la note générale obtenue par cette bière. Laura de sa grande sur lABT 12 peut être... En attendant, mes attentes étaient assez hautes et elles retombent dautant plus... Dommage. Bouteille 33cl, V&B Grenoble.
Slight initial vinegar washes away with lovely smooth sweeter after taste. Nice head. Very drinkable - doesnt taste like an 8%er.

golden, hazy, long lasting white foam; fruity and yeast aroma, some spicy and floral notes; medium+ bitterness and sweetness, slightly sour; full- body, quite thick feel, lively carbonation, long bittersweet finish

Flasche 0,33l: Golden, klar, sehr kräftiger fester weißer feinporiger Schaum; frische kräftig-malzige Nase, Getreide, Brot, würzige Süße, leichte Säure, leichte Hopfennoten, Zitrusnoten, Karamell, nussig, leichte Röstaromen; im Körper kräftige würzige Süße, kräftig malzig, Getreide, Brot, leicht fruchtige Säure, cremig, kräftige Kohlensäure, angenehme Hopfenaromen, leicht alkoholisch, würzige Bitterkeit; langer würzig-frischer Nachgang
Hazy, deep golden with a big, white, fizzy head. Huge yeasty aroma. Sweet and fruity, with a mildly tart finish. Nice.

cereal, floral, basement aromas, golden, cloudy, minimal head, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, 
Bière avec une odeur très douce, une amertume modérée au goût, assez pétillante quand même même si elle na pas de mousse importante, le goût restant en bouche est plus douce, jaime beaucoup

Hay colour, opaque, weak white head.
Smell is spicy and salty, white pepper, dried peach, apples and pears, leather, subtle alcoholic sourness. Hint of biscuits, coriander and orange.
Taste is fizzy bitter sweet, with a brilliant balance. Warming. Lightly fruity with a lightly bitter refreshing finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

colore oro, schiuma fine e cremosa bianca, buona persistenza. al naso crosta di pane, pera e frutta candita, dolce in bocca, biscotto, pane e un finale leggermente amaro.lalcol si sente pochissimo. la mia preferita tra tutte le tripel. favolosa
Sample glass. Golden beer, small head. Aroma is yeast and fruit. Taste is the same ok beer.
Bottle, Ann Arbor, MI via Mulmur. Opaque yellow beige. Soapy head. Yeast bubblegum aroma. Some banana. Spiced flavor. Some citrus and yeast. Mellow finish.
Pours golden colour with small white head, hazy liquid. Aroma if hay, flowers. Lightly sweet, lightly bitter, some sour notes. Medium body, watery feel, very soft bittet aftertaste.

Pale golden. Fruity and spicy aroma with light noble hops. Full fruity and phenolic flavour, and notes of peach and pepper. Sweetish taste with a dry finish. Full body and high carbonation. Overall, a great tripel. Strong, rich and balanced.

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Light hazy pale golden color with off white head. Malty and hoppy aroma light yeasty too, caramel, bread, fruity, banana, citrus, light spicy. Sweet and light bitter taste like aroma with honey notes. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.
Nice tripel with citric and fruity aromas. Intense flavor and mouthfeel. Nice but it is not one of the top tripel beers
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with huge head off. Aroma of citrus fruits, pepper,banana. Taste is sweet, yeasty, herbs, spicy. Huge carbonation.

Pours a cloudy brownish yellow with a large foamy white head. Strong aroma of bread, yeast, and some spices. Light carbonation and some lacing. Smooth light syrupy texture. Sweet grain taste like wheat and corn. Taste is similar to a Weizenbier. Very light spices. Smooth finish with a pleasant aftertaste. Refreshing and enjoyable.
33cl från Dranken geers i Gent. En klassiker som är precis vad jag förväntar mig. En schyst belgisk trippel.

De un color ámbar pálido, turbia y con bastantes partículas en suspensión. Su espuma es agradable y aguanta bastante bien en copa.

Huele a levadura, flores y fruta. Yo sobre todo aprecio manzana.

En boca es agradable y muy rica y refrescante. Muy bien balanceada, el caramelo y la fruta dulce por un lado y por otro los cítricos rondando todo el rato el paladar. Por cierto, de su 8 % de alcohol ni te enteras.

If I had to describe this is one word it would be smooth, on every level. It pours a hazy gold, with a big fluffy head. The nose is floral and musty, something in the vein of yeast, or dough. The mouthfeel is quite full but the high carbonation cuts that down a bit. The taste is lightly floral, lightly spicy, modestly malty, and mildly sweet with no hop bitterness, a bit of that yeasty nose carrying through, and just a hint of alcohol. There are no bold flavours in this beer but since every element is so subtle it allows a lot of flavours to come through without overloading the palate. A classic tripel!
Tap at 100 piv. Golden clear color, thick white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, oranges, pepper, spice, belgian yeast. Taste is solid malty, citrusy, decent hoppy, spicy. Good

8%ABV. Tripel.

Poured out gold. 6ºSRM.

Nose is sour and wit-like. Can I say witty? There are aromas of raw wheat flour and proofing bread dough. A bit of nice stone dust or cement dust in the nose. Other aromas that could approximate what Im describing might be clay and plaster of paris and soft chalk.

Mouthfeel is light and beery. There is pronounced carbonation. Palate has some nice white bread, white bread toast, sweet dough and wheat flour flavors. Nice noble hop balance. Nice little hit of alcohol right at the end before the hops set in. The hops are noble and taste of old oak or aged hardwood.

Finish is clean and very ethereally sweet and light.

Very good and very close to my favorite abbey tripel of all time, Karmeliet Tripel.

Goes on Favorites List!

Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bottle with fluffy white head that dissipates to leave good lace. Aroma of earthy spice, floral hop notes, and light malty sweetness. Taste follows, clean Belgian esters with light fruity notes and light hop notes. Booze incredibly well hidden, effervescent, full body. Amazing how good these beers can be when you get them in their home country.
Bottle from supermarket in Brussels. Pours orange-gold with some cloudiness and foamy head. Aroma sweet citrus fruits with great peppery edge and some tropical notes. Tastes strongly alcoholic.
Delicious. Sweeter and more fruity than I expected, but not too sticky. Caramel or candied sugar, peach, clove. Maybe age has skewed this bottle towards sweetness. Best by 03 12 17 on bottle.

Acheter à Tabac&co palais des bières dans famiflora à dottignies. 
Bouteille de 33 cl. 
Couleur jaunes orangée trouble.
Au nez , présence de sucre , de fleur ? Cest floral peu être bien du pollen ?
Un nez sucrée je découvrirais en bouche. 
En bouche , en effet présence de sucre en arrière bouche mielleux acacias , un fine amertume en fin de bouche, cest moelleux en bouche le goût est bien reparti.

Appearance: slightly hazy golden, big fluffy head
Aroma: dry, light malt, light citrus
Mouthfeel: light Mouthfeel, high carbonation
Taste: citrus, fruit, spicy, medium bitterness
Overall: (I had this with flu so maybe affecting palate) light, easy drinking, lingering light bitterness

Huge frothy white head, very long lasting, that evolves to rocky.
Hazy light amber colour, sparkling with chains of very small bubbles.
Aroma is dry, with slight sour sensation, fruity (some peach) and spicy.
Taste is dry and spicy, some fruitiness (banana), some caramel. Fruity bitterness finish.
High carbonation.

Bottle. Hazy golden with thin medium white head. Beautiful beer. Very fresh and sour aroma. Taste has a citrus/fruity beginning, and the aftertaste is medium bitter with a hint of alchohol. Fine medium body. Im not af fan of the aftertaste in this beer, too much alchohol.

Style et résumé: Triple de grande qualité. 
Comment: Bouteille de 330ml. A 12 09 17 
Description: Un liquide jaune trouble, peu de mousse. Un nez de fleurs blanches, miel, malt pils avec une touche sucrée. Une bouche intense avec une amertume surprenante en finale. Des saveurs de miel et de fleurs blanches sont bien présentes, 
Note:  7+/10

0,33l bottle. Hazy golden colour with quickly disappearing white head. Aroma: Floral, honey with cheese and basement aromas. Taste: Sweet start with a full sweet mouthfeel. Quite fruity and has an oily texture. Medium body with medium carbonation. Short sour/sweet finish. Good tripel.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2016 Bottle.Hazy gold,almost no head,gushing(20 days to bb).Aroma fruity,malty,honey,hints of pears and peaches,almonds.Taste smooth,thick,sweet.Carbonation low.Bitterness unnoticeable.Aftertaste malty,slightly fruity,a slight,pleasant alcohol warming.A very nice trippel.
Very nice triple. Looks slightly muddy, but its delicious otherwise. Yeasty. Tropical fruits, peaches, vanilla, slight spicy note in the background, banana. Full-bodied.

0.33 bottle. Pours murky brown color with medium, sticky white head. Aroma of yeast, malts, pear. Flavor is medium sweet, light to medium bitter, spicy. Finish is somewhat sour, medium bitter, hoppy and with alcoholic notes. Unclear body with huge particles. Soft carbonation.

Saint Bernardus. Brasserie dont les recettes sont issues des moines trappistes de Westleveren qui, après la seconde guerre mondiale avaient, pour un temps, décidé de céder la commercialisation de leurs bières. Se présente donc devant moi, religieusement, la St Bernardus Triple (8 % Abv). 
De couleur blonde aux reflets dorés, opaque, celle-ci présente un effervescence importante. La mousse dun cm dépaisseur environ lui confère une véritable noblesse. 
Le nez se porte sur les arômes de citrons, de levure et de blé. Demblée, sont présentes, toutes les caractéristiques permettant de faire de cette bière une triple belge de référence.
La dégustation ne fait pas mentir cette impression. Lattaque, délicate, se présente sur des arômes de malt avec des nuances épicées. Vous arrive ensuite en bouche une amertume, fine, sur des notes de citron et coriandre. Lensemble est très soyeux, une subtile harmonie envahissant votre palais. Le final, dune longueur appréciable est très rond. Les arômes de miel et décorce dorange sont alors présents, mais sans lourdeur grâce à lamertume toujours bien présente.
En conclusion, la St Bernardus Tripel est une bière que tout amateur de bière belge devrait avoir dégusté, tout le savoir faire brassicole de ce splendide pays sy retrouvant.

Pours hazy dark amber with a stream of bubbles and a thick white head leaving lacing in the glass. Sweet pear and medicinal aromas. Starts off sweet and fruity and follows up with spicy dry hops fading into a nice dry bite. Little alcohol heat. Medium bodied with high carbonation. Exceptionally balanced and drinkable..

Color ámbar turbio con capa de espuma blanca de menos de dos dedos de grosor. Aroma floral, similar a la Chimay White pero sin tanta potencia. Sabor frutal, donde el caracter proviene de la malta y la levadura, sin mucha presencia de lúpulo. Sinceramente, puedo captar algo de dulzor (muy mínimo), pero no capto amargor ni acidez, como dice la descripción. Gran cerveza, casi para beber en cualquier momento, donde los 8% apenas se notan. Estas triples me están convirtiendo en fan acérrimo.

330ml bottle. Pours hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma of fruits, yeats, spices, malts. Light body with average carbonation. Taste is light sweet, light bitter with some acidity and dry finish. Surprisingly light for a style.

Bel aspect orangé léger très trouble, belle mousse onctueuse et bien blanche. Arômes dagrumes léger (bergamote ?) et un goût de pain frais à lentrée en bouche, certainement dû à la levure. Amertume bien marquée, il nen faut pas plus à mon goût. On est clairement pas sur une bière sucrée. En conclusion une triple très classique mais de grande qualité.

Aroma: gentle esters, some phenolics, fruitiness, some herbal spiciness is also present, dough. Pleasant.
Appearance: pale to slight amber, slight haze, white foam with good retention. 
Taste is similar to aroma, with gentle alcohol warmth and a more prominent herbal spiciness. Slightly sweet, low bitterness, a bit sour.
Palate is light to medium body, slick, fluffy, long, slightly sweet, but refreshing finish.
Overall: pleasant, drinkable and complex.

330 ml bottle.

Hazy golden color with some sediments. Large off-white head and lacing. Some taste of spices.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 26C). Bottle 33 cl - Batch A04. AROMA: moderate spicy aroma with a medium-low orange note. medium-low soft, spicy alcohols. medium grainy-sweet malt background. APPEARANCE: gold color and clear. medium-large white head with good retention and lace formation. TASTE: low peppery notes, with a slight low citric touch (oranges). soft grainy-sweet malt background. medium bitterness with a dry finish. PALATE: medium-light body with medium-high carbonation. effervescent. OVERALL: a very nice belgian tripel, more on the subtle side.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with beige head. Aroma is spicy with coriander and white peppers, a little malt and orange. Taste has light malt, biscuit and spices, coriander and orange peel. Lightly sweet finish and quite lightbodied. Hides alcohol level well.
On tap at Steele And Hops. Pours a golden color with a bit of head. Belgian yeast fruitiness balances the malt.

Goudgeel, witte schuimkraag , veel gist, troebel.
Aroma: fruit, koriander, kruidig, licht zurig aroma en Belgische gist.
Smaak: Kruidig, ietsje zuur...groene appel, Koriander, belgische gist en een grassige / netelige  hopbitter. Iets alcohol warmte.
Redelijke body, aktief en prikkelig mondgevoel, afdronk is iets zuur en kruidig en redelijk lang.
Bottle- pours gold with a white head. Aroma is fruity, spice and yeasty. Taste is sweet up front with a building spicy boozy finish.

Samea, oranssinkeltainen, todella kaunis olut paksulla vaahdolla. Tuoksussa makeaa hedelmäisyyttä ja maltaisuutta. Maku karamellinen ja maltaisen makea, jälkimaku keskipitkä, makeahkon maltainen ja aika lailla mausteinen ja hiivainen. Mausteinen jälkimaku jää pitkäksi aikaa suuhun. Mainio tripel, yksi parhaista.

some fruits, floral, hay, vanilla, appearance is golden/amber, hazy, taste is sweet,
light bitter, salty/sour, good experience

Bouteille 330ml, gracieuseté de SebD lors du CanBIF Spring 2016, Thanks Sébastien! Couleur jaune-orangée trouble, mousse blanche laissant une dentelle éparse. Arôme de levure, malt, amande, alcool. Goût de malt, levure, sucré. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen.

0.33 l bottle from Uba ja Humal, Tallinn. Appearance is golden and cloudy with a big head. Taste has sweetness from alcohol (and maybe residual sugar) combined with hops and spices. Again nicely balanced strong ale from Belgium.

Bottle 33 cl. Bière déjà consommée et moyennement appréciée (pas de "rating"). Ici, col moyen, couleur habituelle mais le nez est superbe avec des relents de fruits : ananas, pêche, banane. En bouche, fraîche et les fruits se confirment ainsi que les notes dépices. Longueur moyenne et intéressante finale où lalcool tient bien ! A re-boire !

From bottle. Pours golden with white head. Floral aroma. Breads, botanical taste, sweet perfume giving way to a slight bitter aftertaste. Alcohol content is apparent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille avec un BB du 12/09/2017. Robe jaunâtre surmonté dun léger col de mousse blanc et moyennement rocailleux. Quelques particules en suspension. Arômes de levures belges, poire, pomme fermentée, un peu de muscade. Le tout sur un fond dorange arrosée de crème fraîche. En bouche, entrée remarquée de levures, poire, clou de girofle et orange. Des saveurs de sucres résiduels, de pain au bananes croûté et de muscade créent un corps bien rond. Texture onctueuse. Très bonne tripel.

From elcervecero. In La Trappe chalice. Playing Tomb Raider 2015. With Pok cheese. Great tripel. Refreshing, well hidden ABV, not too much sugary, with some peach and herbal notes. Perfect carbonation
Pours golden with sweet but clean finish. Unexpected alcohol and very nice ending

Édeskés, komlós illat. Kiöntéskor nagy hab, ami egy perc alatt néhány milliméteresre apad, viszont ez megmarad. Erősen komlós, enyhén kesernyés és csak jelzés értékűen édeskés íz. Utóíze rövid. Egy nagyon pici olajos, tapadós érzés marad utána.

33cl-fles van bij Tabac&Co - Palais des bières te Dottenijs (in Famiflora) U: helder goudblond met weelderige witte schuimkraag G: kruiden, fruitig en een beetje metallisch S: fruitige tripel met een gekruide toets en een mooie nabitterheid. Echt lekker!
Metallic, a little bit hoppy and herbs as aroma. In taste also a bitternes and metallic with herb flavour. A comen bitternes in afterraste. Its nothing like a Westmalle Tripel.
11.2 oz. bottle, purchased in Kansas City. Poured cloudy/hazy golden, foamy off white head. Aroma of bread, malts, fruity and coriander. Taste was less sweet than expected, creamy.

Hazy yellow ochre, thin white head. Mildly sweet, flowery notes, fruits, fresh, belgian yeast, herbs and bit spices. Light body, crisp, lively carbonation, mild sourness, long finish. Nice, fresh, light, spring-like, lively and nuanced.

33 cl bottle served in tulip. Pours hazy orange with a nice head with decent retention, eventually turning into nice lacing. Sweet aroma of spices, fruits and yeast. The taste is balanced, mostly yeast, but also fruits and spices. Pretty nice.-

Everything you can expect from a good Abbey beer. Strong taste, generous but not agressive, very pleasant aftertaste that lasts in mouth for a classic beer overall. Maybe not very original or surprising, but definitely a great choice for any occasion. APPROVED BY TAVERNYS BLACK METAL CREW !
Nez fruité, banane, bois. Bien fait, assez plein. Manque un peu de développement. Bonne biere. Finale plutôt courte. Pas mal fait.
Lovely tripel. Slightly floral, stone fruit, bread... mild bitterness, some alcohol. Sweet and slightly sour.

Pours orange from the bottle. Lots of evident carbonation and swimming sediment. The crown subsides to gentle creamy lacing that lasts for the duration. Aroma is lightly floral with hints of pineapple, but on the whole subdued. Taste is a rich blend of pear, clove and pepper set over a yeasty background. Overall remains quite dry with just a touch of sugar on the tongue after the swill. Full bodied with a gentle alcohol warmth at the finish. Nice aperitif. Would also work well as a sparkling wine substitute for special occassions. Excellent.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2017 330 ml bottle. Pours a dark hazy golden with a white head. Mild aroma of breadish malt and some yeast. Medium to full body with soft to lively carbonation. The taste is moderately sweet with some bitterness in the finish. Aromas of apples and pears and dried fruits.

Piwo metne w kolorze brzoskwiniowym z obfita jasna piana ktora jednak bardz szybko sie redukuje. W aromacie pieprz i inne przyprawy. W smaku slodko i troche drozdzowo. Wysycenie na poziomie srednim z ledwo zaznaczona goryczka. Po ogrzaniu czuc lekkie nuty alkoholowe.

Aroma: sweet, fruity, spicy, dusty.
Taste: sweet fruits with some soicy bitterness.
Very light body.
Flavour: pepper, ripe apricotes.

Good but not too complex.

Cloudy gold, with a thick white head that settles to a nice creamy 5mm head. Yeasty, bready, dried fruit and banana aromas. Taste is creamy, banana bread, slightly spicy, thick and creamy body, no hint of the booze at all. Fantastic.

Butelka 330ml. Gleboki zloty kolor. Piana biala niska szybko sie redukujaca. Wysycenie srednie do duzego. Lekki drozdzowy osad. Aromat drozdzowy o lekkich owocowo bananowych nutach i ziolach w tle. W smaku niezbyt slodkie . Drozdze owoce koleander banany . Swietnie wywazone piwo na urodzinowe szalenstwo....  MarcinG

Kruidige tripel, veel gist en best een stevige tripel voor een Belgische. Relatief weinig zoet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2016 Troebelblond bier met wit schuim. Geur: brooddeeg, gistkarakter, licht hoppig, zweem van zoetig fruit, ietwat banaan. Smaak: licht moutzoetig, mooie bitterheid. Goed in balans. Volmondig. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter. Zoals ik hem nu proefde is hij echt lekker, een voorbeeld tripel!
14-5-2016: 3,3/5 Amberkleurig bier met fijn wit schuim. Geur: moutzoetig, overrijpe banaan, appelmoes, kandij. Smaak: zoetig - bitterig, wat gistkarakter. Goede koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitterig. Goed bier maar net iets te zoete tripel voor mij.

Botella. @Vivalabirra, Oviedo 13/05/2016
Color dorado,sabor levadura, dulce, cuerpo medio.

Deep golden orange with a thin white head. Yeasty. Spicy/peppery leads, followed by mellow fruitiness. Not too sweet. Moderate earthy spicy bitterness through the finish. Balanced. High carbonation. Bigger medium body. Enjoyed on a beautiful day in Belgium.

Aroma of yeast, fruity, banana maybe. Pours a light hazy yellow, with some lingering white head. Taste is banana, yeast, bread, some spice. Sweet, yet with a slightly bitter and dry finish that gives away its true Belgian origin. A smooth effervescent mouthfeel. Delicious.
Have nothing to add to previous comments. One of the best examples of style. Yeasts , spices, fruits and dry , hoppy finish . Delicious beer

Bottle from good spirits wine and beer
 pours a golden colour bit hazy white head
 AROMA is bit of spice bit hoppy
 TASTE is sweet to start then bitter with long dry bitter finish
 ok
Bue 1 an et 5 mois avant DLC. Arôme sur la poire. Petite mousse fine qui tombe. Douce et sucrée dans un premier temps. Puis un peu dacidité et final sur le malt fruité.

75cl at inter festas 2014 and 33cl bottles bb08/2017 (BL1). - Quite the foamer in 75cl, at least vivid in 33cl. Smells like a freshly yeasty apple cake, peppered with flower and orchard blossoms, minimal banana, biscuit - overall fresh and appealing as long as you donot consider the possibility it could all be coriander broth... Nicely dry and unfruity in flavour, focussing on those dry orchard blossoms on crisp oven-dried apple cake. Peppery, grassy flourishes. Lovely tripel in modern, Belgian hop league with Witkap.
High carbonation slightly bitter an alcoholic warming hint of clove very active thin head
as good as Id hoped poured from a fine 750ml bottle the taste is tangy hoppy spicy bitter full of yeasty fruity lingering flavours great find in Rotorua

Nez bien houblonné, fruité et levuré.On va laisser réchauffer, servie trop froide : 8 degrés.

Blonde moyennement trouble, reflets orangés, mousse ultra méga fine, très triple, se dissipant très rapidement, tout petit col persistant, régulier.

Fruits blancs dété, pêches, ananas, bien frais et levuré en bouche, pointe épicé : cannelle, girofle, coriandre.

Assez standard mais parfaite réussite et équilibre rien à dire.Corps qui tiens bien la route et permet à la machine davancer sûrement.

Nickel.

Pours golden and hazy with a big creamy head. Aroma of toffee, yeast and pear. Medium body, creamy feel, lively carbonation. Taste is malty yet well balanced with banana, spices and some licorice. Dry and deliciously bitter finish.

Dourada acobreada, creme denso e branco de média duração. Bem carbonatada com evidente efeito frisante/picante na língua. Dulçor bancando e álcool só aparecendo no final com toques cofimentados. Cerveja aveludada e frutada.

Aromas cítricos de limão e frutas como pêssego, damasco e banana e especiarias.

Garrafa 330ml - Gent, Bélgica (30/03/2016) - atualização da degustação 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Golden unclear with a very short lasting head. Aroma of yeast, pear and some grain. Taste is yeasty, malts and spices. Very good tripel.
Hazy golden, frothy white head. Aroma: grapes and spices. Taste is lightly sweet with a hoppy finish, alcohol well hidden, there is also a strange salty aftertaste. Very well balanced.

330ml bottle, from a Brussels supermarket. Hazy, washed out gold. Thin, lasting, just off white head. Nose has bready malts. Banana. Light toffee. Berry fruit. Stewed apple. Notes of petrol. Taste is toffee sweet. Drys out a little. Decent body, although it thins a little as it goes along. Dryish finish, with some light bitterness.
Bouteille 33 cl. Couleur blonde cuivrée. Légère odeur de banane. Saveurs : banane, boisé, assez homogène. Finale séche qui reste longtemps en bouche. A renouveler.
Balanced triple. Not too sweet, not too bitter. Feels lighter, sightly hoppier than some other tripels.

Bottle from Wittich web shop. A tripel rather on the hoppy side! Less sweet than expected, and actually not so much more powerful as the 6 as it could be. Hints of sourness, but really not as much that it would justify putting it in the commercial deScription. Good, but not outstanding.
Caña tomada en el momento en el kraken 02..03..2016. (r2016). Belga normal, ligeros tonos cítricos. Buena sensación alcohólica. Normal.
Lett tåkete lys brun med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Søtlig lukt, bær og karamell. Middels fylde. Gress og karamell. Lett bitterhet i avslutningen. Lillestrøm ølfestival-Klimt
Mousse blanche, couleur jaune paille. Arôme malts, épices, fruits, Au goût bière sucrée, épices (clou de girofle) fruité, levure et pain. Une belle bière qui tient en longueur. 33 Cl Vanuxeem

Estilo tripel de una espuma densa y cremosa. Rubia, color pálido ambarino, de aromas florales y afrutados y un sabor equilibrado y armonioso entre amargo y dulce, terminando con un discreto amargor seco.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy orange color with white head. Bready, yeasty, spicy, grainy aromas. Yeasty, spicy, bread, slight dusty flavors. Really good tripel!
Hazy golden straw color, frothy white head. Belgian yeast nose, sweet fruity, caramel, light spicy notes. Fruity taste, yeast, caramel, dry finish, well balanced. Medium body, fizzy carbonation.

375 nL bottle poured into a snifter. The aroma is a blend of banana, clove, and vanilla. It pours a brilliant clear gold yellow (with sediment by bottles end) and topped by a white, whipped head with great retention and lace. The taste is a medium high sweet and medium / medium light bitter. The slick texture has a light, airy fizz carbonation with a medium light body flavored up front with banana and other tropical fruits, as well as doughy bread. It finishes with clove, banana, vanilla, and biscuit notes and leaves an aftertaste thats clean with light clove.
Storflaska belgoklubben. Gulaktig vätska med stort vitt skum. Örtig doft med belgojäst och säd. Aromatisk och kryddig smak. Äpplekart, druva och jenka.
Pleasant triple. Bread, fruit, brown sugar. Lively carbonation, smooth, and syrupy.

This is about as good as it gets. Pours a gorgeous golden yellow with a head that last. Aroma of yeast but also dried fruit. So much complexity on the tongue that continues to the finish. Wow. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Triple da manuale piuttosto dolce, diventa più secca nel finale. Lievito presente sia al naso che al palato.

Fles gekregen voor mijn verjaardag, als onderdeel van een St. Bernardus pakketje. Uitgeschonken in originele bokaal. Enigszins troebel goudgeel bier, met een medium hoge luchtige schuimkraag, die inzakt maar wel constant op het bier aanwezig blijft. Wellicht iets te koud ingeschonken door mij. Kruidig, fruitig en licht zurig aroma van: kruidnagel, sinaasappel, banaan, fruitige esters van tropisch fruit, vineus licht zurig aroma van witte wijn. Het smaakpallet volgt de geur, een mooie bittere en vrij droge tripel, uitstekend gebalanceerd met verfijnde Belgische gist. Tonen van banaan, sinaasappel, kruidnagel, snoepgoed en zurige witte wijn notities. De carbonatie is stevig, met een kortstondige kruidige finish. Ook deze tripel is weer van een hoog niveau, eigenlijk zoals alle bieren van St. Bernardus. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
75cl bottle shared with friends. Cloudy light golden colour, white foamy head. Really thick and creamy malty, fruity (peach, banana) and floral yeasts. Firm body, medium carbonation.

33cl bottle in tumbler glass
A: clear golden yellow with thick fluffy white head, perfect
A: sweet, cotton candy, caramel, herbs and light malt
T: medium sweet, light to Med bitter, no sour
P: medium body, creamy thin texture, lively carbonation, mild bitter finish
O: I think probably best triple Ive had

Ciemnozłote, mętne piwo o obfitej pianie, która z czasem redukuje się do małego pierścionka przy brzegu szkła. Aromat jasnych belgijskich owoców, winogrona , brzoskwinie, gruszki. W smaku znowu jasne owoce i lekki kwasek, bardzo pijalne. Goryczka średnia w stronę wysokiej, lekko ziołowa. Ogólnie bardzo udany tripel, wszystko jak najbardziej na miejscu, po prostu pyszny, choć piłem lepsze to i tak ten mocno daje rade.

Bottle 0,33L. Slightly hazy, golden color with average big, creamy, white head. Aroma of plum brandy, alcohol, a touch of spice, herbs and grass. Taste starts light sweet with a note of ripe fruits. Finish goes somewhere between light bitter and light acidic. Suprisingly easy to drink for the beer with 8% ABV.

Golden color with extremely fast rising carbonation and tiny bubbles forming into a well formed white foamy head. Aroma is exquisitely spicy with loads of coriander, also detecting some vanilla aromas. The mouthfeel is very light for the amount of alcohol in this masterpiece. I feel like this is right there with Chimay Blanche, maybe a touch less refined, but it is world class all the same.

Triple belge de base.
Nez plein de levures, fond assez floral.
Bouche assez ronde, assez sucrée (un peu trop). Encore une fois pas mal de levures qui peuvent être éc?urantes avec le sucre. Fond de pêche, assez agréable.

Pours a cloudy yellow that quickly clears up, white head. Aroma of wheat and spices. Medium bodied with slightly fizzy carbonation. Taste is slightly dry and moderately bitter with a sweet finish. Felt suprisingly light for an 8% beer.

Pours slightly hazy golden with finger of white foam. Aromas of bread, apples, banana, and sugar. Flavors follow the nose, with a nice bready sweetness of malt and candi dominating amongst ripened fruit. Sometimes this style goes a little sour for me... not this one. Clean finish with a slightly sweet yeasty finish. Very smooth despite high carbonation. Good stuff
St. Bernardus brews craft beers that are very easy for everyone to like and this is no exception. One of the most overlooked tripels.
Spices, fruits (citrus and banana), amber and frothy, medium sweetness, medium body, average carbonation, the alcohol is magnificently hidden...a good drink.
Cloudy pale amber colour with minimal white head, fresh floral aroma of spring herbs and fruit, lightly gently bitter, lively, light body.
Frothy head. Aroma and taste of sugar cookies, spice, and a bit of vanilla. Delightful.
Droge triple. Licht zoet, ietwat hoppige afdronk. Ik vind hem niet zo goed zoals iedereen hem vindt, maar het is geen slechte triple. Beetje standaard eerlijk gezegd.

Are we drinking the same beer? This was so dull, tasteless, weak. A bit of yeast, a bit of bitterness in the aftertaste and thats it.
It could be me, will have to give it a 2nd chance.
Kremasta piva, malo gorcine, kako silazi niz grlo osjeti se citrus. Ostaje odlican okus u ustima

Cloudy blonde with a couple of fingers of cloudy white head. Nice yeasty nose with hay malts and mild citrus. Similar taste of yeast, hay malts, honey, citrus, mild booze aftertaste. Well done tripel.

Hazy straw color with a fruity full slightly off white head. Aroma is wet yeast, slight fruit. Wonderful flavor. Reminds me a bit of a Belgian white but with an slightly sour hopped finish. Full creamy mouth feel, moderate carbination. Enjoyed this a lot.

Poured from a bottle. Hazy golden color, full frothy head. Medium clove aroma. Medium body with a banana flavor and a medium finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Aroma of clove and banana, pours a hazy caramel color with a lasting white head with good lacing. A delicious Belgian taste of clove and banana and a creamy feel with a Spice and banana finish.
Part of a triple taste test. Aroma had faded a bit but got some spice. Had a big head on pour. Clear straw color. Probably the sweetest and didnt taste a ton of complexity. Thickish body.

Bottle. Pours a hazy dark orange with a mostly lasting foamy off white head. Aroma of honey, caramel, bread, spices. Taste is of honey, bread, brown sugar, grassy, citrus, spice. Foamy mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Bottle 33 cl, pours a unclear golden colour with a white head, Sweet aroma of fruits and malts, Sweet taste, Slightly sour aftertaste

Very good! It has a thick mouthfeel...something I dont think Ive ever experienced a brew not classified as a stout. It pours a bit cloudy and I imagine that trait is from the floating (yeast?) Nice sweetness and no bitter...again as with the thick feel it is not a light beer it is a bit heavy in a good way.

Spicy, yeasty, sour, floral complex aroma. Nice yella tripel with healthy foam. Fruity hops first, lots of carbonation, just slight bit of booziness. Sweet malts then really drying finish. Good tripel, but not my personal favorite.

Degustata in bottiglia da 75 centilitri. Schiuma persistente, ottimo aspetto ottimo allolfatto (miele), gusto deciso da riprovare. Finisce subito meglio farne unampia scorta. Molto carbonata , leggermente amara e metallica sul finale.

Amarillo profundo con opacidad sin espuma ni adherencia. Lúpulo especiado moderado alto, malta maltoso moderado, isovalérico (queso), licoroso ligero, ésteres a frutos secos, albaricoque, melaza. En boca lúpulo especiado moderado alto, malta maltoso moderado, tibieza alcohólica presente,, lúpulo de amargor moderado. Final en balance malta-lúpulo especiado, cuerpo bajo, carbonatación media-baja.
Wonderful balance. Straw, barn, pepper and spice on the nose. Doughy, ready, with dried apricot and pineapple fruit on the palate. Slightly sour finish is extremely long.
Sweet fruit and malt aroma. Nice carbonation. Malty flavor with some fruit, yeast and hops in the middle. Slightly bitter finish. Very nice.

33 cl bottle, fairly young. Hazy golden blonde color. Dense, rocky white head. Aromas: sweet malts, sweet fruit. Retronasal its sweet, candy sugar, fruity, light herbs. Flavor is moderate sweet, malty/grain, light herbal. Medium bodied. Finishes lightly herbal bitter. OK triple.

Dorada, con una capa de espuma blanca de burbuja pequeña y poca retención.
En nariz floral, con algo de levadura, cereal y especias.
De cuerpo ligero.
En boca dulce y frutal. Cálida pero sin presencia del alcohol. Suave y equilibrada. Final ligeramente seco. Muy buena!
Aroma slightly corny. Remembrance of farmhouse. Would go well with a lime slice :p. Dry finish with a light citric bitterness. Creamier than the brewerys abbey dubble.

On tap at na 7.schode, Zilina. Pours is cloudy golden with big white head. Aroma is malty, grassy, straw, lemon, floral. Taste is light to moderate sweet, hint of bittery, citrusy acidic and fresh, lemon mouthfeel. Medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation, well hidden alcohol. Well ballanced.

bready and fruity with some spice and bitter. some chalk for balance and some honey sweetness. some cloud in pale yellow with golden glint. touch of banana and full flavor in the froth that is cream in color. the body is a bit light with some slick. thank you son.

On tap @Mad for Beer (Rome). Pours deep golden/light amber, a bit unclear, with a medium and persistent off-white head. Aroma of esters, banana, peach, brown sugar, caramel, raisins, alcol. Flavour is very sweet with a light bitter end, rich and persistent. Full body, medium carbonation. Solid as usual.
Light brown color. Fresh start and body. A bit more complicated after taste. Very nice to "multe" ice.
Clear orange pour with a white head. Bitter and herbal with Belgian yeast taste. Decent and drinkable.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2016 330ml bottle. Hazy pale amber colour with a huge frothy white head, it collapses but leaves a lasting small creamy head throughout the drink. Quite heavy carbonation in the first few minutes. Spicy herby floral aroma with yeast and sweet fruits. Flavour is fruity (apple or pear? a little sour), spicy, sweet, malty. Hint of alcohol.

Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Pale gold and hazy with a creamy white head of thick consistency that perseveres through the last sip. Aroma of malt, yeast, apple, and pear. Tastes of banana, grains, malt, bread, sour apple. Delightful amalgamation of sweetness and bitterness. Rich texture. A first-rate tripel.

Aroma: light, slightly fruity, yeasty; Appearance: straw, cloudy with lots of carbonation; Taste: sweet with fruity tones, slightly bitter; refreshing; not too yeasty; Palate: full body with sticky texture; lively carbonation; lightly bitter finish; Overall: a delicious tripel; would definitely buy again.

330ml bottle. Slightly hazy golden body, big white head with average retention. Aroma of yeast, herbs, honey, peppercorn, pears and apples. Taste of honey, sugar, grains, herbs, yeast, apples in alcohol. A tad too sweet for my taste, but very nice.
Lekkere smaakrijke tripel, fris, moutig en gistrijk. Mag zich voegen tot mijn favorieten in de stijl! Backlog from 2015/02/08.

Merci à Ju-Lo pour le partage! Je ne suis pas très type bière dabbaye, mais je dois admettre que celle-ci ma vraiment plu! Le seul hic est la présence dune myriade de particules en suspension dans mon verre. Outre cet aspect plus ou moins dérangeant, des arômes fruités et floraux attribuables aux houblons belges offrent une performance aromatique des plus agréables et délicats. Le liquide offre une belle densité et nest pas trop chargé en sucre, chose que je reproche souvent aux Belges. Je ne retrouve pas non plus la classique levure gomme balloune Belge. Beaucoup de fruits et de jeunes fleurs dans un liquide qui se boit très aisément.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

0.75 pullo, BBE 07-2015. Vaaleankultainen väri, iso hutera belgivaahto. Ensinuuhkaisu hyvin hiivaisa raaan siman tuoksu, Vaahdon hiipuessa tulee voimakkaampi runkoisa aromi, pienellä makeudella. Suutuntuma kirpeän kuohuva, samettinen, alkoholia lievästi, kuivahko, hapokas, jälkimakuna makeutta ja alkoholia. Kohtalaisen hyvä balanssi mutta rungoltaan jää parhaille.

This was poured into a chalice. 
The appearance was a hazy to cloudy burnt pale orange color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about a half a minute. Lacing is messy with light foamy strings.
The smell had a sweet pear with the "iced aples" I normally get with most tripels. Light "cake-like" quality runs nicely. Light Belgian spices end up coming out slightly as it warms. 
The taste was mainly sweet through the malts and then slides into a sweet tropical fruity flavor. Dry sweet fruity aftertaste leads into the finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a fairly decent sessionability about it. Carbonation seemed to be good and low. Dryness hits my tongue decently. 
Overall, I wonder if Ive had too many Americanized versions of tripels that now when I go to have a real Belgian one that I get thrown off a bit. Dont get me wrong this was a really nice Tripel Im just not sure why I got that "cake-like" aspect in the smell. Still, Id have again.

Backlog. Bottle share with JMD at HNB 20.04.13. Unclear golden. Fine and persistent white head. . Aroma of banana and weissbier. Refreshing taste of weissbier and tropical fruits. Medium long aftertaste. Round and fone mouthfeel, appropriately carbonated. High drinkability, with no alcohol in taste.

From 33cl bottle, poured into trappist glass

Aroma: bread, herbs, floral, dough, earthy, bubblegum, vanilla, 

Appearance: golden, hazy, white foam, frothy, yeast floaties

Taste: medium sweetness, lightly bitter, 

Palate: light to medium body, creamy texture, average carbonation

Overall: Very spicy aroma with lots of distinct Belgiany like aromas. Lots of yeast floaties in the beer after the pour, which gives it a yeasty taste and hazy appearance. Overall, not a bad Tripel and one of the ones that is the standard bearer for most tripels.

33cl bottle as part of a tasting pack. 8% alc.vol. Pours a deep golden colour with a lasting small white head Grapefruit and pears on the nose. Taste is well balanced with a hint of grapefruit, bananas, belgian yeast and ends with pleasantly hoppy finish. Not as dry and bitter as some of the other Belgian tripels (Westmalle, Chimay, or even Duvel) This is definitely a top 3 tripel for me. Recommended.

Bottle. Opaque caramel color with off-white head and substantial lacing. Lemon-lime citrus aroma with coriander notes. Citrus upfront followed by some fruity bitterness and coriander notes with a hint of anise. Long finish. Fine effervescence. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Cloudy golden color with thick white head. Aroma has malt, yeast, spices and fruits. Taste is quite sweet with somewhat sour and bitter aftertaste. Flavors of malt, citrus, yeast, spices and other fruits. Good aftertaste and tasty one. Quite big carbonation.
Sourdough; spicy with a scent similar to the fallen oak leaves in my yard. Not overly bitter but misplaced in this beer. A good Tripel but not in my top ten.
Pours a hazy straw from a bottle with a thick white head with little lacing. Fruity yeast aroma and flavor with some barnyard-y hay, sour/sweet flavor (not too sour). Very well-balanced. Good beer.
Aroma agradável, aparência bege e turva. Sabor balanceado, um pouco tanto frisante e paladar agradável com pequeno amargor em seu final.

Bottle at PaterMarcus. Pours a hazy golden-orange colour, thin white head disappears quickly.
Aroma of citrus, herbs, some tangerine, and maybe a bit of caramel. Taste is bitter and fruity, with medium carbonation. A very well balanced, hoppy beer, an enjoyable drink.

0,33 l bottle. Unclear orange in the glass, big white head but not gushing. Belgian yeast and malt on the nose. Taste is grain, malt in combination with belgian yeast. Fruity. Smooth and complex, not too heavy. Some dry sweetness. Very nice!

Gashing after opening the bottle. Huge head, big bubbled. Light gold color of beer.
Good dose of bananas in aroma, hints of yeast and cheese.
Medium sweetness, low bitterness.
Very high carbonation, but its quite smooth. Light to medium body.
Bottle from Tuckers Maltings. Golden colour with a white head. Yeasty and fruity hop aroma. Taste light sweet. Very easy to drink.

Dunkelbraun, leicht rötlich schimmernd mit weißem Schaum. Tolle süße Malzaromen, die leicht röstig und rauchig sind: getrocknete Früchte, dunkle Schokolade, Brot, Sirup. 
Ein stimmiges, gehaltvolles Bier. Empfehlung!

Bottle. It poured a cloudy pale gold color with a thin white head. The aroma is floral and spices. It has hints of citrus, clove and some banana on the back end. The mouth feel has a tingling sensation. Very well balanced.

Bottle shared with Biv at Primos Deli. Poured into beer mug LOL. Oh well. Golden yellow with some haze and big puffy head. Aroma is sweet fruits, cereal, spices, and candy. Taste is fruity with lemon drops, apples, pears. Big yeast and cereal grains on the backend. You get that typical Belgian yeast flavor on the finish as well. Slight white peppery also. Big carb, medium to light body.
Friendly triple. Golden blond. Taste of orange, citrus, soft bitters, which combine well with the sweets. Very plesant to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 22, 2016 Bottle. 26.08.16.
19 srm. Suspended yeast, mildly off white head, great retention. Dark orange with a ruby red hue. Dominant esters of sugary sweet fruit (strawberries, raspberries, kiwi). Lots of yeast, some hint of herbal, rain forest. Honey flowers. Think velcro syrup (heavy malt, a level up than umami). More on the sweet side, could mistake for saison. As it warms up, more of pear, green apples, and black pepper spice. Velcro on the back end on, too much maltiness for me, like mine with higher attenuation. 
----10/02/15

01/21/2015
 26.08.16.
Yeast in suspension, flakely like particles near bottom heavy. Gusher, foamed over upon pour. 
Honey melon orangish color, with a yellow hue, murky, flakes floating. Silky white head, explosive at first, calms to a thin lace. 
Strong yeast aroma, pears, green apples. Floral. Prominent fruity esters. 
Effervescent, distinct melanoidin type mouthfeel. Moderately high in dryness, still has some residual sweetness.

Bottle. Pours in hazy pale yellow body with high white frosty head. Aroma is yeasty yet with a certain fruitiness, mostly a gentle citrus, light floral background with herbs like ending. Taste has high malty sweetness with light citrus bitterness, yeasty after taste. Body is full, high carbonation, soft.

Foam is rough and very durable. The delicate scent of a little clove and citrus and orange. Its a strong case of 8%, but the mouth feeling is surprisingly easy. The flavor of orange zest and slightly bitter citrus fills all the taste buds with good impressions. But in addition to acid and bitterness it forms a little sugar reminiscent of candy, not the over sweet and sickening way, but more in a way that maintains the malty sweetness as this triple also. Soft and subtle hops tones spreading towards the end and with its moderate carbonation spreads there is a sense of well-being throughout the oral cavity. The finish is medium dry.

Bottle 330 ml. Yellow amber color with good white foam. Aroma: malt, pears and other fruits, noble hops, spicy yeast and wheat bread. Taste: sweet, white dry sherry, pear, bitter hops and alcohol in the finish.

La brasserie Saint Bernardus nous propose avec cette bière une référence parmi les fameuses triples belges. Dans le cas de ces bières, le terme triple est utilisé pour décrire une méthode de brassage ou l’on utilise trois fois plus de malt qu’à l’accoutumé pour obtenir le même volume final. Sur le plan gustatif, le résultat peut être exceptionnel. La couleur, blonde dorée, est relativement classique pour ce type de bière. Toutefois, le nez révèle une certaine finesse. Épices et très légères touches de fruits se mêlent avec l’alcool, lui aussi légèrement perceptible. La bouche présente une attaque malté, mais très vite équilibrée par l’impression d’ester fruité. La finesse des bulles, l’équilibre parfait rendent cette bière facile à boire et à la portée de tout le monde. Idéal à la fois pour les connaisseurs et pour s’initier au monde des bières belges triples.

A fresh sour smell, after which the fruity taste comes forth. A real pleaser with its balance between the golden fruity ale and the creamy yeasty taste. Nothing is extraordinary except the balance it strikes. Very well.

---Rated via Beer Buddy (iOs)

75 cl. Semi hazy hayish yellow, solid white fluffy head, dissipates slowly leaving plenty of lacings. Warm aroma of bread, citrus, malt, fruity esters, yeast. Taste is citrusy and malty, bubble gum, fairly big body with yeast notes, slight alcohol in the finish, more warmth in character than boozy. Very nice balance. Creamy texture, big body, medium carbo. This brewery doesnt disappoint.

Teku. Bottle. Light amber, clear with medium, white head. Poor lacing, average head retention. Nice fruit, ester aroma with great yeasty and spicey notes. Mild caramel aromas. Taste is rather semi is rather semi-sweet from malts. Medium body, above average carbonation, creamy/oily texture, finish is dry. In general very balanced (esters vs malts) triple, highly drinkable, with slightly alcohol warming in the end.
Cobrizo turbio y espuma blanca compacta. Aromas intensos de uva y ciruela blanca, azúcar blanco. Cuerpo denso, sabor dulce y afrutado, ligera acidez de fruta verde y final seco.

33cl bottle at home. pours a hazy golden beer with a thick white head. malty aroma with floral, citrus, caramel. tastes is pretty much similar to the aroma, very nice how balanced it is between sweetness and the bitterness.

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a hazy gold with a medium-sized off-white head that lasts throughout. Wonderful fruit esters on the nose: banana, muscat, currant and orange with some cinnamon and clove notes as well. Taste is quite similar with a nice bready character along with lots of fruit. Good carbonation with a slight creamy mouthfeel. Hides the 8% ABV immaculately. Nice sweet finish. Classic tripel.

Di colore oro carico, velato; forma un cappello di schiuma bianca, fine e cremosa, dalla discreta persistenza. Naso non molto pronunciato ma con una bella pulizia che permette di coglierne tutte le sfaccettature: crosta di pane, banana, pera, frutta candita (pesca, cedro), qualche sentore floreale ed una bella speziatura del lievito, un po di coriandolo ed una spiccata nota piccante che solletica le narici. Ottima la sensazione palatale: corpo medio, con un riuscitissimo equilibrio tra vivacità (bollicine) e morbidezza. Dolce in bocca di biscotto, pane e frutta sciroppata (pesca ed albicocca) ma ad equilibrare cè un profilo abbastanza secco che non la rende mai stucchevole, ed un finale leggermente amaro erbaceo. Lalcool è assolutamente non pervenuto. Pulita, godibile e molto ben fatta, più complessa al naso che al palato.

Pours wheat like golden haze colour, with stable creamy white head.
Aroma without note of an alcohol, with notes of wheat, grape, banana, caramel, cinnamon.
Flavor: taste is similar, without note of an alcohol, notes of wheat, with fruity esters (banana, grape, hints of oranges), cinnamon, etc.
Very well ballanced malt sweetness and hop bitterness.
Body is soft, carbonation also.
One of the best tripel beers.
Pale amber pour. Sizable off white head. Lacing galore. Sweet malt aroma with hints of burnt sugar. Taste is a sweet sugary mess.

Sweet and sour? Am I in a Chinese restaurant? Deliciously frothy, fruity (mostly raisins), bready and a hint of dry and sour on the finish. High alcohol content nicely hidden (am I sweating?). Poured from a bottle.
Keg at Cafe rose red. Pours hazy pale orange, nose is floral, toffee, light citrus, taste is similar, caramel.

Pours hazy orange with a beautiful lasting, thick white head. Great lacing. Malty aroma with some clear yeasty hints. Some ripe fruits as well and also a slight spicy touch. Nice and complex. World class. Taste is smooth and perfectly balanced between sweet, roasty and bitter. Beautiful honeyish hints, nice yeasty kick, clear caramels/sugars, lingering ripe fruits and a spicy kick. Midly dryish in the aftertaste, but the fruity sweetness never fades away. Full bodied, great creamy texture and a fitting, not too lively carbonation. Wonderful balance accompanied with great complexity. Marvellous piece of beer-art and definitely a fantastic tripel.

Bottle. Pours a huge glass of foam. No, seriously, I had to wait a good five minutes to get beer out of this. When it finally calms down, we have a lovely hazy gold with the most creamy, fine-grained, even white head Ive ever seen -- this is whipped cream here, I can get soft peaks out of it with a finger. Theres so much head it mutes the nose, but what there is is lemon, toast, yeast, and phenols. Rich and sweet on the tongue; theres some sourness and breadiness to balance it, and its a nicely restrained, delicate, elegant tripel, almost perfect in how well it hangs together. Finish is long, warm, and slightly sweet. A magnificent example of the style.
Aroma is malt, spice, fruit, yeast, caramel and orange. Appearance is orange with an off-white head. Taste is sweet and mild bitter.

St. Bernardus Tripel is a lightly hazy medium golden pour with a big head of off white bubbles. Nose is yeasty with some banana notes. Taste is slightly tart with some bread like qualities and a hint of wine. The body is really lush. a very nice Belgian.
750 ml bottle. Banana yeast nice yellow ish pour. For whatever reason, never rated, but my wife bought two bottles.
Bottle at Delirium Tremens in Brussels. Pale amber colour with medium head.Sweet malt and spices.Nice beer , balanced
Orange pour white frothy head. Slightly tart, slightly sweet great palate. Some yeast and banana in a minor way. Really great fruity aromas and fruity finish of apricot and light peach.
Bottle from belgoklubben. Fruity and spicey notes in both taste and aroma. High carbonation. Pretty good

tasting @ fillepolo 150808. Bottle (750 ml) from Belgolådan. Yeasty and fruity with spicy and light estery notes, sweet, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is dry and yeasty with spicy notes.

750 ml. Lightly hazy golden amber body has a humongous meringue of foam that settles to a spongy disc after a couple of minutes. Nose is beeswax, spicy honey, papaya and evergreen resin. Tastes of beeswax, resin, honey, mango, toast and white wine. Medium body has a nice dry bias despite the big malts. Medium-high carbonation is appropriate to carry the brew, though it seems just a bit boozy for only 8%.
Heerlijke trippel fruitig met bittere afdronk prima zomerbier, mooie kleur en op 4 graden drinken serveren.
Wat een gigantisch lekkere en frisse triple. Lichte citroensmaak en neigt zelfs wat naar blond bier. Mooie schuimkraag en een gouden, troebele kleur.

UPDATED: NOV 9, 2016

Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wheat, banana, Belgian yeast, bread, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Turbid golden beer with a slight/medium white head. 

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wheat, banana and Belgian yeast; ends slightly bitter and dry with bread, hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. That Belgian yeast is present, but definitely does not dominate. The beer could have been thicker, but that is the only aspect with a flaw.
Bottle. Clean, golden in colour with big white head. Aroma of peach, grapes, yeast, spices. In taste low sweet, spicy with peach and grape notes. Very dry and hoppy finish. Great tripel.
Bottle at Ölrepubliken bar and restaurant in Gothenburg. A near-perfect Abbey tripel, well balanced in both taste and aroma. Goes with anything!

Cloudy golden, Tall head of mid-sized bubbles quickly becoming a thick film on beer surface. The aroma is composed by corny sweetness, yeasty spiciness, banana, floral notes. Medium body. Oily texture. The flavour is relatively dry with notes of corn, spice, grassy light smooth bitterness. Delicious. Perfect balance. Hoppy finish & aftertaste. Its a classic, what else can I say?

Bottle.
Yellow, hazy, white head.
Fruity aroma, some notes of honey, banana.
Taste some bitterness, sweetness, alcoholic, banana and some notes of vanilla
Balanced feeling

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Pours hazy orange and with fine yeast sediments floating around, has a lasting off-white head. Classic belgian yeast spiced aroma. Flavour holds a classic belgian spiced yeast flavour and with mild caramel malt base

Gros nez de triple au sucre bien présent mais également bien balancé. Les épices et la cassonade sont de la partie. Une imposante mousse demeure très vivante tout au long de lexpérience. En bouche, cest étonnement mince, je mattendais à quelque chose de plus costaud! Ça se boit très bien mais ne présente rien de bien palpitant.
Bottle. No detailed notes, entering some big dogs Ive missed from earlier tastings. Nicely balanced tripel with a bit more flower than fruit in the aroma and taste.

Botella. Color rubio muy pálido y turbio.
Aroma complejo. Floral y especiado. Clavo.
En boca resulta también muy floral en el que aprecio también regaliz.
Un conjunto de sabores brutal.
Bastante compleja, y seguro que con nuevas catas, encontraré distintos matices. Eso sí... deja un regustillo final.... Ummm...

750 ml bottle recently purchased. Side by side comparison with Kasteel Blonde 11%. Amber like color in a golden murky liquid. Aroma is lots of fruits, peach, pear, biscuit malts. 
The sweet malt is balanced well with spicy notes. Traces of citrus and perfume notes, shows light hop bitterness as well. Much more complex then I would have guessed. At 8% no alcohol is noticeable in the flavor. St. Bernardus wins this taste test hands down. I wish I would have picked up a Tripel Karmeliet to go along with these two. But I already rate that so... No.

Great brew.. One of the first I tried in craft beer world, time went, but its still great. Awesome maltiness, one of the most distinct yeastiness, spices, lovely fruitiness. Moderate sweetness, quite high bitterness for triple. 
Nice, well balanced brew.

Bottle @ deTolly, Tartu. Pours golden with medium nice white head.Aroma is sweet, malty, grainy, yeasty, caramel, candy. Taste is nicely sweet, slight caramel, malty, some spicyness,. Well hidden alcohol. Good beer.

The beer has a golden color with a bit of amber and the head is white and voluminous. Strong floral scent from the hops. In the taste, these floral notes are accompagnied with a caramel-like sweetness. A well-balanced and very tasty Tripel.
The description does not lie, the balance between the sweet and bitter is amazing, I could drink liters of this beer and never get fed up.

Bottle from The Counter in Palo Alto, CA. Aroma is slight apple juice, fruited breads, lemon shortbreads, orange blossoms. Taste is crisp...spring / summer flowers with apples, stone fruit and the expected chalky wheat / cloves of a Belgian but not overwhelming. Great summer beer with tons of depth. Very close to the Chimay White for me.
Flaska från Belgoklubben. Dimmigt gul med vitt skum. Skumbanan och örter i doften. Lätt kryddig smak med en del jäst.

Giallo arancio molto torbida e con sottile schiuma frizzantina. Ottimo aroma floreale. Fantastica al palato, dolce, amaro accennato, fruttata, carbonazione media perfetta. Molto lievito sospeso. Alcool ben presente. Eccellente.
Aroma complejo a caramelo, algo de plátano, pera y especias. Excelente en boca con gran cuerpo y mezcla de matices en un tono donde predomina el dulce y las especias, con algo de plátano.
Hazy golden beer, white head. Nose is hops, belgian yeast, spice, malt. Hoppy, citric flavor with spice notes, caramel. Finishes with hops and booze, some sweet caramel notes. Pretty nice balance.
Put this bottle down during a Belgian tasting. Tripel flavors abound here with the fruit and burn.
Bottle, 330 ml from MBR, Zagreb. Cloudy yellow, white head. Fruity aroma. Malty, fruity, spicy and yeasty. Nothing to write home about.
Not a well balanced tripel. High alcohol content downs any of the other flavour. Little aroma, mild caramel notes. Medium carbonation.

33cl bottle, been in the cellar a while. Pours a hazy, dark amber color with a huge white head and a ton of lacing. Aroma is fruity, raisin, maybe some ginger, light clove. Medium on the palate with big, soft carbonation. Flavor is sweet, malty, nutty, spicy, clove, ginger, some grassy bitter hops, with a light, sweet finish. Very nice.

33cl Pours clear when allowed to settle for couple of days. When poured clear or with yeast - completely different aroma and taste. When settled: more like a very good BSA. When with a dash of yeast - a combination of sour and tripel. Malty, gently hoppy. Easy drinking but with a nice rough touch. Medium carbonated. A good beer even when served at room temperature.

Pours a hazy orange with a good white head. Aroma is floral, clove, banana, creamy, yeast. Taste is clove and banana with lemon citrus worked in nicely. Extremely balanced and drinkable tripel, right on point for the style.

nice aroma of fruit looks good golden orange and nice foam 
clouded taste fruit low bitterness making it very drinkable a very good tripel

75cl Bottle from belgoklubben.
hazy, golden, white foam, clove, alcohol, banana, earthy, herbs, intense aroma,
medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

330ml bottle, poured into La Chouffe tulip. A: Palest shade of amber, hazy, initial large head morphed into a lid of film. S: Fruity, yeast, phenol, slight citrus. T: Phenol, sharp ripe fruits, tangerine, wheaty. Fairly sweet for a Tripel. M: Smooth, reasonably crisp without a great deal of carbonation, minimal coarse edge from the booze. O: A nice Tripel, lower in alcohol and bitterness than others, there is no such thing as a session Tripel, but two or three wouldnt get you in trouble.

Color dorado ocre, algo turbia. Mucha espuma al principio que va perdiendo hasta dejar una fina película que permanece hasta el final. Aroma complejo a caramelo, algo de plátano, pera y especias. Excelente en boca con gran cuerpo y mezcla de matices en un tono donde predomina el dulce y las especias, con algo de plátano. Las Bernardus no fallan.gran triple.

Bought this 330ml bottle from Bangkok, Thailand and took it back to Hong Kong in my suitcase. It has a best before date of 7th August 2016 and was poured into a Chimay goblet. The beer poured a hazy murky dark gold colour with one finger creamy white head that has great retention but leaves a nice set of stringy lacing. Mainly floral and citrus lemon and lime aromas along with some bready buscuit malt. Taste is sweet fruity pear and some caramelised banana, maybe even banana bread. The bready malts come through and the finish is slightly bitter and peppery. Medium bodied, medium to high carbonation and somewhat dry. Overall, this is a pretty good tripel but not my favourite. I still prefer the La Trappe and Westmalle versions more as this was less fruity overall.
the aroma is malty with some shades of caramel, honey and dry fruits... the taste is malty and fruity with notes of wine, toffee, yeast and some spicy herbs... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...
Cor âmbar claro. Espuma boa, cremosa e de média persistência. Aroma floral e fermento. No paladar cereal, herbal e condimentos. Encorpada. Retrogosto agradável e levemente amargo. Sensacional!!!
