Bottiglia da 0,33. Birra estremamente corposa quasi cremosa. Colore opaco con schiuma abbondante e persistente. Bassa carbonatura. Linizio dolciastro lascia spazio ad un lieve e piacevole gusto amarognolo. Aroma delicato con sentori di campo. Consiglio 9/10
Bottle. Yeast aroma. Beautiful lemon yellow color, cloudy, white firm head. Very nice.
Bottle to glass. Spicy and floral. Hazy yellow-gold with massive retained white head. Biscuit, flowers and chewy yeast.
Прекрас& запах и вкус карамел&
Golden, but a bit cloudy. Sour taste, also a bit flour-like, therefore a thick taste.

L:
-pours a hazy light-golden with a medium,foamy,quickly dissipating,white head
-medium carbonation visible
S:
-lemons,lime,banana,spices (Coriander),grassy,floral
T:
-Follows the nose completely
F:
-(Belgium-typical)high carbonation,medium-full body
-alcohol very well hidden
O:
One of the best Tripel in the world

The beer pours a soft white foam. The beer has a yellow/amber appearance. The beer is very cloudy, maybe I havent poured it right, and the yeast has came loos from the bottom. The smell is heavenly. It has a floral hint and a somehow savory appearance. The taste has the same floral notes. Really great palate. Little creamy, soo great.

Piana średnio pęcherzykowa, biała, sycząca, szybko opada do centymetrowej warstewki, barwa ciemno złota, mętna, piwo ładnie bąbelkuje. Aromat typowo triplowy, belgijski, z przyjemnymi brzoskwiniami, landrynkami, kwiatami i ziołami, delikatnym siankiem oraz szarlotką. Bardzo orzeźwiający i przyjemny. W smaku analogicznie, odczuwalna słodycz winogronowo-ananasowa, szczątkowa kwaskowość pomarańczy, troszkę kolendry, czerwonego pieprzu i rozgrzewającego alkoholu. Kontra chmielowa delikatna, bardziej likierowo-szampanowa z dość wysokim perlistym nagazowaniem. W afterteasie poza kwiatami pozostaje chwilę białe wino półsłodkie... 
Stylowy, smaczny i udany tripel, leżący bardziej po stronie słodkiej niż wytrawnej. Nie ma tu może czegoś szczególnego, wyróżniającego na tle konkurencji, ale śmiało mogę polecić jako bardzo pijalne, mocne piwo. Klasyka.

Foam: white frothy, short lasting.
Colour: hazy, opaque, dark wheat yellow. 
Aroma: malt, yeast, a little sour, fruity, banana. 
Taste: sweet, malt, hints of tangerine, apricots, pretty mild dry tart finish, bread, dough, banana, hops, high carbonated, medium body, good, refreshing triple.
Really dry after the first sip....expected a way better beer....good but not great...ok...(#482)

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours straw yellow with a big white head. Smell of banana, belgian yeast esters, clove, grassy hops, light malts, floral hops. Medium sweet, honey, grass, alot of light malts, hints of alcohol. Moderate bitter, grassy finish. A very fine tripel

Hazy golden colour, good head, some laceand sediments. Floral aroma, with some spices and fruits, coriander, cloves, dough, sugar. Medium to full body, sticky and oily palate. Taste is sweet, with cloves and coriander too, some toffee, candy, with a good alcoholic finish.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2016 Greenish yellow, hazy. Light to medium body, flat mouthfeel, low carbonation and alcohol heat, weak flavor, thin texture,long but bland finish. Low bitterness, off dry, low acidity, not well balanced. Disappointing, didnt help that I had after a big Imperial IPA. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle from punka in Tallinn ( 3.00). Pale, hazy amber colour, mmmmassive off-white head with rather good retention. Nose: lemon biscuits, Belgian yeast, malts. Taste: refreshing malts and Belgian yeast, white bread and dough, clove, hay, alcoholic warmth. Faint bitterness. Would say its around 8% only in the finish. Carbonation modest, body medium. I may not be a Tripel fan but I remember having much better ones. Bernardus Prior 8 was similarily rather well made and in some way enjoyable, but damn dull and simple. Good for purists maybe.
Une triple fabuleuse, très douce, qui se laisse boire sans aucun soucis, notes de candi, robe blonde , corp léger finale courte

Dorata pallida, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, bella schiuma bianca non molto persistente.
Aroma di coriandolo, banana matura e albicocca.
Al palato si ripresentano le caratteristiche olfattive seguite da una buona nota amaricante erbacea, a chiudere nota maltata ed alcolica.
Ben carbonata, corpo medio.

Pours bright blonde with a long white head. Nose is typical tripel and bursting with fruit, coriander, and alcohol. Flavor is complex and really pushes a sweet breadiness to the front, though the hops and bitter peels do some out decently on the backside to counterbalance. Finish is long and dry but a bit sticky. Good stuff.

Poured from a 330 ml bottle into a pint glass.
Aroma- Had a floral and hop aroma
Appearance- A murky golden yellow with a lot of sediment floating inside. Had a fairly large white head
Taste- Has a nice fruit flavor mixed in with the hops. very good.
Palate- A medium bodied heavily carbonated brew. Has a nice creamy texture.
Overall- An outstanding beer, I look forward to my next one.
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2015 Blonde with an average frothy head. Candi sugar, spices, yeast, lemon. Medium to high swwtness with a drier and light bittter finish. Average carbonation, medium body, oily.
Sampled from a bomber at the Big Texas Beer Fest. Poured a slightly hazy light yellow with a white head. Sweet taste of coriander, clove and Belgian yeast. High fizzy carbonation, thin-medium bodied.
Bottle @ Ölrepubliken, Gothenburg 11/4-15. Yeasty and fruity with spices (for example, clove). Body is medium, the finish is dry with spicy notes.

0.33l bottle. Hazy golden color with rocky head. Aroma is fruits, yeast and spices, mostly coriander and pepper. Taste is sweet, spicy, fruity with medium bitter finish and slight alcohol notes. Fruity and spicy aftertaste. Full body and soft to average carbonation. Overall its great and complex beer.

Appearance: cloudy yellow. Lasting white head.
Aroma: fruit, ether.
Taste. Yeast, belgian Wang, late bitterness.

Feel. Pasty, bubbly.

Not a fan.

From a 330ml bottle on 2/4/2015. Pours a cloudy light golden with a biggish white head. Has a light spicy, fruity aroma with a dash of Belgian yeast. Take a sip and its sweet, fruity, a touch spicy, with bready malt and more Belgian yeast. Has modest bitterness at the back and drinks much easier than 8%. Full bodied with lively carbonation. Decent but quite straight forward. Having now sampled what is considered their best gear, I cannot for the life of me work out why this brewery is so very highly regarded.

NOTA DE CATA:
- Aspecto: Es una cerveza rubia, color pálido ambarino. 
- Aroma: Aromas florales y afrutados. 
- Cuerpo/sabor: Sabor equilibrado y armonioso entre amargo y dulce, terminando con un discreto amargor seco.

3/30/15 (Bottle) - Hazy golden pour, slight white head, some carbonation. Lemon, yeast and malt among the pleasant aromas. Very crisp clean feel, nice lemon, malt, citrus and banana flavors. Very smooth, and Im glad I selected this Tripel. Cheers!
Pours a hazy yellow color. Aroma and taste are spices, large amounts of malts, and some citrus.

ASPETTO: biondo abbastanza torbido. Schiuma bianca, fine abbondante e persistente. AROMA: speziato di lievito e fruttato i due aromi maggiormente presenti. GUSTO: tanta frutta gialla, senza mai diventare molto dolce. Anzi, la birra è abbastanza equilibrata e delicata, rendendo la bevuta semplice e godibile. Retrogusto abboccato abbastanza persistente.
9.8.2014. Clear golden colour, thick coarse head. Aroma has lemon, banana, spices. Taste is sweet, spicy, zesty, banana, yeast. Also some sourness. Very smooth body.

(Flasche) Es hat eine getreidig gelbe Farbe, ist trüb, mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist etwas schwerer, fast ein bisschen Alkoholisch, hefig, samtig, mit einem Hauch von Pampelmuse. Der Geschmack ist samtig, hefig und etwas spelzig. Dazu kommt eine Note von Rosinen. Abgang ist sehr angenehm, wie das gesamte Trinkerlebnis.

Sadly not my favourite St. Bernie offering, still a decent brew though. An otherwise clear pale blonde is filled with yeasty particulates. There isnt much of a fortitude from the aroma here, just some nice clover honey, cereal and light floral business. The taste is quite mellow as well but I find a not entirely unwelcome sting from the alcoholic content. Some subtle vinous quality is also noticeable. Fairly fizzy and with a medium chew, this Tripel is definitely worth a tipple.
UPDATED: OCT 21, 2015 Dark orange in colour with an apple aroma.  Refreshing beer but I am re - rating this lower because a second bottle wasnt that enjoyable for a St. Bernardus.

Bottle @ Koht, Tallinn.
Golden color. Fruity aroma with light citric notes. Medium carbonation. Bitter finish.
bottle pour, slight banana peppery citrus, hazy golden with delicious particulates, light citrus taste

Bottle pour. Cloudy pale golden with a large white head. Aroma is spices, malts, banana, pepper, and light citrus. Full thick body. Light sweet and slight bitter taste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a nice hazy orange with a good stable head. Aroma is fruity and spicy with some citrus, banana and apricot. Flavor is nice and well carbonated with fruity flavors of apricot, banana and spice with a nice phenolic, bitter finish. Lingers for a long time.
(bottle) hazy pale yellow colour with a medium tall, white head; aroma of lilies; slightly oily palate; balanced, intense flavour with a long, light bitter finish

0.33 bottle. Cloudy, gold color and a medium, thick, white head - nice retention but no lacing whatsoever. Aroma of malts, bananas, citruses, and some spices. Sweet taste once again bearing semblance to bananas, spices, and light malts. Medium body, slick texture, and lively carbonation - the beer also has an unwelcome propensity to foam in ones mouth. Overall a nice brew, has some flaws which could easily be corrected but otherwise pleasant.
Great fruitiness and easy drinkablity. Seemed a bit too carbonated, but was still well crafted. A great tripel

12oz bottle from a sample pack. Pours cloudy orange with an ample head that leaves plenty of lacing. Aroma is fruits and spice. The taste starts more on the fruity side but as it warms in the glass the spice notes really come out. The ABV is masked nicely, Really nice tripel.

Pours a clear golden / orange with a thick, foamy white head...great lacing and retention. Aroma has some candied fruits as well as mild spice and faint leather. Flavor follows suit but steps up the spice and leathery notes...earthy hoppiness and a bit of citrusy rind...definitely a candy sugar sweetness. Mouthfeel is medium and very lively/silky with a dry earthy/bitter/boozy finish.

Colore giallo paglierino, leggermente torbida. Schiuma molto abbondante e finissima.
Odore speziato, fruttato, leggermente pungente.
Dolciastra con finale secco, rotonda e non eccessivamente carbonata.

UPDATED: JUL 2, 2015 Drinking this out of a Spencer Abbey goblet. Got a surprising overflow of foam on opening. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a lot of initial head which dissipates into a thin layer. Yeasty, complex, full of flavor and very well balanced, this is a superior Tripel. Wow! Whenever Ive got a few dollars to spare, this will be one of my go-to ales.

On tap in Cafe Botteltje, Oostende. Light, easy to drink,. Abbey ale, brewed in the classic triple style. Slightly hazy, golden, medium white head. Aroma some sweetness, honey, banana, light spices. Taste malty with some pilsen sweetness (but beer is not swett), some citrus, very smooth. One of the best tripels I ever had.

Gold hazy body with plenty of sediment floating around. Pillow white head at least two fingers worth and stays for a long time.Tangy tart bitter taste. Lemon and bread too.Peppery on the tongue. Creamy feel in the finish.

Golden color with medium white head. Smell is elegant, bananas, dough. Taste is bananas, dough, spices, with a peppery finish. Carbonation is high. A really really good Tripel with some interesting properties which remind me of an intense Weizenbock.
Bottle. Pours clear glolden with moderate head. Aroma of caramel, cereal and dough. Taste is more of the same with sweat finish. Awesome.

330ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden hue with a giant head of fine off-white bubbles. Tart apple notes, yeasty white bread, mild honey, light damp cement, and apple juice on the nose. Medium sweetness with more wet concrete, black pepper, mild cinnamon, a light graphite note, light golden syrup, and a little bit of a spicy alcohol burn that leads into mild sultana raisin, mineral notes, clove, some prominent spice on the tongue, and lots of mineral notes with some clove that lingers in the finish. Excellent.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Butelka, warka do 19.11.16. Bardzo ladna, wysoka, biala piana, brudzaca szklo, opadajaca dosc powoli. Piwo samo w miodowym kolorze, metne, wyglad nieco psuje taka szarosc koloru. Aromaty typowo triplowe - owcowosc a la brzoskwinie, banany, troszke tostowosci, oczywiscie drozdze, tez slodowosc, przyprawowosc (w tym niestety tez kolendra, ale delikatna). W smaku kolendra juz mocniejsza. slodkawe choc z dosc wytrawnym finiszem (jest i goryczka w posmakach), jest tez kwaskowatosc. Ewidentnie dobre piwo.alkohol ladnie schowany, niewyczuwalny, mimo, ze pije mlode .Wysokie acz nieprzeszkadzajaco wysycenie. srednio pelne w ustach.Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Bottle was a present. Aroma is koryander, yeast, some citrus, dusty. Alcoholic, malty, citrus, more yeast. Decent tripel.
Pours hazy light-brown with big white head. Earthy and a bit citric aroma, tastes sour and bitter, light sweet with hints of caramel, alcohol is well inserted. Medium body and lively carbonation.

UPDATED: JAN 31, 2016 Golden opaque with a white one-finger head that lingers. Thick lacing.
bananas and other citrus elements.
Yeasty, sweet, banana bread, malty. Plenty of citrus notes and fruity esters. Fantastic. Medium with thick, full and chewy carbonation.
On tap at Biercab. Yellow-orange colour with white head. Malt, honey, fruity and yeast aaroma. Sweet, malt, honey, fruity, yeast, spices taste. Medium to full body.
Malty aroma with scent of tart fruit. Clear gold colour. Flavour of raisin, toffee, honey, and strawberry medium body with a high carbonation. Quite an enjoyable beer.

yellow/ golden beer. almost clear, big white head dont last for long.
Nice sweet fruity aroma. Some bananas. Some spicy notes too.
In taste beer is lightly sweet, dry.
Beer seems to be light, wity lively carbonation, very drinkable. Alcohol is warming up but really well hidden.
Overall: pretty good beer. Altough aroma is better than taste.
Bottle. Sweet slightly spicy aroma. Sweet taste with a dry boozy finish. Tasty tripel.

UPDATED: MAR 20, 2016 Pours a medium yellow with tiny black grains and a thin white head that leaves white lacing.Nose is bananas. Taste is bananas with slight bitterness. It is full bodied. 11.2 oz bottle with best by date 8/27/15 from a variety pack.

Fulländad arom på fruktigt söt malt och mjuka jästtoner. 
Brygden är disigt gulorange och skummet är tätt, med bra volym och lång halveringstid.
Trippelsmakerna sitter som ett smäck med en jästig källarklang på en elegant avslipad maltbotten. Mycket bra.
Kolsyremängd i överkant.
Lätt oljig i den direkta eftersmaken och en något för klen efterbeska i den längre.

330ml bottle from LCBO. Pours cloudy apricot colour with white head. Nose is fruity (plums, apples, pears) and funky Belgian yeast. Taste is more fruity and yeasty esters. Herbal, spicy bitter finish. Really nice triple.

Pours a hazy yellow with a very foamy white head. Aroma is sweet Belgian yeast and fruit. Flavor is the same, with a lot of honey that adds a nice body feel and finish. Simple, yet excellently made. Delicious.
Poured a hazy gold with crazy active carbonation and a 1.5 finger white foamy head. Strong bread and yeast flavours. Nice lacing. Overall pretty good.

330ml bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Big and foamy white head. Hazy pale orange body. Aroma is sweet and malty. Some yeast as well. Sugar. Some herby hop aroma as well. Mostly sweet on the tongue with a light tangling bitterness. Nice, creamy mouthfeel.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy straw yellow producing a very large white fluffy head. Aroma is fruty and floral with hints of banana esters and pale malts. Taste is sweet upfront, has alot of fruity yeasty notes and a dry and semi-bitter finish. Creamy texture and quite lively carbonation. A style-defining beer from St. Bernardus.
Flaske fra vinmonopolet. Gylden, disig farge. Moderat karbonert. Stor hvit skumtopp. Smaker gjær, krydder og frukt. En svært fornøyelig tripel

Bottle 33cl from Vinmonopolet. Yellow orange, misty, nice foamy. Fruity and yeasty nose . Carbonized,sweet with some bitterness in the aftertaste. Slightly alcoholic aroma. Good belgian abbey beer. Weekness : Slightly to bitter/alcoholic and lacking some body. Will I consider bying it again. Yes.

Bottle 33cl from Delhaize, @ home. Blond color, quite clear, nice dense white foam. Aroma of honey, banana, belgian yeast. Taste is first sweet with some bitterness in the aftertaste. A vert good belgian tripel.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Bottiglia 33cl comprata da giangaspero e bevuta a casa.
Chiara con schiuma stupenda.
Frutta gialla e finale amaro, buona

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhold
Hazy gold pour, frothy white meringue head. Nose is spice and fruity yeast. Bittersweet. Middle runs to creamy malt, coriander and hint tarragon. Finish is dry and nicely bitter.

Robe blonde, dorée. Nez puissant sur des notes de houblon, de pomme, dépices. Bouche à lattaque ample, une très belle mousse crémeuse, de la fraîcheur, de lamertume et une longue finale épicée. Une très belle triple, typée

Keg at Sedona Charlottesville. Currently the 2nd most rated beer I havent personally rated. Pours a slightly hazy straw color with a thin creamy white head. Decent head retention. Aroma of candi sugar, bready and doughy malt, clove, cinnamon, dry pineapple and stone fruit. The taste is bready malt, spice, pineapple, stone fruits, citrus. Medium bodied, low carbonation, dry.

Poured a fairly clear, but slightly hazy pale yellow/amber with a large foamy white head. Floral aromas, Belgian yeast, and a certain spice I cant name. Has a medium body with a fizzy carbonation. There is a nice pleasant warming sensation from the alcohol as soon as you take a sip. Starts sweet but develops a nice spicy bitterness. I really enjoyed this beer, lives up to the St. Bernardus name.
330 mL bottle. Gold blonde pour with a tall fluffy white head. Aroma is a bit spice, fruit. Similar taste, some yeast.

Golden with big white head. Nice lacing. Aroma is banana, noble hops, Belgian spice and some orange. Fruity palate. Aftertaste is dry, thick, spicy, alcohol and some sweet banana. Overall: Very nice. Easy to drink.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2015 Served in a trappist glass. Golden with a big persistent white head. Aroma is yeast, fruity (mango, peaches, oranges, bananas), caramel, biscuit and some herbal and floral notes. Taste is also fruity (apples and pears), bread, biscuit, honey, yeast and some light alcohol and earthy bitterness. Light bittersweet aftertaste. Awesome beer!
Bottle from Del Haize, Evere, Brussels. Light, easy to drink,. Abbey ale, brewed in the classic triple style.
11.2 FL OZ ($4.59) very good triple, this is the standard for triples. finest beer that you can find just about anywhere that has a decent beer selection.

Pours a hazy golden color, topped with a nice frothy white head. Lots of bubbles. Auite yeasty aroma, some soury notes in there too. A bit nose-irritating aroma. Taste is sweet, slight fruity notes. Not too strong. Apart from the aroma, not that bad.

Small bottle from Bierzwerg.de. Sparkling, misty, golden body with a medium sized, dense off-white. Pungent and pleasant spicy triple yeast notes, band aid, rock sugar on the nose. Full bodied and alco warm. Spicy and medium bitter.
Nice golden pour, citrus tones and tons of bitterness. One of my favorite Tripels.
Pours a clear golden. Aroma is complex, citrusy. Taste is malty, with citrus.

Great beer, probably my favorite tripel. Complete in taste, beautiful color and aroma. Alcohol is also not too strong andbis masked well making it very drinkable. My bottle had noticeable big yeast chunks, so maybe a bit old. Despite this, still a great taste
Large bottle from whole foods. High carbonation. Alcohol on the nose. Some spice and Orange. Very pale. Tastes a bit like a lager. Some pine and spice flavor with little aftertaste. Pretty good

Poured into St Bernardus tulip glass a slightly hazy Amber with white head and lace. Highly carbonated. Aroma is Belgium yeast and malty. Comes off as floral, sweet, some banana and honey. Taste is banana, clove, carmel, a bit peppery and bittering in the finish. Light syrupy mouthfeel. A joy.

Amber slightly blurred. By pouring into the cup formed a beautiful white foam, good height and duration.

Its aroma is fruity and floral fewer and brings certain condiments and soft sweetness of the banana caramel type.

On tasting brings me a sense of honey, citrus, a touch of pear fowl, as well as malt and hops, which complete the nice set of this beer. In its a soft sweetness has a delicate balance with its average bitterness.

We can say that p its bitterness is well marked, above average for the style, and pepper the end of the tasting. The mouth seems to be thirsty for more beer. Minty would be the correct adjective.

We can say that this cerevja enchanted by all.

Medium and slightly warm body in the throat, this sense denoting the first sips. The carbonation is medium to high.

In my view is a balanced set for excellent, very tasty honoring the brewery and the style that suits me. One of the 5 most style.

12/19/14. Draft at the thirsty monk. Slightly spicy and floral nose. Weak head ( not tapped right?). Nice complex mouth with bitter hops nicely balanced against the Belgian yeast and caramel malts. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy, golden pour with a frothy head. Mild aroma of hops, fruit and something floral. Taste is similar, with a complex but mild mix of citrus, perhaps peach, a little hops, and just enough caramel malt to balance it. I was afraid this would blast my taste buds with too much of everything, especially yeast and spice, but it is very, very well executed.
330ml bottle at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, Belgian yeast, spice and bread. Sweet finish.

330ml bottle poured into chalice. Great light sweet fruity aroma. Pours a great hazy Amber yellow gold with a frothy off white head that stays around with great lacing. Tastes very smooth with some fruity notes a slight sourness that is pleasant and just the perfect amount of bitterness at the finish.
Nose is floral, honey, pear. Flavor is same plus some clove, overripe pineapple, red apple, butterscotch, mild herbaceous quality.
Bottle. Pour is gold, aroma is sweet fruity. Taste is sweet, apricot, fruity, malty balanced, finish is sweet with gentle bitterness. Very nice

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Cloudy medium amber with a very long-lasting 1/2" white head, full lace cover. Aroma of malt and floral hops. Taste is sweet and sour malt that moves cleanly through the palate to a floral hopped swallow. Then things get interesting: as the hops fade, more and more lightly spiced sweet toffee blooms for a very satisfying finish. An exceptional brew.
bottle. Hazy gold colour and huge lively head. Fruity malts, pear, honey, light spices. Well-hidden alcohol. Very nice.

Bottle from a St. Bernardus sample pack. Very active as soon as I opened it, pours Amber/ gold with a massive white fluffy head, sheets of cascading lace. Nose is A-typical for the style, sweet, spice, Nobel hops. Tastes light, sweet, the bitterness is light, but the hops stay with you.

330ml bottle. Golden yellow with a foamy white head. Slight haze. Flavors are cereals, wheat, yeast, honey, caramel, apricot, pear and citrus with herbal and spicy notes. Alcohol is well hidden. Medium body, lively carbonation, creamy texture.

Pours into the glass in a blaze of thunder & foam. Forgot I had this in the fridge. This is a delicious brew. Complex & enjoyable. Im getting a hit of spice on the front end, with a rush candy & dried fruit through the middle & a finish that is a washout of brisk carbonation. Awesome.
Draft 0.15l at St.Bernardus stand at Horeca Expo Ghent Belgium 2014.Pour it hazy yellow color with small white head.Taste and aroma of citrus, peach, orange peels,grass, Belgian yeast.Good balanced.
UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Great triple, very crisp, flowery and citrus nose and taste. One of my favourites abbey beer. Simple and classic, yet effective.
Hazy and golden with a thick head. Great atom of honey and spice. Sweet and fruity with a sour and slightly hoppy aftertaste. Excellent tripel

Nice honey sweet nose, hint of belgian spices and alcohol. Golden yellow, not too hazy, long lasting huge foamy head. Tastes beautiful, honey notes come through in the taste as well upfront, finishes spicy and decently leafy hoppy with some more of the belgian yeast. Alcohol well hidden. Well balanced and comforting to drink. Medium bodied and highly carbonated. Excellent tripel.

Licht troebel gouden bier met mooie schuimkraag.
Neus vol met fruitige aromas. 
Mondgevoel is zoet met zurige toets.
Lekkere tripel!

750 ml bottle into signature chalice, best before 11/21/2015. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep golden amber color with a 1-2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation. Aromas of big lemon, orange zest, peach, pineapple, apricot, pear, apple, light banana, honey, candi sugar, bread, pepper, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Incredible aromas with awesome complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast and moderate pale malt sweetness; with great strength. Taste of big lemon, orange zest, peach, pineapple, apricot, pear, apple, light banana, pepper, honey, candi sugar, bread, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness. Fair amount of earthy yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, orange zest, peach, pineapple, apricot, pear, apple, light banana, pepper, honey, candi sugar, bread, floral, grass, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity of fruity/earthy yeast and moderate pale malt sweetness; with a great malt/yeast balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium bodied; with a very smooth, crisp, and slightly slick/bready mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with minimal warming present after the finish. Overall this is an incredible tripel style! All around amazing complexity and balance of fruity/earthy yeast and moderate pale malt sweetness; and very smooth and crisp to sip on for the ABV. An extremely delicious offering.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 Cloudy yellow to orange color, huge white head. Aroma is yeast, some banana, spices. Pleasant medium sweet taste. Medium to full body, soft carbonation, creamy. Sweet finish. Very nice. (Vrutak 0,33l bottle)

Pale golden, typical triple head.
Fresh, floral nose.
Spices, honey yeast,, nice beer, more subtle than a Chimay or a Westmalle for example.

Bottle from the lcbo. 
Clear golden pour, with a huge white head. Big aroma of tropical fruit and a very forward aroma of yeast. A very bready tripel, with alot of cereals also. A very well done balanced example of the style.

Has a decent head, among an amber, golden glowing, cloudy color.

Floral hops at the beginning, together with clove, pear and a biscuity maltiness, spiced with nutmeg. The most outstanding thing to the nose is the intense, floral, illustrating hop note among slightly funky Belgian yeast. 

The same thing applies to the taste, floral, grassy notes define the first impression. The processed hops arent particularly bitter, but they do confirm the spices of the brew outstandingly well, adding a lot more character to the beer, than the usual Tripel would allow. Spiciness has a semi-dry note to it, while peppers, cinnamon, ripe banana, pear and apple, as well as burned caramel shine through. Includes also an earthy, herbal coordinate, close to a Saison, which gets detectable during the slightly bitter finish, accompanied by soft, slightly slick yeast.

Hazy golden body with a huge, creamy, white head that never gets smaller than a finger-thick pillow of dense foam. My chalice is covered in beautiful draperies when the beer is gone. The aroma is strong and spicy, I actually get lots of cinnamon and nutmeg, quite unusual for the style. Also citrus and banana. How fun! The spicy notes of the strong flavour are more coriander-like, I get lots of Belgian yeast, banana, alcohol and pale malts. The long-lasting finish has notes of honey and flowers. The taste is moderate sweet and moderate bitter. Mid-bodied and dry with a lively carbonation. An unusually interesting tripel, Ill certainly buy this again! 
[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 2 years before BB date, from Vinmonopolet Vika, Oslo]

Bottle. Amber Body with white not very long lasting head. Aroma is ripe fruits with hints of yeast. Taste is fruity and yeasty with some hints of sourness. Aftertaste is sweet balanced by some bitterness and some alcahol.

330 mL bottle. Pours golden nectar with a frothy cap of white head. Sweet honeyed peach on the nose, doughy with clove and allspice, chewing gum and cream, woodsy. Balance is on the sweeter side of the style, with just a hint of bitterness. Full bodied and full textured with high carbonation. Stellar, a superlative tripel.
Bevuta alla spina. Un bicchiere tira laltro. Di colore ambrato pallido, con un buon bouquet di fiori e frutta, armoniosa nellequilibrio tra dolcezza dei malti e amarezza dei luppoli, molto beverina
Good triple beer, I was impressed by the apoarence. A lot of bubbles which make this beer very particular.

33cl bottle. Lively pour. Pure white creamy head springs forth. Aroma of fruit skins, bready malts and cream cakes. Champagne-like carbonation. Dark gold and hazy once fully poured. Big fat creamy head. Flavour has lots of sweet biscuit. Lots of zip, then a creamy linger, and a very delicate bitterness, as the label says!
Bottle from Congress, Longton. Pours amber with large white head. Well carbonated and a yeasty well balanced triple. Very good.
Fruity and yeasty with a pleasant mouthfeel and lots of grass. Good mixture between tart and sweet and little to no trace of alcohol.

Aroma: belgian yeast, sweet fruits, spices, malts and little bit of pepper. Taste: sweet malts, fruits (apricot, pear) and specific belgian yeast flavour. Nice alcohol and spicy aftertaste. Gold colour, big white head, good lacing and high carbonation. Price [Warsaw, Poland] 14PLN (bottle)
Pours cloudy amber. Apricot, yeast, malt, fig aroma with a hint of bubblegum. Fruity taste of the same with citrus notes. Warmth of alcohol but not harsh.

Citrus aroma, taste is citrus and hop bitterness. Very smooth and flavorful. Great Tripel!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a pale gold big rocky head, smells fruity with pears and pepper. Taste has sweet honey like malt more pear like esters and some spicy alcohol flavors. Light body high carbonation.
Bottle. Pours full yellow coloured beer with nice white head. It kicks in with sweet taste, transforms in a light sour and tipps off with a bitter. Good triple. Great branda

huge fizzy head over a golden transparent body. Theres a belgian yeast aroma thats reminiscint of the st bernardus wit. Orange zest and sugar aromas. There is a nice carbonation which really compliments and fits the style. The hops really come through on the finish, the entire tasting starts sweet and ends more dry and bitter.

Served from 0,33 bottle; Smell of hops and herbs, light smell of malt and hay. Relatively long lasting and full white head. Slightly cloudy and light orange coloured beer. Palate: It has a full mouthtaste of first of all a moderate malt sweetness followed by a slightly sour and bitter hoppy finish with long lasting dryness.
Overall a very delicious Tripel.

In short: sweet and strong beer.
Aroma: Malt and cereal.
Taste: light sweet that goes to light sour.
Palate: Thick and liquory, with a bitter (¿yeast?) finish.

Fľaa. Zlatá farba, biela pena, padla rýchlejie ako som čakal. Vôňa peničná, korenistá, jemne bylinková. V chuti jemne kvasnice, troku peničných tónov a v pozadí korenistost. Plnie telo, vyia nasýtenosť. Celkovo skvelé pivo.

Old rating rerated 22.10.2014, 0,33l bottle shared with a colleague @ hotel room in Ulsteinvik:
Big slightly fizzy mediumlasting head. Aroma is mild fruity, flowers, yeast, hay, sugar, banana, citrus peel, leafs, sugar bread. Taste is slightly sweet grassy, sugar, weeds, grass, flowers, yeast, hay, bark, old leafs, paper, light malts, dried fruits. Medium bitterness, slightly dry and harsh mouthfeel. Nice enough.
Een volle, ronde smaak, die zich onderscheidt van de meeste tripels. Hierdoor heeft het een eigen karakter.
