0,33 bottle from Vrutak. Pours hazy pale orange color with medium white head. High carbonaton. Aroma of yeast, fruity, a bit bready. Bitterish with hints of sour. Good, but not my kind.

Bottle @ Home. Clear straw yellow, medium white head that last, good lacing. Aroma, malty, yeast, fruity, caramel, grass. Similar taste. Dry mouth feel. High carbonation. Warming alcohol. Nice bitterness. Aftertaste of malt, yeast, bitter hops, grass.
Bottle @ Delirium. Hazy light amber pour with a generous head. Yeast, estery, some herbal notes and toasted grains.

Bottle from Cotteridge wines. Golden beer with medium head and patchy lacing. Aroma of yeast, citrus and bready malts. Taste is citrus, bready, spice, cloves, a little banana and yeast. Fizzy on the tongue. Excellent beer, one I have I wanted to try for a few years now.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle from Wallington Beer Fest 2014. It pours lightly hazy gold with a thick white heads. The nose is soft, doughy, toasty grain, cereal, boiled sweets and mild spice. The taste is bitter, toasty, cereal, bread, spice, warming alcohol, grain, stone fruits and boiled sweets with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. Thankfully not too sweet. Balance works quite nicely. Top echelon tripel.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2014 The tripel in this series, if I am not mistaken this was the first beer with which they deviated from the Westvleteren staple, which they are historically allied with, as we all know. Medium thick, off-white, irregular head, opening after a while; colour a deep ochre blonde, slightly hazy at first, cloudy with deposit. Estery and malty aroma with hints of icing sugar, mango, brown bread, pepper, apricot jelly, cloves, bananas, apple sauce, calvados, raw potatoes, cinnamon, coriander, marzipan, freshly grated ginger, sweet white grapes, butterscotch, earth, dough. Taste begins with a pleasant fruitiness, citrus freshness but in a subtle way, quite strong and minerally carbonation, smooth but full, mellow mouthfeel, sweetish bready malts, yeasty, a bit starch-like with a dry, medium long finish bearing herbal and somewhat peppery hop bitterness along with the lasting yeastiness and booze, in the form of warming, agreeable, gin-like alcohol. Now heres a good tripel: sweeter, more gentle and more bready than mother Westmalle, but on a par with this great archetype of the style, with a very good balance between sweet and dry. That being said, I dont expect anything less from this trappist-related brewery. One of the top ten tripels from Belgium for me.

33 cl bottle at home. Aroma is yeasty, bready and slight resin. Pours a nice golden colour with some haze (my bad pouring) and a large white head. Taste is sweet with some balancing bitterness. Rich mouthfeel and a dry bitter finish. Overall, very good. A great brewery and a terrific example of a tripel.

33cl bottle at home. Pale orange with a medium white soapy head with medium retention. Medium to full body with moderate carbonation. Well balanced bitter and sweet tones. Citrus, hay, grain, herbs, some floral tones and bread. A nice tripel.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml bottle poured in a chalice.
A: Pours a yellow to orange bit hazy color with a huge foamy aired white to yellow head. Good retention. Many lacings left
S: Sweet, grainy and bready. A lot of Belgian yeasts in the nose. Fruity esters (cherry and pears, mainly). Hints of spice and orange zest. A bit citrus
T: Follows the nose. Grainy, bready and fruity. Hints of spice, orange zest and nuts. Sweet upfront but, in overall, a dry taste. Belgian yeasts and a citrus bitter end
M: Creamy and molasses body. Medium carbonation. Peppery sensation in the end. Citrus bitterness is a must
O: High drinkability. Great beer. Excellent St. Bernardus specimen
[ BA Review @ 10/31/2010 ]
Clear, blond liquid with red shine. Large head. Strong, rich aroma with hops. Full body, average carbonation. Taste is bitter and sweet.

Hazy golden color with rich and fluffy white head. Aroma is quite floral, spicy, with coriander and clove, fruity and citric, with green apple peel. Taste is is the same line as the aroma, very fruity, floral and spicy.

Dark pilsner brown (that is, quite light). Smells seductively vinous, hints of aged cheese. The vinosity returns to a high degree in the intricate taste landscape, together with some caramelly notes and a typical belgian tripel feeling.
Goudgeel van kleur met fraaie schuimkraag. Geur van mout, gist, abrikoos, banaan. Zoetzuur van smaak met tonen van mout, gist, alcohol, wat zoetbittere nasmaak. Lekkere tripel.

Golden yellow with thick white lingering head. Aroma of yeast banana grass green fruits Fruity slightly spicy taste some pear apple and hint of cloves some breadiness from the yeast. Hides the alcohol well. Medium carbonation. A good tripel.
"solid interpretation of a belgian tripel and probably my favorite of the bernardus line. floral, some yeasty spice in the flavor and aroma and a hint of bitterness. nice."

Pours a hazy golden body with a medium head. Nice yeasty aroma. Nice malty taste with tones of yeast.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Couleur jaune trouble, bonne mousse blanche crèmeuse. Nez fruité, levures, bananes, épices. Gout fruité, bananes douces, levures, corps bien cremeux, notes de malté sucre candy, figues, fruits noirs.Un top!

Pour is slightly yellow-orange with thin head. Nose is Belgian yeast with cloves and banana. A bit of sweetness. Taste is spicy with banana. Esthers and some light hop bitterness. Some citrus notes too. High carbonation. Great Abbey Ale!

Fátyolos színe édes malátás, s egyszerre fanyar, citrusos illatokat rejt. Vibráló ízeit a gabonásan telt malátás alapokon kiteljesedő élesztős, citromfüves, pikánsan alkoholos és határozottan kesernyés szálak hímzik ki. Egyfajta középmérték a tripelek világában, legalábbis számomra, amennyiben a szimplán tökéletes és a szerényen izgalmas tengelyek alkotta koordináta-rendszerben szemlélődünk.
Bottle. Hazy deep golden color with a medium thick foamy off-white head. Aroma of apple, yeast, apricot and grain. Smooth sour and medium bitter taste. Medium body.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Botella de 33 cl, en Cerveceria Internacional. Color ambar. Sabor a levadura, dulce, afrutado, ligeramente a alcohol.
Great tripel. Nice opague yellow with lively carbonation. Subtle flavor that is remarkably fresh for a tripel. Flavor of yeast and white wine. Recommended!

12oz bottle. Pours a hazy golden orange with thin but nice looking white head. Notes of pear, apricot, orange and pepper. Slightly boozy but that does not detract. Overall another great offering from St Bernardus.

UPDATED: JAN 12, 2015 Nose is yeast, grass, straw, peaches, pear drops, herbal notes, slight sweet vanilla. Taste is herbal, pear, peach yeast, a fleeting initial sour leading to bread, soft sweet tropical tones before moving to a darker, stickier more alcohol heavy note in the finish. 

Mouthfeel is good.

Outstanding, beautifully balanced beer.

Bottle purchased at Haskells consumed in Moeder Lambic glass. Hazy light orange. Persistent head. Spicy, bready aroma bringing to mind some of the better Belgian tripels Ive tried. Taste has some citrus characteristics, evenly ever so slightly sour. Cloying tendency towards the end. Honestly would appreciate a little more sweetness but thats being pretty nitpicky. Even though its probably not the first St. Bernardus I would order, I would still love the shake the hand of the monk who crafted this delightful tripel.

Big bottle from Haskells. Beautiful hazy light orange with nice white head. Smells sweet and sour with some yeast funk trailing. Nice aroma. Slightly tangy. Can taste alcohol slightly but more of the clean sweetness and pungent light sourness. Very slight bread but more on the aroma. Finishes with yeast, but then a last slightly sour tang hits. Great balance though, and really good long lasting bite. The monks come through again.

Bottle @ Home 
caramel, cereal, barnyard, basement aromas, alcohol, orange, cloudy, frothy, white foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, full body, creamy, oily feel, slick feel, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish,

Im Glas gelb, orange, leicht trüb und schaumig. In der Nase hefige, blumige Noten, brotig, Honig. Am Gaumen Hefe, Süße, leicht alkoholisch, blumig am Abgang. Asufüllend, aber mit vergleichsweise wenig Kohlensäure für ein Tripel.

Bottle gifted from a friend after theyd held on to it for a few years, so is slightly aged. Boozy, sherry-like smell - and lots of raisin and wood flavours coming out. Would be interesting to compare this with a fresh bottle too.

Pours a cloudy golden color with a thick head that fades to good lacing. Aroma of fruit, citrus with bit of spice in the background. Taste of tropical fruit, bit of citrus and spice. Mild bitterness and a clean finish. Moderate body, smooth and well balanced. No hint of the 8% ABV. Enjoyable beer that is easy to drink.

750 bottle from Brewfest Beverage. Very pale beige orange with lasting flat head and lace. Spicy peppery grassy bready aroma. Very mild vanilla and tropical fruit sweetness with a touch of tartness and mild peppery grassy finish. Medium body soft carbo. Hmm...Im not blown away like I had hoped. Very good. Has a little dirty dishwater aftertaste and my glasses are sparkling clean. Is that age?
Zeer lekkere tripel, te drinken als aperitief in kleinere glaasjes, of gezellig onder vrienden.van het vat zeer lekker, frisse tripel te evenaren met st sixtus

Transfer from BA review on 12-25-12-

 Poured from bottle into wine glass

 Appearance  The beer poured a hazy orange amber color with a one finger, rather fizzy white head. The head fades relatively fast giving a decent level of lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma was lighter then I would have expected with it being mainly of a candied sugar and light fruit aroma of peach and apple. Mixed with these sweeter smells were some notes of a bready and wheaty nature as well, giving it a rather traditional triple, but light traditional, triple aroma.

 Taste  The taste starts out with a lighter fruit and bready flavor. Flavors of pear and peach mixed with a lighter orange flavor, create the fruit flavor base, while the bready flavor has some light notes of a wheat bread nature. As the flavor advances, the yeast starts to make its presence known. This mixed with a light candied flavor as well as a newly arriving clove spice and boozy flavor. The boozy flavor gets stronger as the taste advances further, and at the end the mix of sweet, boozy and bready flavors leaves a satisfying and warming flavor on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  For an 8% abv. triple the body of the beer is just above average in its creaminess and chewiness with a carbonation level that is very appropriate for the style at a medium to slightly above medium level, Both are nice for accentuating the fruity, sweet and boozy flavors of the brew.

 Overall  A rather delicious triple. It had a little more boozy flavors then would have been expected for its 8% abv. strength, and its nose was a little weak, but overall it had great flavors, a nice look and a wonderful feel.
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear gold with a thick white head. Floral spice nose. Flavors of banana and butterscotch. Smooth and tasty.

Head is white, frothy and huge but diminishes mostly. Body is clear light yellow with sparkles.
Aroma contains straw, citrus fruits, spruce, and banana, vanilla, grape, raisin, pear, peach and spices.
Flavor is light acidic, then bitter and light sweet, then sweet and finishes in bitter.
Body is medium with creamy texture and soft carbonation.
Truly a great tripel. Many sweet fruits and a bitter finish.
Een van de beste tripels dat ik al geprobeerd heb. Echt een aanrader voor de tripel-liefhebbers

Pours a cloudy, slightly greenish pale amber with one finger of white head diminishing gradually to a thin skim and moderate lacing. Nose is light malt, yeasty, orange peel, slight alcohol. Taste is sweet and yeasty, clove and pepper, finishing bitter. Mouth feel is medium bodied but sticky, with mild warming.

330 ml / 33 cl, flaske, rating m.f.f. alderstegn - flasken BB 26/11/10, købt i Den Belgiske Ølbutik i Vanløse, 15. august 2014.
Karamelbrun, grumset og ufiltreret Triple med fin høj offwhite skumtop, 3-4 cm. Ganske stort indhold af gærrester, som sandsynligvis delvist skyldes alderen (se top).
Lettere sur-/sødlig aroma. Citrus/lime, tørret frugt, gær, bondegård, fugtig/svampet. 
God dyb smag. Fint indhold af sødme og ganske moderat bitterhed. Ganske lille let surhed i begyndelsen. Fin medium lang eftersmag. Fin balance mellem smagselementerne. Mellem fyldig krop og cremet konsistens. CO2 på et medium niveau. 
En god og "stabil" Triple uden dikkedarer og let drikkelig trods udseendet.

Very nice cereal notes in the aroma, light floral and some alcohol. Golden and clearappearance. Small bubbles and fluffy white head, stayed for quite a while. Medium bitter, the cereal taste started first and ended in the bitter aftertaste. Medium body, average carbonation, long finish. Rates amongst the best Tripels i have tasted in a while.

Bottle. Yellow-orange with a white head that fizzes away. Light malt aroma, spicy, yeasty, citrus (orange peel). Over carbonated. Flavour is sweet, yeasty, tending to bitter peel with spices--coriander, clove, pepper. A nice beer with good qualities.

Tap. Golden body, short white head. Aroma is sweet of toffee and malt, very fruity. Full bodied, with oily to creamy body and soft carbonation. Tastes sweet, with some soft orange sourness and some bitter citrusy, fruity hops. Nicely balanced. Crisp and light, but very full and warming. Strong flavors of warm spices, cloves, orange peel, light malt, toffee, very warming. Some more hops to balance. After taste is strong, very sweat and sticky. Much lighter then I expected, yet full and warm.
Yeast an clean aroma. Nice bright amber with white Frothy head. Taste is just as bitter as it us sweet super balanced. High alcohol thats only some what hidden. Great beer

Vierte color amarillo naranja con buena cabeza de espuma que perdura en la copa; en la fase olfativa se aprecia levadura belga, fruta cítrica y galleta; en boca entrada potente con notas a pomelo y miel; el alcohol se siente al paso por la garganta; pos gusto con amargor moderado, tornándose dulce al rato; cuerpo y carbónico medios, muy buena cerveza triple.

Bottle to tulip
Yeast, bread, biscuit, citrus, and malt. Its a sludgy, yellowish brown, with a long lasting, thick, frothy, bright white head with lots of black particulates. Taste us apricot, pepper, peach, loads of yeast.

Bottle 750ml. Nice hazy golden with medium bubbly white head. Yeasty aroma, oranges, citrus, biscuit, bready, a bit grassy. Sweet-sour yeasty flavor, citrus, hints of honey, sweet malt, notes of grass. Heavy carbonation. Medium to full body. Very nice.
Golden yellow cloudiness below frothy white head. Smells fresh with citrus and palate fullness with smooth finish and strong alcohol content appreciated. Another fine beer from the monks.

330ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. Golden amber colour, white foam head leaving some lacing and aroma of sweet malt cereal, spice, fruity, belgium yeast. Taste is malt & grain, spicy cinnamon, with fruity, grassy hop & yeasty notes. Mouthfeel is both smooth & crisp, medium body, soft carbonation, slight tartness & bitterness at the finish. Very drinkable.

Hazy yellow with a small white head.
Faint aroma, fresh and yeasty.
Taste is light malty and yeasty with herbal hops.
Medium body, low soft carbonation..
Yeasty peppery herbal aftertaste.
Yellow cloudy with medium white cap. Mostly watery bitterness with some bit sweet notes.
Pours a hazy yellow with an impressive long-lasting thick white frothy head. Has a yeasty nose. Smooth, soft palate and flavors of yeast, malt, banana, and hops.

Pours a tangerine color with a large white head. Aromas of spicy belgian yeast esters; clove, white pepper. Wheaty. Taste is spicy and off dry. Flavors of cloves and white pepper up front, followed by citrusy yeast, a small dash of sunshine across a backsplash of a floral panorama. Crusty. Finishes delicate inthe mouthfeel yet with a brash alcohol presence. Not my favorite.
Tap at Busters. Hazy yellow pour with thick white head. Grassy, apple and pear aroma. Light malt body with light hop bitterness and light fruit notes. Very tasty.

After a nice pifff from opening, pours with a very aggressively head tall and dense over a golden straw beer. A bit hazy and with great carbonation.
A get a mildly spiciness with some subtle fruity esters.
A spicy malt taste with some alcohol warming.
Medium bodied beer with a dry finish and a slightly bitter aftertaste.
Drinkable? 10/4 good buddy.

Pours a light golden with frothy one finger lacing white head. Aroma is light, spiced, and yeasty. Taste is light with a light to medium body. Slight tart bitter hop finish. A great tripel but lighter and crisper in flavor than others that I have had.

Dark golden with big white head. Very spicy at first, with cinnamon, cloves, coriander, going into big fruits with cherries, peach and grapes. Not too sweet, with great balanced tartness and pleasant bitter finish. Medium bodied, full carbonation and slight alcohol. Exotic tasting tripel with great yeast character. Awesome.
Bottle poured. Golden appearance with a white, fluffy head. Sweet aroma with faint floral hops.

a hazy orange-yelow coloured beer with a thick and frothy white head. A spicy aroma, clove and a touch of cinnamon, plus a dusty malt aroma and a background yeastiness. medium-dry mouthfeel. The taste starts off with a cereal element, malt and wheat. This is followed by a spicy sweet, fruit flavour that is in turn followed by a tart yeasty flavour. This tartness become dominant into the finish.
Bottle, Bangkok Casa Lapin X Aree. Dark amber color with apple flavor and sourness. Tastes lovely. リンゴジュー

Really good trippel - a style Im still learning to love but beers like this are getting me there. Its light amber, slightly cloudy with a small white head and some lacing. Yeast figures strongly in the aroma and taste, with banana, some sweetness and a sour tang. All of which are well balanced. Very nice.

Bottle, 330 ml. Pours cloudy yellowish amber with a finger of soapy white head. Aroma of wholemeal and sourdough bready malts, banana, honey, orange, possibly a bit of citrus and floral hoppy notes. Strong taste of banana and honey retained from the aroma, overlaying the bready malt base. Orange notes are now also more pronounced, and the finnish is rather grassy, floral or just generally biological like that, with a small amount of bitterness. Taste is much simpler than the Abt 12 but its certainly a pleasant one, especially when combined with the moderate to full body, smooth texture, and good amount of alcohol warmth.
UPDATED: JUL 22, 2014 Bottle 33cl. Seraf. Cloudy golden with medium white head. Aroma of clove and spices.
Melhor representante do estilo e melhor cerveja belga que já provei. Excelente drinkability, overhead cremoso, álcool equilibrado e cor linda.

Draft at Mellow Mushroom Spring Texas. Pours very lively with a nice white foamy head. Beautiful hazy yellow. Floral nose. Taste is rosebuds, very mild orange citrus, and the proper amount of dryness on the finish. This is a fresh tap and it shows. Not too sweet like most American tripels Ive had. World class beer.
user_location: Seattle still not near Beersel., Washington, USA

text: Nice white head, lasting. Honey, slightly hazy. Yeasty, fruity. Light bitter aftertaste. Nice.

Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Pours hazy honey in color with a beautiful, long lasting white head. Aroma is sweet with notes of bananas, yeast, light glue and sharp. Flavor starts a bit sharp fallowed by a nice sweetness and notes of yeast. Good

3014/06/14 - Pours a hazy gold/honey colour with a tight, white, soapy head. Aroma is Belgian yeast, bread dough, spices, banana, mild orange, apricot, and floral hops. Taste is Belgian yeast, dough/biscuit, spices, banana, mild orange/citrus, floral hops and mild alcohol. Medium body with a silky mouthfeel. Lively and smooth carbonation with a fruity/floral, warming finish. Delicious, complex and refreshing; everything a good tripel should be and more.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: DEC 16, 2016 Hele lekkere frisse tripel. Bloemig aroma. Lekkere romige en volle smaak met licht bittere afdronk. Bloemig, kandijsuiker, perzik, abrikoos, banaan, zelfs licht likeurachtig. Pracht van een bier !! Hoeft zeker niet onder te doen voor de blinde Westvleteren. Deze is stiekem zelfs een beetje beter...
Golden color with orange hue. Fluffy white foam. Hops and esters aromas. Full body with malty notes. Well balanced with herbal bitterness.
Smells and tastes much like a slightly more powerful Mardsous Blonde. Some citrus, malts, yeast and bready tones. Typical and slightly above average off-the-shelf belgian tripel.

Location/Date:Bottle on June 6th, 2014.
Appearance: Pours an opaque orange yellow.
Aroma: Aroma of light orange, lemon, yeasty.
Taste: Light bitterness, sweet, orange.
Palate:Medium body.
Summary: Finally got to try this. Good beer, although belgian yeast kind of gets to me.
Classica tripel un po invadente, con forte presenza alcolico, gusto floreale e leggremente fruttato. Non troppo complessa, ma nel suo stile buona.

Kaatuu tulppaaniin kullankeltaisena ja sameana, noin kolmen sormen paksuisella vaahdolla, joka jättää jonkin verran pitsiä. Tuoksussa vahvimpana tuntuu yrttisen ja pippurisen mausteinen belgihiiva, sitrusta ja hiivaleipää on myös joukossa melko paljon. Leipäinen viljaisuus on jotain, mitä ei yleensä tripelin tuoksussa ole. Maussa ollaan melko perinteisellä linjalla, yrttistä ja pippurisen mausteista hiivaisuutta on eniten, mutta sitruunaista ja kukkaista humalaa on myös melko paljon joukossa. Viljainen leipäisyys tuntuu taustalla lievän happamuuden kanssa. Suutuntuma on melko täyteläinen, napakasti humaloitu ja suht raikas. Leipäinen viljaisuus on jotain hyvin erilaista tähän tyyliin, mutta sopii oikein hyvin joukkoon. Lievää happamuuttakin on joukossa. Hieman lisää raikkautta olisi toivonut, mutta älyttömän hyvää näinkin.
Hazy orange, airy white head. Fruity, yeasty aroma. Flavour is similar with clearly present alcohol, a little spicy but mostly fresh and fruity. Carb is lively, mouthfeel is both prickly and creamy.
Bottle. Hazy, orange, frothy, white foam, light sweetness, medium bitterness, full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, & abrupt finish.

Bottle. Appearance- light, golden with an amber tinge, hazy, lots of bubbles rising, a large pillowy white head which settles into a fingers worth and leaves some lacing. Aroma- fresh fruits- banana, a bit of lemon, creamy malt, grassy, spicy. Taste- creamy, medium to full mouthfeel, hop resins, plenty of biscuity malt, sugary sweetness, sweet banana, spicy notes come through, with a bit of zesty fruit. Quite a short finish. Very tasty.

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2014 Several times, both on bottle and especially on draught. 
Beautiful hazy golden color, pours medium head which dissolves to a 1 cm layer. Very fruity, floral, sweet, banana, belgian yeasts aroma, typical tripel essence. Tastes fruits, honey, spices, dough, yeasts. Starts with a great fruity sweet taste which progressively lowers and balances leaving a great palate, with a little bitter grassy finish and medium effervescency. A very nice tripel, with great balance and drinkability. Just love the  tap version, even more fresh and balanced.

Highly effervescent Belgian Tripel, with nice aroma, amber color and strong flavor. Perfect for the hot summer as it is very refreshing. Try it with chicken wings!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Its head is bright white in color and about one finger in thickness. The light foamy head fades quickly down to just a small ring of foam that makes slick lacing on the glass as I swirl and sip. Under this head is an orangey tan colored liquid which is cloudy and full of tan yeast floaters. The aroma has notes of fresh peeled apple skins, funky yeast and a touch of apple cider vinegar. There is a slightly astringent, citrus and hard apple cider flavor with some spicy phenolic character as well. The finish becomes bone dry with flavor notes of dry powdery yeast and some mild leafy hops that add just a touch of bitterness. The carbonation is light and just tickles the tongue. Its body has a medium to full feel and its texture is a little bit thick, almost chewy.

Drinking from a 33 cl bottle.
No special aroma but alcohol.
The unclear orange beer has a medium white head that disappears fast.
Banana and spices in the taste.
Medium carbonated.
A decent triple.

BOTTLE 33CL

Look:dirty amber and cloudy, off-white creamy head.
Aroma: blond fruit perfume and some mellow herbal notes too.
Taste: quite sweet and fruity, balanced by light spicy/phenolic background, a tad of hop bitterness in the finish. Light easy drinkable body. Quite nice but somehow too innocent, would like more spice and character.
Bottle. Cloudy golden with medium white head. Belgian aroma. Nice full bodied taste, floral banana, pretty high carbonation. Very nice tripel

750ml bottle. Pours a hazy golden color with a creamy white head and soft carbonation. Aroma of clove and spices. Flavor has a bit of banana and lively spice notes. Medium bodied with bittersweet finish. Quite good.
UPDATED: MAR 5, 2016 330ml bottle. Hazy yellow body with a medium white head. Light bread, banana, spices and yeast.
Hazy golden color with white lasting head. Sweet fruits and honey aroma. In taste bit sweet with alcohol nicely masked. Big bodied. Special beer.

Slightly hazy yellow golden pour with very large white foamy head. I get bread and banana and a lovely yeast aroma along with a nice blend of spices. Again bread and banana, but also pear and spices in the back for taste. Mildly alcoholic and good bitter sweet aftertaste. Full mouthfeel and perfect carbonation. Fantastic tripel! Love the spices!
Ottima tripel anche se non la miglior st bernardus provata, indubbiamente.
Pours hazy golden, with aroma os mild spice, pear, peach and bread. Taste is bittersweet and noticable bready yeast. Very tasty and a nice fluffy thick white head. Very good!

Hazy and cloudy opaque orange beer with a cloudy white head. Aroma has sour apple, white grapes, some sweet toffee and little bit of alcohol. Flavor is dry with crisp sour apple and yeastiness and bitterness. Palate is highly carbonated, foaming in the mouth and thicker than medium. Finishes with a quite heavy bite of bitterness and some burning alcohol, leaving a dry bitter and peppery aftertaste. A quite dry tripel with some alcohol, not the most refreshing or aromatic one.

Bottle at Nydalen, Oslo. Hazy gold. A very proper Tripel. Peaches, apricots, a little frehs grass. Slightly funky, and the Belgian yeast miracle that creates the soft sour/bitter edge that lifts it all up. A blessing on a rainy afternoon.

Hazy amber/bronze pour. Aroma is sweet and delicate, with some honey, flowers and light malts. Taste of dark sweet fruits, and burnt sugar (caramel?). Some spiciness in there as well, with some bitterness that builds up throughout.

Birra di bellaspetto. Schiuma compatta e persistente.
Al naso aromi di frutti e, principalmente, banana. La birra risulta ben bilanciata ma non esalta in nessuna delle sue caratteristiche.

Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur blonde à pein trouble et une mousse intense au nez grosse attaque sur le grain type blé et orge, en bouche grosse attaque sur le citron et une continuité sur le grillé, très bon

It took me a moment to figure this one out. Excellent right out if the bottle, but with some air time the true flavors are released. Wonderful bread pudding/caramelized sugar notes not to be missed. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Bottle. Slightly hazy orange color. Foam dissipates just a little too quickly for my liking. Aromas of yeast (young cheese), koriander, hint of citrus. The mix of ingredients gives the beer quite an acidic sensation. Light touch of basement funk. Taste overwhelms the palate a little at first. But slowly you discover the individual tastes in there, which are nonetheless hard to pinpoint: some white grapes, French cheese, general cabbage taste (no sauerkraut but it is moving in that direction). Little boozy. Slight creamy touch. Nice.

Bottle at home. Like the 6, I think this is a good representation of the style. Maybe not the best but a good solid performer. Kind of like a Darren Fletcher, rarely wows but never lets you down. Yeasty sugaryness, fair lick of malts, some citrus and peach.
Pale amber, flowery, fruity, orange peel aroma and flavor, subtle sourness and spicy, a very smooth beer, well balanced, medium body, you can taste de alcohol but in a good way.
Pale cloudy yellow, white foamy long lasting head. Aromas of malts, belgian yeast and some spiciness. Sweet taste, almost no hops.

Flasche (33 cl). - Goldgelb, trüb, viele Hefeteilchen. - Hefig-würzige Nase mit ganz leichter Ananas-Note. - Antrunk breit hefig und leicht würzig (ist das Koriander?). Deutlich kandiszuckersüß, malzig aber mild und irgendwie flach, ohne hervortretende Herbe oder Schärfe oder wenigstens ein bißchen pikante Säure. Stark rezent, schaumig. Kaum bitter im Abgang. - Etwas arg mild für ein Tripel und jedenfalls viel zu schwach gehopft. Mir persönlich fehlt die wuchtige, bitter-fruchtige Schwere, die ein gutes Tripel bieten kann.

Pours a hazy golden colour with tight foam top. Aroma is grainy-malty with some fruite notes. Taste is very rich, mouth-filling with a nice well-balanced spicy bitterness. Medium carbonation and well hidden alcohol. Medium long finish. Highly drinkable. A good summertime abbey beer.
Bottle. Pours cloudy straw color. Nice white heat. Spicy fruity taste. Nose is pear. This is what a tripel should taste like.

Bottle at Delirium Cafe, Brussels. Amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, hops, earthy notes, honey and grass. Velvet smooth body. Bitter finish with citrus, ripe fruits and earthy notes. Excellent tripel.
Dunkel gyllen farve med lyst skum. Lukt av malt, gress og gjær. Smak av malt, honning, frukt og gjær. Melkebaren.
Syrlig duft av høy og gjær. Dunkel gulbrun farge. Tykt dekkende skum. Smak av banan, og andre frukter. Frisk og god.
Fruity and sweet, almost cloyingly sweet for me with a honeyed taste. Yeasty bread taste with the strong honey aftertaste,
Bottle from Bruges. Pours hazy golden with a nice big frothy white head. Yeasty aroma. Taste is bitter sweet with notes of citrus, hay and bread with a slightly earthy finish. A nice tripel.

From a 750 ml bottle. Pours cloudy gold with a super thick, expanding white creamy head with artistic lacing. Aroma of honey, raisin, lemon, hay, and yeast. Moderately sweet with some sour and medium bitter for a very balanced taste. Nice earthy notes, somewhat nutty, very refreshing and delightful, clean finish. Im very impressed with this brewery.
Bottle 0,33ltr: Hazy golden coloured brew with an nicely dry bitter taste and hints of spices, oranges and caramel.

75cl. bottle. Pours a cloudy golden color with a one-finger white head. Aroma of malt, caramel and spices. Taste is of malt, light citrus-y fruits, bread, yeast, spices and alcohol. Mouthfeel is dry and leads to a bitter alcohol finish. Full bodied and highly carbonated. Quite good.

33cl bottle @ home. Hazy golden amber color, big white creamy head. Aroma caramel, fruits, floral, cereal, licorice notes. Alcohol warmth is slightly noticable in the throat. Taste light sweetness, medium bitterness, salty notes. Full body, creamy texture, average carbonation, fine bittersweet finish. Tipical abbey tripel, not too intersting, not very special, but good.

Hazy golden color with a firm, lastign white head. High carbonation. Aroma of oranges, spices and flowers. A malty sweetness taste cobined with alcohol and light spices. a slightly dry and alcohol aftertaste, A very good tripel beer. Well balanced.

Bottle. Cloudy amber with a small foamy head. Peach, some clove, a little alcohol and maybe butterscotch candy aroma. Tastes slightly bitter, rich and fruity - peach again, mostly sweet and very, very lightly sour - in a fruity sort of way. Full-bodied, carbonated, long, peach and apple finish.

Ins Glas ergießt sich ein trübes goldenes Bier mit schöner Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig süß, alkoholisch, Nüsse, Früchte.
Geschmack sehr süß malzig, dunkle Früchte, hefig, leicht alkoholisch.

Bottle from Great Grog. Murky golden/amber body with a thin white head. Light lacing. Aroma of pear, yeast, orange rind, spices and apple sauce. Wonderful flavour of pumpkin, overripe red apple and spices. The slightly salty yeast ties it all together beautifully. Very drinkable for its strength. Full body with a frothy mouthfeel. Average fizz. A mellow, moreish Tripel.

Bootle. Cloudy golden colour with a white thick head. Aroma of fruits, yeast and sweet alcohol. Flavour of sweet malt and some spices with a kick of alcohol toward the end. Nice finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Presentation: 330mL brown bottle, served in an 5 Rabbit Cervecería tulip.

Appearance: Deep, cloudy, dark yellow color. It develops a thick, two finger white head and leaves lots of lacing that sticks to the whole glass and slowly slides away.

Smell: It has a burning fruity alcohol scent.

Taste: The malt sweetness is dominant. There are some herbal, spicy notes in the background and a good alcohol kick at the end that reminds you this is packing an 8% ABV.

Mouthfeel: Theres a fair amount of carbonation. It feels creamy and smooth on the palate, even a bit refreshing.

Overall: A very interesting beer all the way through. Despite the high ABV it remains mellow and balanced, which makes for a very good experience. No wonder this is one of the best rated Tripels out there.
Good beer, but not a 99 rated one in my opinion! Slightly sour and sweet, no hops taste, good but not great

0,33L bottle, BB. 10.02.2016. Pours hazy golden with nice white head. The head stays. Aroma is very fruity, sweet, sour, spicy, and yeast. Taste is sweet, fresh fruits, spicy, Finish has a spike of bitterness, spices and noticeable alcohol, but not unpleasant. Overall: classic tripel, but not really one of my favorite beers.

Pours hazy yellow with a big white head. Aroma is very breaded, slight sour, flowers and a good portion of alcohol. Taste is very textbook tripel, but actually pretty sweet. Taste hides the alcohol quite well! Decent tripel

En flaska som stått till sig några år. Smak och doft av jäst, äpple, päron, karamell, aprikos med toner av örter och russin. Fruktig, rund och len men med fin beska och sötma. Välbalanserad och med lagom kolsyra. Riktigt gott.
Donker goudkleurig ietwat troubel bier, Smaakt is sterk, sterk hoppig, iets fruitig citroen, licht zoet. Smaak blijft lang hangen. Uitstekende tripel.

Large white head, drivel like. Mixed malt and heavy hops aromas. Unfiltered body with light orange color. Fresh taste of spring flavors. Refreshing and warm in mouth. Good length.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Payé pas de mine niveau aspect, peu de mousse mais dense en goût citron et épicé grillé .reste en bouche, malt puissant....

The aroma blends Belgian yeast, sour fruit, and light malts, and the appearance is an opaque golden with a large white head. The taste is mildly sweet and slightly sour, but there is a crispness to it. The palate fuses an average carbonation, medium body, slick texture, and a long sweet finish.
1 inch white heat. Hazy straw color. Spicy fruity taste. Aroma typical Belgian. Overall nice beer.

Bottle. Slightly hazy golden color, generous white frothy head, good lacing; complex sweet malty aroma, bread, grass, citrus, herbs, bit yeasty, apricot, light caramel, butterscotch, hint of coriander; medium sweet, lightly bitter, fruity notes; full body, creamy to oily texture, lively carbonation; smooth bittersweet finish, fruity notes (apricot, peach). Very well-balanced beer. Excellent tripel.

11.2 oz. bottle. Appearance: 2 fingers lasting white head, ok lacing, straw color, clear. Aroma: Belgian yeast, dough, caramel, floral hops. Palate: light body, lively carbonation, slight bitter finish that lasts for a second. Taste: mild fruity sweetness with light bitterness. Overall, very very nice tripel. Good balance with the hops, nice aroma, and very refreshing.

Bottle at Akkurat. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is fruity with citrus some grass, typical belgian yeast spice notes, sweet malt. Taste is sweet malt with a light bitterness and spices, finish is dry and crisp. Smooth, oily with a lively carbonation makes it easy drinkable despite the fairly high ABV.

Pours lager-light-lemon colour with small fading head. Aroma is a melange of floral and belgian yeasty notes (under ripe banana and almond) with some citrus in the undergrowth. Banana and lemon replicated in the refreshing mouthful. Finish is a little grating: light pilsner, almost grainy, bitterness.

A delicate, smooth tripel. Light bitterness in the aftertaste, flowery, not the most complex tripel but very well drinkable. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy yellow orange color, big white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, yeast, spices, some honey and floral notes. Taste has similar notes and is mostly sweet with gentle dryness and light bitterness in finish and spicy aftertaste. Medium body and fizzy carbonation. Good trippel, quite enjoyable.

hazy, slightly brownish yellow colour, significant amount of stable white head; aroma of grassy and floral hops, hints of honey, fruitynes and some bready notes; taste is the same; really excellent tripel

Aroma: spicy citric malty. Appearance: pale gold, small white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: medium carbonation, bitters continue. Overall: bit disappointing Abbey Triple, missing the sweets. Bottle at the Dovetail, London.

Colour: bright gold with a shallow white head.
Nose: vanilla, banana, grassy, custard, hint of herbs.
Flavours: light alcoholic bitterness, lemon (sour), licorice, butterscotch (sweet). Banana fruitiness remains.
Finish: quite long and refreshing for an abbey tripel. Alcohol barely noticeable.
Verdict: very well made Tripel from a fantastic brewer.

January 26, 2014. 750mL bottle from Craig via British Columbia. Opaque gold in colour. Banana on the nose and flavour. Big foamy head that didnt last. Touch of sweetness in flavour. Quite a lovely beer.

a real Tripple, with fermentaion in bottle; rather sour then sweet.
an alternative to the hard to find West Vleteren ones.
UPDATED: FEB 4, 2014 Amberblonde cloudy abbey tripel with a nice bittersweet flavour and a hint of walnut.

Bottle. Clear orange yellow with a small white head. Aroma has dusty grain and fruit. 

Taste has fruit, grain and floral notes. Little liquorice. Crisp carbonation, alcohol is non-existant. Bitter woody aftertaste. Decent stuff.
Straw yellow color with white foam. Fruity aroma. Taste is soft sweet malt. Fine Triple.

dough, spices, citrus, fruity and a very lite hint of a root beerish aroma. Poured a thick 2 finger head and a hazy golden color. That Belgian sweet and sourness and a nice smooth and mellow taste and feel on the palate. Good beer!

Viellie deux ans. Superbe robe blonde dorée légèrement trouble avec un haut col de mousse pétillante. Nez très riche de miel, fruits secs, alcool, levures. En bouche, corps crémeux et pétillant, bonne carbonation, malts et alcool en attaque, puis une légère amertume et le côté mielleux prennent le dessus. Pas très longue en bouche malheureusement. Superbe bière, comme toutes celles élaborées par st. bernardus !

UPDATED: OCT 16, 2014 33cl in a St. Bernardus glass. Pours a very pale straw colour with a billowing white head. Very floral and sweet with some nice estery yeast notes giving way to a mildly bitter aftertaste. Superbly well balanced and a very classy tripel. Gets better the more you drink. Very much of the St. Bernardus family and one of the best tripels I have tried.

Bottle, 33cL. Home. After opening, slow white foam arises. A good omen for. A yellow brown hazy beer with a large fine , persistant head. Sediment of yeast at the bottom of the bottle. Aroma of spices, herbs, bread, alcohol and lemon. Medium sweetness with light bitterness. Medium body and carbonation. Long bitter refreshing finish. A very good beer. Good balance.

Bottle poured into a St Bernardus Trippel glass. Golden hazy body with a thick frothy head. Aroma and taste are pure Belgian Trippel with the expected balance between sweet and sour. Very well done!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
33 cL bottle into a bowl shaped glass. Golden-orange with a huge head, and its gassy. Sweet, hoppy aroma. Smooth, malty and a touch sweet. Light (for the abv) and tasty tripel.

Ar: Orange rind, peach, a touch of pineapple - a little black pepper.
Ap: Golden-orange, slightly hazy - large head with good retention, leaves a semi-even foam cap and a few spikes of lacing.
T: Soft sugary orange, peach - moss and cloves - a hint of banana - medium-low bitterness with a clean, warming alcohol - more citrus, leafy bitterness, and a refined sugary quality - a bit of sherry oxidation.
P: Medium-light body with high carbonation - finish is very dry.
O: Nice, drinkable tripel - a fair degree of complexity, with a mixture of fruit and spice.

330ml bottle from Beers of Europe website (£2.69):
Lively & fruity as well with some orange and citrus notes on top of an apple and grape base. Naturally the beer is quite sweet as a result of the fruits and comes with some sugar and some peppery spice too with alcohol well hidden.

Orange/amber with 0.5cm of tiny white bubbles and plenty of visible carbonation. Head retention is good considering the strength & it holds for a few minutes.

Sweet with orange & citrus plus some grapes and a little Belgian yeast on top of some banana too although this is quite light and barely detectable at first. There is a floral, almost perfume like taste that starts to come through alongside some tropical fruits and some peppery spice.

Crisp and lively with plenty of carbonation and a medium body that is quite sweet and dry, particularly towards the end of the beer. The beer had a great balance to it with the fruits all coming together well to completely hide the alcohol in the beer.

One that I quite enjoyed and one that despite the strength went down quite easily thanks to the good balance between fruits and the lively carbonation. I was expecting the beer to be a good one and it didnt disappoint and despite the fact the finish was a dry one.
This brew is very sweet. Tastes a bit like pineapple juice not as good as I was anticipating.
On tap. Hazy golden orange, cream rich head. Heavy body with medium carbonation. Winey, caramel malts and citrus notes. Very sweet with almost no bitter ending. Overall OK. N
Tasting at RW&B. Bottle->stem. Hazy gold with fluffy white head. High carbonation. Lots of fruit and floral notes, some bread and yeast. Quite good.

Bottle poured into snifter. Hazy golden body with foamy white head that dissipates at a decent rate. Smells of lemon, straw and caramel malt. Tastes include lemon, citrus, grassy straw and a hint of the alcohol. Solid tripel, will be enjoying again soon.
I Totaly LOVE this beer and would recommend to everyone who likes blond beers! great beer!
Appearance is large white head with amber color. Aroma is a bit sweet. Taste is relatively mild with a balanced mix of sweet malt and bitterness. Overall pretty well balanced.

Veramente una bella birra, che al mio naso si presenta con un sentore distinto di Malto e di Luppolo, soprattutto con lodore del pane e del miele, e lievemente di resina. Allaspetto è arancio ocre, con una schiuma bellissima color bianco sporco che tende ad accompagnare quasi tutta la bevuta. In bocca, presenta un sapore amaro con una bella carbonatazione, persistente e godibile. Corpo medio, quasi oleosa e con finale amaro. In definitiva una ottima birra, con un finale medio lungo e che si lascia bere molto piacevolmente.
The head is robust, body brown-grey and cloudy. It smells yeasty, maltaromatic. The tatse is yeasty, a bit fruity, malty, less hoppy,

330ml bottle in Jerusalem. Exp date: 2/2016. Pours a hazy amber with four fingers of spongy white foam, which settles to one finger. No yeast at base of bottle. Visible carbonation is negligible. Very aromatic, evoking a fresh pilsner, with notes of citrus (lemon), grass and hay -- sweet, dank and pleasant. Taste again dominated by pilsner flavors, white wine, honey and banana on the finish. Carbonation in the mouth is intense, excessive. Body is medium. Lacing is abundant. Bottom line: I was expecting more -- there are local brews of the style that surpass what St. Bernardus has done here.

Golden with an off white, light head that lasts long enough, initially very carbonated with a milder "triple" flavour than say Westmalle and later the carbonation decreases and you taste more of the st bernardus flavors. First review sorry I didnt use the terms on the right not entirely sure about some of the terms cooked vegetable? What beer is that?
Pours cloudy orange. Citrus, banana, bread aroma. Biscuit, bread, fruit flavours. Big body and full mouthfeel. Nice

Hazy golden orange, cream rich head. Winey, caramel malts and citrus notes. Tasted in a bar with lots of other smells around.... Carbinated beginning, which at first covers the mouthfilling delicious feeling. Sweet with bitter ending. Winey, hops, caramel malts.
From the bottle, pours hazy golden with huge white head. Fruity floral aroma. Taste is the same, moderately sweet. Big carbonation. Medium mouthfeel. Classic. Lovely.

Bottle, poured into tulip glass. Hazy yellow, thick white head, great lace. Aromas are perfumey and citrus. Taste is sweet, a little funky sour. Really typical tripel. Does its job very well. Very nice.

Drunk from 33cl bottle. Slightly sweet Belgian triple ale. 


 


 


 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pretty typical Belgian ale. Banana, clove, spicy Belgian yeast taste. Some fruitiness. Not much alcohol shines through, less than usual for the style. Good beer.

750ml bottle into a tulip glass. Pours cloudy gold colour with nice big persistent 2 finger head. Aromas of caramel & cloves. Taste is the same with lemon zest and banana. Superb thick & creamy mouthfeel. I really like this tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

(33 cl bottle from Belgisk Bryg; BBD: March 3rd 2014) Pours a cloudy amber with dense white head that fades somewhat after a while leaving an off-white film and plenty of lace. Aroma has more malt than many of the other Belgian triples Ive tasted but at the same time it also has the alcohol and yeasty notes with hints of banana. Oily texture, medium carbonation, medium body and a less dry and more fruity, spicy, marzipan-like finish. Flavour is complex with less hop bitterness and driness and more aroma notes.

Best by: 03FEB14

a: diaphanous toasted grain with three fingers of whipped, white foam. This falls to a thick quilt of the same leaving cobwebs. 
S: Clove, banana, coriander, musty yeast, grain, corn, a hint of pear.
T: Sharp and sweet with hints of amaretto. grain, yeast, looong finish is the amaretto. The finish here is what make the flavor so beautiful. Allows for long appreciation of the beer.
M: Medium on heavy with hi carb and a semi dry finish. 
O: Really a great tripel. complex, playful, multilayered.

Serving type: bottle

12-11-2011
Bottle at home. Hazy golden with a quite big, white, head. Aroma of fruits, banana, and yeast. Sweet taste of honey, yeast, and fruits. Slightly bitter, sour-sweet aftertaste.

330ml bottle shared with jeevan. Pours hazy golden yellow with a good white head. Classic aromas of clove, mixed spice, banana, wheat and yeast. Taste is slightly to the sweet end of things. Finishes clean and zingy. Lovely.

Really enjoyed this as one of my first tripels. The triple malt provides a rich tasty flavor that I enjoyed, yet very much in balance. Clean palate without any particular character lingering. Definitely try again. Look out for 8% alcohol, excellent for winter.

Very refreshing tripel thanks to its carbonation, and not dry at all in taste. Would have been great for the summer. Not much aroma, well balanced taste. Spicy and floral in the beginning, fruity in the end.

Tap at RJ. Aroma clove, spicy, wheat-like character. Hazy golden colour, white head, medium duration. Taste is yeasty, clove, spicy, weizeny. Alcohol hidden perfectly. Good beer, but one expects something more from beer of this calibre.
Color rubia oro casi ambar, aroma agradable y fuerte, sabor a caramelo, muy buena cerveza tripel

[ASPETTO] 			
oro pallido, aranciato, leggermente velata, schiuma bianca, abbondante , cremosa e buona persistenza			
[OLFATTO]			
cereali, frutta matura, sentori alcolici			
[GUSTO]			
inizio dolce, ancora frutta matura; cede sul finale un leggero amaro alcolico e speziato			
[TEXTURE]			
corpo medio, vellutata al palato ben carbonata

tripel equilibrata, tendenzialmente dolce, che mantiene una buona alcolicità che contribuisce ad un finale rotondo.
A very good example of a triple... Though a little over carbonated. Some alcohol is present, surprising considering only 8%

From a bottle. Pours hazy light orange, lots of carbonation, short lived white head. Well balanced, nice dry finish. Yum.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: bruised apricot color with golden highlights, fully opaque & filled with small sediment. Volatile - huge bone-white head grows large & tall. Aroma contains fruity & earthy esters, faint banana, lemon & citrus zest, orange peel, clove spices, & a huge backbone of Belgian yeast. Bubblegum notes from the yeast as well. Taste has some mellow fruitiness up front; plum, mango, grape skin, mushy banana. Light sugar dusting with some clove, baked biscuits & bread, bubblegum, & yeast. I was first getting an off-flavor of weird cardboard-y, moldy wood. As the beer warmed, this taste went away, but Im wondering why it was there? Didnt seem like oxidation. Mild phenol heat with warmth, too... Pretty well attenuated for a tripel.
Lots of carb, golden color. Sweeter more airy. very well balanced. much nicer than Watou tripel.
Fles met nagisting:goede schuimkraag, smaak beleving is fruitige , beetje zoet met zuur in goede balans.
Flesje 33cl thuis gedronken. Ruikt fris, smaakt sprankelend, fruitig, vleugje banaan. Prettige afdronk.

Bottle, chilled. Clear orange, gently sparkling, quite a big white bubbly head. Leaves white lacing. Smell is quite pungent and sharp, yeasty. Body medium, slightly foamy, carbonation medium - a bit spritzy on the tongue. Taste - yeasty, malts, semisweet, a bit fruity. A standard tripel really.

Aroma:somewhat dry fruitiness, fresh though

Taste:perhaps lighter but well balanced hop/malt character, hops finish relatively smoothly with little mouth feel

Appearance: cloudy gold body with very very fine sediment , very frothy body

11.2 oz bottle poured into a tulip glass. Poured a golden color with a huge white head and nice lacing. Aroma was Belgian yeast, spices, banana, and bread. Taste was very sweet and malty with a caramel finish. Excellent tripel.
pours gold with a massive foam head. big biscuit nose, light grass. grass is more upfront in the mouth. big body with a solid booze burn.

A good Tripel but its the same as Watou Tripel!!
Not a special taste but good at the end
Pours a cloudy golden colour with a frothy white head. Lovely sweet aroma with a hint of alcohol. Really nice balance between sweet and bitter.
una de mis cervezas favoritas. un aroma y sabor citrico. apariencia clara cambiando a oscura. sabor a naranja rayada y caramelo.

I had this at Global Brew. Pours a hazy gold with a white head. Taste sweet, fruity, Belgian yeast. I thought this was pretty good. I would definitely drink this again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
From tap at kazematten in Ieper. Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma is yeasty, fruity, sweet touch. Aroma is low bitterness, medium sweetness with yeast, fruit. Decent triple.

Aparência bege tendendo ao âmbar, turva. Espuma de média duração e baixa densidade.

Aromas de malte, fermento, frutas amarelas.

Sabor acompanha o aroma, com um dulçor bem presente mas não excessivo. Álcool muito bem inserido no conjunto.

Corpo médio.

Belíssima tripel.
