Blonde claire au beau col crémeux, bonne pétillance. Odeur de paille fleurie. Goût légèrement sucré au début puis vient une amertume un peu corsée avec une finale légèrement sèche. Très agréable à boire, une bonne triple.
Dissipating frothy white head and a peachy, amber sediment filled body. Nose of apricot and banana. Body is creamy, yeasty and nice mellow malt. Very enjoyable.

Bottle. Honey, fumes, some yeast, and hay aroma. Light honey color. Sharp tangy fruit, sliced peaches and something a bit zippier / yeast and then some bittering emerges / finishes with little bursts of fruity sweetness. Medium body, pleasant mouthfeel. So smooth and full of gentle flavors. Drinks less than 8%. Seems to have more bittering than most tripels.

330ml bottle. pours a hazy orange/gold with a cream coloured head that doesnt last. aroma is of yeast, alcohol, malts and a bit of fruit. taste is nice. full mouth feel, very smooth and ends tasting of fermented fruit. nice.
Nice cloudy amber color with mild fruity aroma. Malty with a tasty subtle banana finish. Very good triple.
Cloudy straw color with nice foamy white head. Aroma of light fruit. Fairly big mouthfeel. A bit chewy, bready, a bit musty. Well balanced. Lively mouthfeel.

Citrus and yeasty aroma. Dull orange with a thick head that doesnt last too well. Sweet malt with some caramel, banana and vanilla and a hint of citrus in the finish. Nice beer, though not the equal of some of St Bs other efforts.

330ML bottle from the beer palais on the Belgian border nr Watou. How did I not try this during my time in Flanders?? Incredible triple, ticking all the boxes for aroma, body and flavour with just the right amount of that vague banana sweetness that makes this style so moreish.

330ml Bottle. This opens and pours a lively golden amber with a deep white head that is long lasting. Being bottle conditioned there was a fair amount of sediment. Its aroma is quite usual for this type of beer - sweetness with some hints of malt and fruit. It tastes quite a lot "darker" than it looks with sweet fruitiness and honey soon giving way to darker caramel and slight toffee hints and a bitter finish. This is a lot more complex than similar beers and the depth of flavours really make it worth trying.

Poursa hazy peach-orange color. Aroma is faint and slightly alcoholic with hints of citrus. Flavor isnt as bold and robust as some of the other Bernardus brews. More citrus than dark fruit and oak. More carbonated it seems too. Not bad. Just not what I expected.

33cl from tap @ De Fiere Margriet, Leuven
Hazy orange, large head, lasting quite long.
Nose has some fruit,spice, apricot. 
Taste had a lot of sweet fruityness. Like candied apricots. A bit alcohol and bitterness in the finish. OK beer.

Draft - Honey, apricot and yeast. Cloudy yellow with a thin white head. Lemon, honey and a bit of hay. Very nice rich mouthfeel and alcohol is non existent.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Small bottle. Hazy golden body with a ta ll head. Aroma has soft honey and some fresh bread. Mouthfeel is full but the flavours are mild. Alcohol is well covered. Finish is lush and juicy but I prefer some more dryness and bite in it. I liked Westmalle and Chimay Tripels more.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2013 Well balanced, especially for 8% alcohol. Any alcoholic nose is absent with only a slight aftertaste of alcohol. Medium bodied with a touch of spice. Nice mouthfeel and head retention. Balance is the keyword for this beer. No noticeable flaws or otherwise outstanding positive characteristics. Very drinkable.

330ml bottle. Clear dark golden to amber colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Yeasty and fruity aroma with hints of pear, pale berries. Taste is moderately sweet and slightly sourish, yeasty, fruity, hints of honey, alcohol; prickling carbonation. Too sweet and alcoholic.
Hazy orange with a thick white head that retains. Aroma of flowers, citrus and yeast. Taste is fruity with some carbonation. Some slight biterness. Enjoyed it a lot.

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2016 Pours a hazy orange with a substantial white head. Aroma of bread, malt, fruits, citrus, yeast, hint of spices, touch of honey, some hops. Moderate to medium sweet with a dry and light bitter finish. Body is medium. Surprisingly easy to drink for a Tripel. Smooth with good balance. Very good example of the style.
A superb beer that easily holds its own against others of the style. Not quite as sweet/full bodied as the Westmalle I use as a benchmark but its not a fault and provides variety.
Poured from 750mL bottle. Hazy orangey yellow with full white head. Sweet aroma with biscuit belgian yeast. Mild yeast taste that hides the alcohol. Bready, carbonated. Mild, but polished finish.

Pour is a hazy honey color with a thick large peaking head. Noise is dry with notes of fruit,spice and yeast with spices being the stand out. A easy drinker for 8% abv and makes me think of fall but would be great for all 4 seasons. The sweet aromas and flavors of apricot blend well the the bitterness of the hops.

UPDATED: DEC 14, 2013 Op de biergilde proefavond uit de fles bij Charlies, goudgeel met eten dikke blonde kraag. geur is kruidig met mango. De smaak begint vol zoet met een bitterzoete afdronk. laurier met rozenbottel.
Licht amberkleurig bier. Schuim fijn van structuur. Ruikt naar oud vocht, schimmel. Smaak is weang beetje truffel, laurier.
Hazy yellow/amber, medium carbonation. Well balanced beer. Fruity aroma with hints of banana. Yeast and hops. Bitter finish.

Poured into a pint glass from a bomber-golden with a lovely white pillow head that sustains for quite a bit. You know what I mean when you pour a half of a glass admire the head, drink the brew, & the head remains in the bottle of the glass for a nice frothy finish.
Fruity aroma of a Belgium with a bit of spice. Taste is exquisitely balanced. Sweet malt balanced well with the hops & fermentation. Alcohol subtle
Tremendous flavor overall. YUM!
One of best!!!
This is just a fantastic beer. Has slight citrus flavor along with fruit and some yeasty flavors. Very nice.

Pours golden yellow the color of the sun in the sky. A cloud like head of white foam that stays forever to a layer on top and some sticky lace. Its hazy and and speckled. 

Nose is fragrant with light fruits. Lemon rind nice and sweet. A little orange and some tropical sweetness too. its herbal and sweet has a faint little spice. A light banana develops as it warms and there was short splash of bubblegum when I first opened the bottle that disappeared. Malt is light and honey like with a little bread. I am picking up a tarter fruit like apricot . 

Taste is splendid. Its impeccably crafted and in absolute harmony. The balance is perfection and the fruits all come together sweetly and a with a bit of tart from the apricot. the banana is laid over the top like lightness and air. The malt is fluffy and superb. There is a faint hop bitter but its so light. There is a nice toffee richness behind the malt that tastes like it wants out but remains restrained. It finishes dry and with a light bit of alcohol on the palate. 

This tripel is one of the best. It is outstanding in every way and it is everything you expect in the style. Chalky yeast and and a deep but light fruit character. Delicate toasted malt and a little pin prick of hop bitter. Its whimsical and yet tall and upright. You can almost imagine that the jolly looking monk on the bottle is the real genius behind this beer. Its as if he is saying "our backs are straight but we do know how to have a little fun when no one is looking." Indulgent and very very good.
What can you say about this beer other than I cant imagine how they could make it better. Hits the nail on the head in terms of balance, alcohol, and mouthfeel. Spicy to boot.
Pours hazy amber , white head. Nice slight bitter , slight carbonation . Not fruity. Very nice balance. Meets expectations
Love the smell. Very sweet smelling. Appearance is very cloudy. You can see chunks of yeast floating. Sweet tasting, almost like banana. Overall, a great beer.

Bouteille de 33cl. Couleur dorée, léger trouble, mousse abondante de tenue moyenne. Des arômes de miel combinés à des arômes fruités ( ananas, melon, mangue). Un bel équilibre sucré / amer, carbonnation moyenne. Trouvée à Roby - Menin.
Pours a golden beer with a good white head. Smells bit fruity. Triple like. Tastes pretty sweet. Average to lively carbo. Medium body and a bit sticky texture.

Light flowery aroma with some lighter straw and fruit aromas. Pours a clear golden color with lots of head. The taste is mostly sweet but has a light bitter bite on the end. Very light bodied and effervescent. This was quite pleasant not too sweet like so many tripels, the dryness in the finish i was also fond of.
Mooie goudgele kleur met goede schuimkraag. Zoetige fruitige geur. Fruitge smaak met zoetige tonen van honing. Veel, maar niet te veel koolzuur.

draft @ bierhuyske . pours blonde, good white foam . 
yeasy smell . 
rather low carbo ( i like that) 
taste is grainy, full, bread, yeasty, bit sweet. nice !
Has all the ingredients of a high quality Belgian tripel. Its even a little more special due to the slightly sour taste of fruit that gives the beer an extra depth. Really good.
Bottle 0.33 l. Aroma: yeast, some citrus, vanilla. Flavour: balanced, little sweetnes, banana. In aftertaste some spiceness and hoppines. Good beer

This is everything I want in a belgian beer. I am blown away at how many of my favorite belgian flavors are present in this beer. Pours a hazy, sedimented woody color with a sticky lace. Cloves, bananas, bread and that delicious belgian yeast flavor. Fairly bitter for the style. Feels full in your mouth, but betrays its abv. I love this

Poured a cloudy straw gold with a huge foamy head. The aroma is of strong alcohol with a subtle fruitiness as the head disappears in the bottom of the glass. Tastes sweet with a light bitter afterbite and a lot like I remember hobgoblin tasting.  Other than that I couldnt pick out too much on this beer. Slightly disappointed in this one considering the price for a bottle. Good beer but not much complexity or much to rave about.

Botled from Leffe-glass, pours rich-golden and fizzy, settles with a humble foam-cloud. Very carbon-rich triple with a refreshing bitter taste, aromas of full-wheat yeasty bread combined with hops and malts, perfect long finish, but ends a bit suddenly.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow with airy but thick and stable white head. Clear aroma of hops, fruit and malt. Sweet, malty taste with notes of caramel, fruit, and hops. Rich body. High carbonation. Lingering, sweetish aftertaste. Very nice.

This beer, with high fermentation, has a pale amber colour and a flowery, fruity taste with a harmonious balance between sweet and sour (8% alcohol content). This beer has a thick and vivid froth and strikes by its balanced taste with a delicate bitterness.

One of the better triples Ive had despite this probably being my least favorite Belgian style. Pleasant sweet and floral aroma. Light copper like apple juice color with medium head. Had to be careful with the pour on account of the good amount of sediment in the bottle. Good balance of flavors with crisp fruit, maybe some banana and pear with Belgian yeast and bready malts. The alcohol was not dominating. The palate was full and almost creamy with an appropriate amount of carbonation. Easy to drink.

Bottle @ Il Cortiletto. Appena aperta si percepisce lodore classico di una tripel importante. Maltato docle con note fruttate, il profumo che ricorda lo zucchero filato delle fiere, e delle note floreali estive, tipo buganvillee. Nel finale ci sono anche marcati sentori di lievito. Colore è un po scarno, giallo oro non molto carico, solo lievemente opalescente e con una schiuma bianca compatta e persistente. Il gusto è eccellente, pieno, vivo e rotondo. Su tutto si percepisce il dolce del malto che ricorda un po le focacce dolci, luvetta e le pesche sciroppate. Finale breve, piacevolmente alcolico anche se la birra non lo è. Laftertaste è luppolato , ma poco invadente e per nulla astringente. Chapeau.
Pours hazzy blond / gold with a creamy white head. full of fresh fruits, some sweet of sugar and yeast. One tasty tripel!

330ml served in a St. Bernardus goblet

A - Burnt orange color with a thick bright white head forming a thick collar. No lacing.

S - Fruity and yeasty, apricots, peaches, mango, sweet aroma

T - Sweet pale malts upfront, peaches, apricots galore, lemon, spicy Belgian yeast comes in along with a line of sweet candy and grain. Some nutmeg and coriander pop up as it warms. Finishes semi-dry with peppery/grassy hops.

M - Moderate foamy carbonation, turns creamy and lush, full body medium weight.

Excellent tripel. Rich pale malts with a tasty yeast strain. Stone fruit with some spice on the back end. Very drinkable I found myself drinking this faster than most tripels.

Serving type: bottle

02-01-2013

Flaska från SB drucken i profilglas. Vackert mörkt stråfärgad, lite disig och bestående vitt skum. Stor doft av jäst och kryddor. Skummar i munnen. Söt, syrlig, lätt pepprig gräsig kryddighet, vetemjöl, blommor, maskrosblad, alkohol, pomeransskal, markant beska. Stora smaker, perfekt balans. En riktigt bra trippel.
Bottle 0.33l at home. BBE 22 06 15. Colour is cloudy golden with small thick white head. Aromas and flavours: Belgian yeast, fruits, citrus, spices and hops. Better than average tripel.

While not my favorite from St. Bernardus (Abt 12), a truly well blended Belgian Tripel, foamy white head over a curry-yellow body. Malt based sugars balance well with mild fragrant hops, with little sting from a relatively high APV. St. Bernie really does ale right. Quality water allows even subtle aspects of flavor to blossom through.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Orangey clear pour with a huge foam head. Slightly skunked. Aroma of banana & bubblegum, yeast some acetate. After working through a layer of delicious boozy foam I was able to get a whiff. Flavor of yeasty honey sweetness. The alcohol is sharp through and though. Also theres some buttery/butterscotch flavor. Complex, but overpowering. I didnt get much in the way of bitterness or sourness. Good mid carb.

Fruchtig, trinkbar, nett im Abgang. Nach vielen belgischen Enttäuschungen und Einheitsbrei, haben wir hier wieder ein nettes Tripel, das zu überzeugen weiß. Fruchtige Aromen und ein fehlender Tabak-Abgang (wie so oft bei der Konkurrenz) sammeln Punkte. Schön.

Bottle, bought in Belgium. It pours out in a hazy amber-golden colour with medium-smooth body and steady, creamy head. Nose of Belgian yeast and hops. Taste of Belgian yeast, strong alcohol, torf, grass, hops and barley. Very fruity finish. Extremly easy to drink, very quaffable and delicious. Not as dull and boring as many other Belgian ones.

Bottle @ Home. Pours hazy amber with a white head. Aroma of malt, wheat, yeast, spice, fruit. Flavor is malt, yeast, spice, coriands, pepper, grass, light fruit. Medium body, lively carbonation. 270210
Taste and aroma were both mainly spicy and fruity. Typical Belgian yeast flavor and aroma.

From the 11.2 fl. oz bottle marked 29-05-15. The pour is slightly cloudy with a pale yellow carbonated look and a decent long lasting foamy head. The aroma is delicate but includes pale malts, Belgian yeast, and a slight herbal note. Quite nice and relaxing. The body is light to medium with a creamy texture. The taste is far more mellow than I would expect from a Tripel with its pale malts, Belgian sugar sweetness, and low to moderate bitterness. How can one go wrong?
Aroma: Yeast, cheese, citrus, grass Appearance: Gold, hazy, clear white head, fine foam and lace Taste: Grass, hint of citrus, malt, light bitter finish
Malty banana slight earthy spice and raisin. Golden Orange body light white head. Clove spice and banana flavors with roasty malt and a little heat in the end. Crisp
Pours a hazy orange. Has a yeasty and wheaty aroma with some hint of lemon. Taste is also a little yeasty and wheaty with some spices. Has some carbonation.

Yeasty aroma of cider, banana and pepper. Classic tripel scent in other words. Very opaque yellow color. Sweet pale malt taste, some zesty alcohol strength, though not a booze laden beer by any means. Only complaint would be that it fades towards the finish. Rich, foamy palate feel emblematic of a strong yeast forward brew. A good tripel and actually my favorite among the brewers lineup.

An everlasting, evergreen brew - in my humble opinion the real standard for Tripels worldwide. Featured with a complex aroma based on a full-bodied cereal, it is enriched with notable fruitiness (golden delicious apples, abate pears) and little esthery notes (banana, butterscotch). Mouth reflexes what can be found in the nose, still it adds a lively carbonation (froth is stable, abundant, white) and hints of spices (clove, white pepper). Whats astonishing in this beer is the balance it boasts, perfect (all the sweet-malty part is supported by the slight closing acidity able to make the beer drinkable and thirst-quenching). Furthermore, its available practically everywhere.

Koud begonnen, als aangeraden, maar dan komt bijna niets door. Aroma is fris zoet, wat bloemen, honing en licht citrus. Smaak is matig zoet, bittere afdronk, wat ijzer, maar algemeen wat gewoontjes. Met St. Bernardus kaas gegeten, maar niet de beste combi.

Light, cloudy, yellow-gold with a large, whipped white head.
Lovely fruity aroma, pear, apple.
Flavour is much more of the same, plus honey notes, spice, white pepper.
Nicely sweet, with a hint of bitter/tart at finish.
Wonderful.

P:  Cloudy orange tinted golden body with a massive mound of ivory cream jiggling on top. 

S:  Pilsner malt, candied sugar malt, marshmallows, clove, pears, peaches, Granny Smith apples, gala apples, cinnamon, spicy barley, sugary pound cake and a great yeast strain.  Subtle banana esters and coconut. 

T/M:  Spicy and fruity taste that follows the above mentioned ingredients. Yeast is great with earthy and fruit forward flavors that are semi powdery. Alcohol presence is sharp and spicy but complimenting.  Great mouthfeel that finishes dry with tea tannins. 

O:   As expected this is a great triple. Super complex profile while being well balanced as well.

Troebel geeloranje. Kan me details weer niet herinneren, had meteen notities moeten maken......   Ik was er niet zwaar van onder de indruk, sterker nog, het viel wat tegen. Ik moet m nog een keer re-raten eigenlijk.

75cl bottle (abv 8% but i think it was actually lower), hazy dark golden color, medium persistent white head, caramel aroma, yeast and citrus notes, sweet honey flavor, medium body, flat, dry finish with some hops and spices notes, nothing special expectations were higher
33cl from Auchan (Luxembourg). Although tripels are not my favourite type of beer this one just got me right. Hazy yellow with nice head. Starts a bit bitter and with a dry end. A nice beer.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2015 On-tap poured into St. Bernardus goblet. Pours a hazy golden-orange color with a white head, nice lacing. Banana, apricot, floral and spicy aromas. Taste - sweet, fruity, spicy and alcoholic flavors, mild bitterness. Medium bodied, high carbonation, slightly dry finish. Great tripel.

Aroma cítrico. Espuma clara, porém baixa. Cor dourada opaca. Sabor leve e cítrico (laranja).

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle pour into glass with nice head, aroma is sweet, light spice.  Taste is crisp but sweet, light spice. Nice tripel

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2013 Rating: 3/5 = World Class,  I would definitely drink this again - Light pour.  About a 1 finger head in the St Bernardus  glass.  Dark orange liquid, almost of a ginger ale color, but a bit darker.   Tons of carbonation and is quite cloudy, like a German wheat.  Excellently attractive lacing with nice alcohol legs.  Aroma is full of traditional triple notes including big yeast and bready tones.  Additional complexities include orange peel, light spice, and mild malts  Upon a second attempt at the aroma is a sweat malty characteristic and a light alcohol barrel character reminiscent of a dubbel or even a quad.  Excellent mouth feel on the palate with a slight creaminess on the finish.  Immediately, you know that this is going to be a good beer.  Finishes with a low alcohol warmness with a light malt flavor that lingers very nicely.     Initial sip is nice and complex with strong bready characteristics with more subtle tastes including an almost faint grape barrel quality.  A great beer, not overly complex, but a fantastic brew with enough depth to continue to drink again and again. Wouldja - yes

Pours a very hazy straw color with a finger of extremely frothy, pure white head, that leaves decent lacing. Nose is very boozy and malty with a lot of sweetness, mainly Yeast, apple, honey and spice. Mouth is delicious. Very sweet and carbonated. sparkling cider like taste with A lot of apple and cloves. A very warming feel.

Très pétillante, elle a "gushé" à louverture, et une tempête de bulles a persisté longtemps dans le verre. Après le calme revenu, cette boisson couleur eau dérable a des arômes de pommes. Douce en bouche, elle est lexemple-type de la triple belge, complexe, un peu sucrée, un brin de houblon. Pas mal, si on oublie le gushing.

Tasted on tap.
Opalesquent golden colour, creamy and lasting white head, soft carbonation.
Fresh yeasty nose and aroma with grain, honey, apples and spices underpainted gently by alcohol.
Slick, creamy mouthfeel.
Long and warming, somewhat corny finish escorted by tart citrusses and bread-crust.
Not the best Tripel I ever had, but still a very nice one.

A pretty good Belgian, but not super unique. Pours a cloudy orange. Smells like green apples and herbs. Taste is classic Belgian style, with more green apples. Has a bite. Had in the bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Poured a lively light golden with a frothy white head. Aroma of sweet spiced floral hops. Medium body, flavour of honey sweet citrus with a residual sourness.

lively carbonation . Blonde a little cloudly, big head, Some lacing,
Slight Aroma A liitle flowery taste. dry finish, no aftertaste. Not bitter
Una de las mejores tripel. Un sabor complejo entre afrutado, cítrico, especies y dulces y amargos. Muy bien balanceada la relación cuerpo gas.
bottle at royal mile,  clear gold w/medium head. Aroma is spicy and fruity.  Taste is orange,  apricot some spicy as well. pretty good , woudl do again

UPDATED: OCT 4, 2013 his beer, with high fermentation, has a pale amber colour and a flowery, fruity taste with a harmonious balance between sweet and sour (8% alcohol content). This beer has a thick and vivid froth and strikes by its balanced taste with a delicate bitterness.

UPDATED: MAY 25, 2013 Blonde dorée légèrement trouble, belle mousse crémeuse, bonne pétillance. Légère amertume plus quagréable: herbeuse et épicée, caramélisée sur la fin. Ronde et longue en bouche.
UPDATED: AUG 17, 2013 Bread, cereal, floral, citrus, herbs, ginger, woody, bottle fermented beer, 8%, clove, st. Bernardus
Cloudy gold,large white head.Salty,yeasty aloholic nose.Softly carbonated spicy yeast palate,light alcohol heat.Medium hop finish. Fruity notes in nose and palate..Great lace

Bottle. Pours a slightly cloudy yellow color with a fluffy white head. Banana and a wheat like aroma in the nose. Medium/light mouthfeel. Pretty carbonated. Banana with a slight bitterness, florals, and wheat. Slightly sweet. 8% really doesnt show.
Hoppier than most Belgians. Caramel aroma with a hint of bread. Fruity, but dry in the end. Medium bitterness lingers long. Alcohol well-hidden. One of the best tripels that I know of.

Beyaz dolgun bir köpük, bulanık sarı-portakal bir renk,biranın bardaktaki görüntüsü çok çekici.
Kokuda tatlılık hakim, tipik bir belçika tripel birası.
Tadım ise önce gazlılık, ardından meyve tatları ve bitirişte hafif acılık içeriyor. Bir tripel kalsiği

Pours lively and highly carbonated.  Blonde in colour with a slight haze and a copious white head that dissipates to about 1/4 inch.  Some lacing, but not very much.  Aroma of tropical fruit, banana, a hint of passionfruit, along with a yeasty background.  Taste is bready biscuity.  Not much maltiness there.  Very dry finish, with a slight lingering aftertaste.  Low bitterness, but noticeable in the finish.  Slight alcoholic heat in the finish as well.  This is a very well made beer.  Id buy it again.
Really good Tripel with a sweet candied fruit flavor. Pours well, has an appealing appearance. Remarkably smooth, finishes well with a nice hint of sour to finish. I would recommend this beer.

Bought a 330ml bottle at Berts Bierhuis. Has a soapy white head and is highly carbonated. Aroma of fruits, spices and bananas. Taste of citrus fruits, caramel, spices and herbs. Taste is a little sweet and the aftertaste is medium bitter. A very good Tripel.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2014 Flaska @ Systembolaget. Ljus bärnstensfärgad grumlig vätska med högt vitt skum. Inslag av bananton, passion och maltsötma. Fyllig munkänsla. Sötma och lite beska. Lång eftersmak.

Pours honey gold color. Fluffy white head. Nice lacing. Sweet and fruity. Smells of cinnamon, nutmeg and fruit. Slightly dry finish. An excellent beer.
Thanks to Jordan for finding this in a basement and giving it to me!

Bouteille 330ml. De couleur dorée foncée et voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes de pommes, traces de bananes), de malt sucré aux notes rôties, léger dalcool et dépices (poivre, notes de clou de girofle) avec des notes de houblon floral .Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-élevé ainsi quune texture légèrement huileuse. Goût de levures fruitées et aux petites notes acides (agrumes, notes de bananes, de prunes vertes et de pommes) légèrement épicées (poivre doux, petites traces de clou de girofle) lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût goût de malt sucré aux faibles notes rôties, léger de pain et de miel puis en finale lon retrouve une légère chaleur dalcool douce combinée à une légère amertume de houblon herbeux. Post-goût moyen-long,  composé dune légère amertume dalcool  et de houblon herbeux avec un goût de levures fruitées (zeste dagrumes) aux notes épicées ainsi quavec des traces mielleuses. (2006)

UPDATED: APR 25, 2013 Magnificent! 750ml bottle pours out bright straw with heaps of foam. the smells are straw and sweet pale malt and yeast. the weight is light but it has so much flavour that lingers between sips.. great with asian food- a superb beer all round. a favourite
Bottle from Slowbeer. Great tripel. Aromas of bread, with notes of caramel. Taste is sweet, with light sourness, long length. Palate is creamy. Yellow, with a big frothy head.

Pours a cloudy light orange brew with a big white head with good retention, aroma is moderate sweet and moderate to low bitter with orange, spices, banana, medium bodied, flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and moderate to low bitter with orange, banana, spices, sweet finish,

33cl bottle, 8%. Appearance:Orange color, particles in suspension, big bubbly white head, fizzy look. Lots of lacing. 
Fuity nose. Aroma is fruity, ripe yellow fruit, amaretto and noticeable fuel tones of whiskey, possibly a note of white chocolate. Lots of esters and malts with spicy yeast. Taste is sweet and sour, with a proper hops bitter bang. Creamy mouthfeel, full bodied, complex, heavy, tasty. 
Probably good as dessert along with cream, cakes. Reminds me of Chimay Cinq Cents (rated 4.0), this is more "round" and sweeter, the other is more crisp and spicy. Quality product and well worth.
August 2010. Pours amber color with a white head. Fruit and citrus on the nose. Smooth long finish.

Bottle from Debucas. Pours out a deep clear golden color with a thick frothy white head. Cloudy off the bottom with yeast in. Lovely yeast profile throughout. Fruity and citrus. Some sweet peppery bread. Some apple and pear on the backside. Very good overall.

75cl bottle from 1,5 years old.
Appearance: clear blonde beer, small stable head.
Nose: caramel, yeast, spices, dried fruits.
Taste: fruits, alcohol noticeable, rather sweet, caramel.

Paired with roasted pork tenderloin, apples, leaks and fennel.  Accentuates the flavor of the fennel and mixes well with the other flavors as well.  Smells like belgian yeast, honey, and some sort of spicey note.  Tastes sweet and sour but is well balanced.

Hazy orange colour, with thick creamy head. Smells malts, coriandre, and other spices, also honey. Taste is bitter, but very spicey, with sweetness always detectable. Very rich mouthfeel, also alcohol is clear, but in a nice way. Amazing, St. Bernardus is always great!
some fruitiness and a alcohol burn. A bit tart. The aroma is more intense than the flavor. Nevertheless a complex and delicious beer

0.33l bottle from beermerchants.com I think. This has a massive big and really hanging in there just off-white fluffy head on top of a blurry honey-golden body, packed with floaters following the carbonation bubbles. It looks pretty darn good this one! On the aroma this I get fruity tones of orange and lemonade, some strong and sharp alcohol tones lurking underneath some yeasty and almost spicy tones. Yeah, its average to lively carbonated, full-bodied with a mild oily texture. First thing hitting the buds is warming sweet alcohol and Belgian yeast. When that fades a bit ( after a few sips) I get some dry caramel, tones of flowers, leafs and it ends in a light warming and lasting finish. A true classic this one, and I enjoyed all the way. 22.06.2012
UPDATED: JUL 28, 2016 Pours an orangegolden color with a large white head. Taste is fruity, sour, spicy and a bit bitter. Nice Tripel.
UPDATED: JUN 23, 2013 Excellente triple dabbaye. Ronde et équilibrée. Goût bien fruité et épicé, des notes florales équilibrées dans une légère amertume et une légère acidité.

Bouteille 330 ml. Robe ambrée, surmontée dun épais collet blanc mousseux. Arôme: levure belge, malts et fruits. Goût: malt, levures, agrumes. Très bonne balance entre le sucré et lamertume. Ronde en bouche. Très bonne bière.

Pours a cloudy golden color with white frothy head. Smells of yeast, hay, and lemon. Tastes of yeast and citrus with slight bitterness and slight sweetness. Nice balance. Feels bubbly on the tongue with nice carbonation and the alcohol is very well incorporated. Delicious Belgian Ale.

pours hazy pale but bright yellow with a frothy white head, very good retention and lacing. bready and doughy, lightly toasted malts, yeasty - lemony too, booze, herbs and flowers, maybe coriander, very hint of acidity and very few lightly oxidated notes, probably aged hops. lively carbonation - almost prickly, some sweetness, medium body - oily, very nice sustained medium long grassy, citrusy and spicy finish. very nice offering!

Bottle.  Dark golden yellow pour, effervescent carbonation and an aroma of fruity, yeasty pears and a little nice sugar.  Flavor is also lightly yeasty flowers, rich sweet pears and a little spice on the finish.  Yum.

Bottle. Pours a somewhat hazy golden, with a big creamy head. Aroma is a yeast, apricot, kandi and grain. Full body, with a soft carbonation. flavour is sour with a nice yeast, fruitiness and orange peel, grain and kandi sweetness. Nice tripel.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. Nice big beer. Fruity and floral with some heat. Very sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
330 ml bottle, rated from backlog. Aroma of fruit, sugar and yeast. Taste is malty, candy and fruity, alcohol with a little grassy finish

330 ml bottle, poured into a tulip glass at home. ABV 8%.
Despite my careful pour, I got some little yeast chunks in my glass, but that doesnt matter that much. Light orange copper in colour, with two fingers of white, soapy head. Very good retention on the foam and a slight lacing on the the glass.
Aroma is fruity, with very obvious yeast and sugar notes.
Quite sweet on the taste. Again, yeast, sugars, some light banana on the aftertaste, along with a very faint alcohol trace, more notable by the warmth it gives rather than the taste to be honest. Nice and complex.
Medium on the body, good carbonation and a tart feeling on the palate.
Now, although I am fan of more bitter and hoppier examples of the style, this one had a nice complexity and balance of flavours. Very good tripel.

[0.3 bottle, served: beer glass]

In general Im not huge fan of these "St. Bernardus"(like only 12th and 8th ones), even I really like Belgian style beer. But his one was a really great surprise.

Appearance: very thick with massive "beer precipitate" in glass, thats not allowing any light beam to get through the glass. But looks outstanding.

Aroma: casual Belgian style aroma, with some sour yeast, but Ive always like it so, yeah, this rules.

Taste: some minimal bitterness with great feel of citrus a like hops, very pleasant combination. Nothing really special in this beer, but some good Belgian tripel. Yeah, and as always, at least with these Bernardus, very high carbonization.
I knew the Berardus Abt was one of the best in the word so I was curious about the Trippel. And its one of the best Ive ever had! Great taste, not to strong alcohol taste, a very smooth drink!
UPDATED: MAR 17, 2013 Peut-être la meilleure bière du monde. Belle robe, douceur et rondeur avec pourtant un caractère certain... un délice.

Pours a clear golden with a nice lacing. Aroma is fruity with some candy sugar, yeasty. Taste is malty, candy and fruity, a little grassy finish and little alcohol warmt. Drinkability a nice with a good lacing. Good carbonation Good reference of the style. Would drink again for sure.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

.33L bottle (best by 8/2014 dated) served in a Piraat tulip glass. 

A: The beer is a pale orange-amber color, hazy with a towering, creamy tan head, some of which lasts until the end, and leaves some lace on the glass.

S: The fruity/floral aroma reflects Belgian yeast, light malts and a touch of hops. Excellent for style. 

T: probably the best tasting tripel Ive ever had.  The toasted malts are a bit more apparent than usual, banana and clove make up only a small portion of the complex flavor, and the sweet/bitter/tart mix is superb. 

M: Crisp and very smooth; medium body; medium-high carbonation, slightly dry finish.

O: World class.

330 ml bottle. Pours a nice hazy orange with a thick, resilient white head. Aroma is oranges and yeast. Flavor is very lemony, some orange, loads of vanilla cake and bread. Finish is mostly citrusy, lemon zest dominates. Very easy drinking, a great brew.

Body is perfect amber color. Head is big bubbled, disappears leaving moderate and thin compact layer. Abundant sediment. Nose is malty, bread, hay, some hops as fruity and herbaceous. Moderate body; carbonation  also , high alcohol but not unpleasant. Final is well balanced, long, though perhaps too alcoholic in my humble opinion. 
Taste maybe lacks some character and personality, but the whole picture is correct. A bit of licorice, vanilla and caramel ... A little rough due to alcohol.

Hazy orange with giant, flotsam, white head / Mellow, candied funky nose of orchard & tropical fruit, cream, and old sock / Medium body, vibrant fine-bubbled carbonation, modest sweetness, creamy, more malty and sweet than hoppy, hinting a cloying but good balance and some light bitterness on the finish brings it back / Flavors of orange, passion fruit, clove, coriander, coconut, cream, and a little barnyard / A fine expression of the Belgian art.

A hazy, golden color with a huge, fluffy head.  The aroma is rich, sweet and just outstanding.  I picked up on apples and nutmeg and something like Ritz crackers  Thats right, I said Ritz crackers.  The taste and mouthfeel are really very good.  The flavor is rich and balanced, with sweetness and hop burn mixing perfectly and mingled notes of fruit, buttered bread and spice.  I love this beer.
Drank at the buitenlust. from bottle to glass.. medium white foamy head which rapidly disappeared dark yellow light brown colour.. smell malts taste also malts low carbo.. overall very good beer..

Beautiful pils malt aroma and taste - even from the bottle they flourish.  Taste is similar, and then the fruity esters hit in the finish, especially apple.  zomg this is delicious!  This is my new favorite tripel.  NOMNOM!

By gum!  This is a beer with some balls! Aroma f straw and barnyard. Thick head. Great flavour vanilla fudge then tangerine then biscuit. Sweet to dry via citrus. Carbonation lifts the beer so it does not taste as strong as it is .... dengerous!

I havent had a lot of these, but I like the style. I am not a huge fan of a dubbel, and I LOVE a good quad... so it makes sense I would somewhat like these. This one is a staple, and is a great example of a tripel. Its very good, sweet, and has just enough bubbles to start like a champagne but finishes smooth, balanced, and somewhat thick. This is not a bad brewery, and everything they make is a solid offering. Oh, and the aroma smells like straw. Its fun! Its not cheap, but a good offering from a great brewery.

Weird trapist, cause in palette it is as should be, but there is no so much sweet malty profile, like incomplete. Aroma of citrus, bread, bit yeasty flavor. Medium spicy on tongue, above average body, fizzy one. Pours hazy golden with white top, middle lasting frothy one, small lacing. Very light bitter from hopping in late stages. In conclusion - nice one, but maybe could be more malty and more intensive in aroma.

Appearance: Golden brew topped by an ample head. 
Aroma: spicy notes mingled with some honey sweetness and maybe a little grasss.
Taste: Medium sweet with a restrained alcohol warmth, not too hot. Flavors are honey-like again but this time with a fruity twist that reminds me of these golden delicious apples.
Mouthfeel: Body is just right and the medium carbonation makes it so unaggressive that Id argue that it isnt legal for a tripel to be easy drinking like that.
Overall: Let me start off by telling that Im not the biggest tripel lover out there and I usually stay clear of them. This product however I thoroughly enjoyed and will be looking for it from now on.

Bottle 330ml.
Pours clear golden with high white head. Extreme lacing. Aroma is of malt, candi-like sugar, flowers, fruits. Taste is of malt, caramel, candi-like sugar, fruits. Palate: medium body. Overall: Good.

UPDATED: APR 11, 2013 appearance: Dark golden, almost orange slightly hazy color. Good white foam, nice lacing.

smell: I get some ripe tropical fruits, yeasty, wheaty and sugar.

taste: It starts with a fresh fruity and herbal flavor, into a more defined banana bread sugary flavor. Finishes surprisingly light and fluid with some caramel flavor to it. Cant really get my finger around it. There is also some creaminess to it. 

mouthfeel: Quite creamy, but also quite some carbonation to break through it, making it fresh. 

overall: I just love this beer. Its somehow hard to really pinpoint the flavors. There is so much going on, and yet its a very easy to drink beer. Its a mystery to me. Making this beer very interesting when focused on it, and very, very drinkable when just relaxing and having a beer. Highly recommended.

Bottle (330 ml). Clear golden with a medium white head and good lacing. Aroma is of yeast and fruits along with noble hops and grain. Taste is malty and yeasty with grain, fruits and slight caramel notes. Grassy finish. Medium carbonation. Couldnt be more on style. Extreme drinkability for a 8% abv beer. Very good Tripel!

Great tripel aldo Belgium style it has notes of German influences. The body of this beer is full and has a great balance and long smooth after tast. This beer is brewed using the same yeast as the St bernardus abt that has is origin from Westvleteren. A must tast beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone By Belleketels
UPDATED: FEB 23, 2013 Larôme épicé avec des fruits et du levure. Un goût de malt et fruits avec une finale sucré et légèrement amer.

11.2oz bottle. Code on back indicates best by is 16/9/14. Mildly hazy golden orange color. Lots of dark sediment in the body. A sort of snotty dark film swirling around in there, too. Big puffy white head, with good retention. Good, thick lace. Estery, fruity, yeasty aroma. Big banana. Some citrus. Sweeter taste, lightly sour finish. Stronger, soft carbonation. Bigger body. Dry texture. Taste and texture are kind of strange, but the aroma is great. Pros and cons add up to a decent, though unusual, tripel

330ml bottle into a goblet.

Pours a medium orange with quite a bit of sediment making it into the glass. Tons of carbonation with a white fluffy two finger head that has ridiculous staying power. Awesome lacing as well.

Aroma is just about perfect for a Tripel. Lots of coriander and clove along with some spicy orange. Hints of alcohol but they remain in the background.A little bit of bready malt and yeasty spiciness.

Lots of coriander and spice in the flavor along with a huge punch of orange. Light bread in the background but the yeast and spicy flavors really dominate. Alcohol comes forward a little bit towards the finish with the mouthfeel being bone dry as it should be in the style. Just a touch of stickyness on the lips.

Overall, an excellent example of a Tripel and one that is a great pleasure to drink. Ill have to pick this one up again.
Bottle. Hazy golden color, medium size head. Looks nice. Hops, slightly bready, malty, fruity, yeasty notes in aroma. Citrus, malty, creamy, bready flavor.
Blonde in colour, taste is yeasty, some peaches and slightly sweet, quite a nice beer
Blond, licht troebel bier met grote witte schuimkraag. Kruidig aroma, hinten van groen fruit (appel, peer) en deeg. Gebalanceerd van smaak. Complex, maar toch fris. Prima tripel!

Outra clássica da St Bernadus! Ótima Tripel belga, dourada turva no copo, desprendendo um aroma frutado, lembrando pêssego, bananas e pão. No paladar, herbáceo com gosto novamente de frutas amarelas, com pouco predomínio do álcool. Alta carbonataçao, conferindo um caráter picante na breja. Retrogosto estupendo e duradouro. Excelente!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a cloudy yellow. Fruity, yeasty and sweet.  Tastes of bread and spices. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Appearance: Cloudy yellow color with a big bubbly white head. Nice lacing.Aroma: Fruity, yeast, citric and a bit acidic.Palate: Medium to full body. A bit sweet and some bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Citric, fruity, acidic, some spices and a fine mild malty background. Well hidden alcohol.Overall impression: Classy, complex, refreshing and tasty. Outstanding! I am going to buy a lot more. Amazed!Personal stats: Bottle  from Slijterij t Fust in Hoorn, Netherlands.

Quite clear gold colour with lacey medium head. Aroma is spicy and fruity. I get oranges and apricot with some bread and banana. Creamy body. Taste is pleasantly sweet, but tangy and spicy as well. Just a little bitterness is enough to create a refreshing finish that still lingers nicely.

pours a cloudy straw yellow with a billowing head.malt,overripe melon,coriander and pepper are what im picking up on aroma.flavor is malty sweet with a balance of citrus acidity.full bodied,heavy carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel.finish is slightly dry and crisp.very nice beer all around.

Aromas of shortbread, flowers, granny smith apples, coconut, and melon.  Hazy, pale apricot, with a mostly lasting, white head.  The taste contains very little sweetness, with hints of butter cookies and subtle fruity flavors, and dries up very quickly with light, earthy hop bitterness.  Medium-full body, very creamy and smooth with spicy overtones, and finishes quite abruptly, leaving behind soft, dry, malty notes.  This is a beer that offers so much throughout all of the brilliantly subtle nuances, and maintains such clarity on the palate; one of the most refreshing beers I have ever had, despite all of the fascinating complexity.

Pours a cloudy yellow colour with some small spotty white head. Aromas are moderately spicy, yeast, fruity, orange citrus, floral, perfumy. Flavours of orange citrus, mild bitterness, soft malt, spicy/fruity/alcohol blend, and a dry finish.

Pours a hazy golden color with a big frothy white head that dissipates into a sml white hat with nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of fruity esthers, pepper, orange peel & some light floral notes. Taste is a great mix of spiciness, fruit and alcohol with some soft malt notes in the background. Finishes fairly dry with a high carbonation & a low bitterness. Nice creamy mouth feel, overall a great tripel that is bigger than it seems.
UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 330ml bottle at BXL East. Pours hazy golden color with big fluffy white head. Aromas of flowers and fruit with a fruity, yeasty, spicy, slightly bitter taste. Good stuff.

33cl at La Maison Belge, Puerto de la Cruz. Pours slightly hazy (dark) golden with a white head. Classic Belgian tripel aroma; fruity, yeasty and malty with notes of honey and flowers. Fruity and refreshing with well integrated alcohol. Decent triple. Dangerously drinkable.  (2013-01-05)

Pale yellow and a little hazy with tight white, foamy and big head and little lacing.  Juicy fruit and apricot on nose with some funk.  Spicy with some light fruit and sweetness from malt and also slight grain and tad bit of tartness.  Nice funkiness like a Saison while white pepper dominates in finish.  Medium/high carbonation with moderate mouthfeel.  Very nice tripel that I would love to try again.  Impressed.    

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Did not enter amy comments at the time I tried this but remember not liking it as much as he double.  Will try again so I can enter more specific comments.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours cloudy orange with white head that disappeared quickly. Aroma is wheat, malt, orange, yeast, hint of alcohol and raisins. Flavor is malt, wheat, alcohol, orange, yeast.
Pours a fizzy peach with a great froth. Fruity, flowery aroma. Tastes similar with some hay and pear. Sweet and delicious. Light palate.

Pours a hazy golden amber with a very effervescent head. Faint aromas of citrus and flowers. Tastes follows with same with a slightly bitter finish to balance sweetness upfront. Mouthfeel is light and fizzy. A decent brew, but more flavorful and complex tripels out there. 

--- Cheers

330 ml bottle. Pours pale gold, clear, with a thick dense white head. Aroma is surprisingly fruity, maybe the yeast but it smells a lot like the 12, lots of pear, berries, light grain. Taste is slightly sweet, berry flavors, lots of pear, light grainy finish. Palate is well carbed, light and fluffy, true Belgian drinkability.

75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100722.
Pours golden color with a large head. Aroma of citrus fruits, yeast, spice notes, toffee and some earth notes. Flavor of yeast, ripe fruits, toffeen and caramel, mild spices also. Very nice and balanced.
Poured from 12oz bottle. Golden color with thin white head. A lot of yeast aroma. Theres a strong fruit taste of banana, with a malty finish.

750ml bottle. No BBE that I could find. Pours an orangey gold with a white ring of a head. Aroma is a lot of bready malt, like smelling a fresh loaf of yeast bread. There is also some banana as well as dried apricot. Taste is a lot of dried fruit character with some spiciness there as well. The maltiness isnt as strong as in the aroma. Ethanol makes an appearance on the finish, drying the flavor up so no sweetness comes through. On the first pour, the taste is a bit difficult to get since the carbonation is so strong that the beer doesnt stand still on your tongue. Letting it sit a while helps with this. Palate is full and chewy. An alright tripel, but not one of my favorites. Too carbonated and too ethanolic even though the ABV isnt that big for a tripel.
Bottle. Pours a cloudy light amber color with a moderate white head. Nose is  a sweet yeasty smell thats fairly strong. Taste is both sweet and sour with an almost citrus note. Not a huge fan.
Excellent. I dont know why they stop bringing these beers here but were amazing. I guess lager guys are not interested. Great body and foam, great shape and aftertaste.
It pours a hazy golden color with a thick creamy head . Nice floral and citrus taste. Very light and sweet crisp aftertaste.

Aroma is malty, caramel, yeasty esters like a tad of banana. Appearance is a yellow opaque colour with a fine head - a touch of lace. Taste is banana, a lot like the nose. Great mouthfeel - pleasant and refreshing while still being musky and damp on the tongue.
Bottle. Alcohol nose. Banana and some spice at first taste. Golden and a bit hazy. Nice head.

a truly nice blend of malt and hops a hint of carmel and lemmon grass color amber and hazy with a tan head taste sweet medium a medium body with a creamy lively abrupt  taste i would recommend this beer

Bottle @ Belgian Brew Fest.  My notes at this point in the festival get it a little sketchy.  I wrote "excellent - well balanced sweetness..." I will re-rate after my next tasting in a more hospitable environment.
Smells of smooth banana and a hint of spice. Flavour is lusciously sweet and full bodied.
Some cloves. I wish I was always good. Im not. Thats good though right??

UPDATED: DEC 28, 2012 Aroma: lemon, sweet perhaps

Appearance: golden, cloudy, not transparent, very dense white head that lasts, some particles floating

Taste: faint sweetness initially fades to a slight bitter aftertaste, some fruity ness only if you really concentrate, lemon in there too

Palate:dry, pretty carbonated, very frothy, just enough bitter aftertaste

Overall: good beer, a bit of a let down from what I was expecting, but I had very high hopes. Worth drinking again though with out a doubt. Cant taste the 8% abv at all

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33cL Bottle, purchased at Downtown Wine & Spirits - Somerville, MA. Sandalwood, spice, and pils malt aroma. Fluffy and fresh. Alcohol warmth is nicely melded into a clean and soft body that expresses a bit of candied lemon peel, distant ginger, and gentle phenol spice. Creamy in the finish. This is very good. It doesnt blow me away with build and complexity, but its very solid, reliable, and enjoyable, with a nice juicyfruit finish.

Bottle at the Paters Vaetje, Antwerp.  Poured a slightly cloudy yellow straw colour. The aroma is weak but yeasty and dry. The flavour is typical of the style which is dry yeasty and with a slightly alcoholic burn and a nice bitterness in the aftertaste. A very decent Tripel as one might expect from St Bernardus.

More of a hazy look that a Westmalle Tripel this beer struggles of keep a constant thinnish head. Theres a firm zesty honey quality on the nose as it begins spritzy and ends with a zing. Doesnt delivery the complexity or development Id expect from a top flight tripel. Decent but not great.
Bottle (0,33l). Aroma is fruity and citrus. Pours a hazy yellow with a big head. Tastes fruity and a little yeasty. Carbonation is lively and mouthfeel is soft. Nice for a tripel.

Poured from a bomber. Pours hazy golden in color with a decent amount of carbonation. Huge head. Citrus floral aroma. Sweet fruity taste. Strong orange flavor. Nice lacing. Medium body and the alcohol is well masked.

330ml bottle - Cloudy dark yellow colour with small white lace. Nice aroma of spices, banana, grapefruit and sweetened oranges. Quite sweet flavour of oranges, marmalade, lemon and toffee. Yeasty finish.

Pours a hazy gold  with a good amount of fine white head and a bit of sediment. Smell is somewhat hoppy with some grass and pine, and also quite sweet with some caramel and also a bit of bready yeast. Palate is medium bodied with lots of very soft carbonation. Taste is a bit bitter at first but then gives way to a bit of sweetness and a lasting slight bitterness with some mineral content and a bit of alcohol that gives a long lasting warmness.

Finally getting around to reviewing this beer. Thanks to Jeff for leaving it in my fridge.

Served in a Duvel oversized tulip.

The beer is a murky orange color. The fluffy white head is gargantuan, encompassing the upper half of the vessel, leaving copious lacing on stuck on the walls.

The aroma is oranges, yeast, bread, spice. Wow, this smells fantastic.

Complex, well balanced, fabulous. Coriander really comes through. Citrus and yeast blended to perfection. One of the best tripels I have ever had.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-31-2012
Flaske fra Begisk Bryg: et stjerneeksempel på hvordan en tripel skal være - fruktig, smaksrik og sterk uten at alkoholen skinner gjennom. Et forbilledlig øl som jeg bare må kjøpe flere av!
Eccezzionale! Di una bontà indescrivibile!!!

Look: Nice golden yellow, nice frothy white head. Smell: Spices, lemon citrus, hay, little honey, mild oats, sour notes (green apples maybe), little banana.  Taste: Follows the aroma, spices, lemon tart, apples, wheat dough, fruity notes,  Feel: medium-light body, lively carbonation. Overall: This is a text book example of a tripel. No off flavors, no alcohol burn. Not as sour as the aroma tells. This is a very good brew. Recommended.

Pours a rich orange golden color with a two finger frothy head that floats and sticks nicely. Aromas are yeasty fruit, apple, pear, touch of bread and booze. On the palate its big and rich with ripe floral notes mingling with yeasty spice and some sweet ripe fruit flavors to pull it all together. Nice touch of bitterness shines through on the finish to clean it all up.

A blond cloudy pale with white head.  Apple nose with some bananas.  Pears and apples mixed with caramels mingling with lots more fruits.  Not too sweet, dry finish.  Well blended, nothing stands out.
Great sweet, spicy, yeasty flavor with a nice clean finish. This is a terrific tripell
Light golden pour, quite large head that reduces to a lacing, aroma of banana, coriander, floral notes and belgian yeast. Average carbonation. Nice beer.

Hazy orange pour with a huge white head. Lots of sweet banana, sugar, and bready malt. Light toast, pears, and apple esters. Plenty of yeast and a bit of clove spiciness. Very nice malt sweetness, lots of sugar, and tons of banana, too. Some orange peel, a lot of pear ester, and an excellent clove flavor. Plenty of yeast and a mild toastiness. An excellent tripel.

Cloudy, very light brown; yeast and caramel nose; malty sweetness initially, light fruit and spice, oranges, lemon and pepper; generally restrained; nice, well balanced, but felt it a little too peppery and just lacking a bit of oomph, really. A relative disappointment - expectations were high.

330 mL bottle from Total Wine in Virginia Beach, VA.  Yellowish-orange pour with a foamy white head.  Aroma of bready yeast and light citrus.  Taste is clean with a nice balance of citrus, floral hops, and light bitterness.  This is a top notch tripel.
330ml Bottle - Amber/golden with a haze and a foamy head. Grain, marmalade, malt and spice in the aroma. Sweet, fruity and hoppy taste with notes of tea, apricot, lemon and malt. Very easy to drink.

Bottle 0,33l. Aroma of orange peel and spices. Tadte of citrus and banana with sweet and sour undertones. Fizzy palate with medium+ carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

alla spina. non sono mai rimasto deluso dalla produzione del birrificio st. bernardus, e nemmeno bevendo questa tripel lo sono, effettivamente :)
la schiuma derivata dalla spina sembra una crema e si sente un delicato aroma floreale e di lievito, ma sparisce immediatamente (probabilmente a causa della temperatura di servizio un po bassa). in bocca emerge un mielato eccellente e ben bilanciato da un leggero tono di acidità. sul finale emergono note amare di luppolo dai sentori erbacei. mi stupisce la grande scorrevolezza di questa birra, che, nonostante la gradazione non certo soft, invita a prenderne subito un altro calice. certamente non è una birra miracolosa, ma è di fattura indubbiamente elevata, e comunque è difficile aspettarsi dei prodigi da birre come le tripel che, a mio parere e non solo mio, sono generalmente birre di facile approccio, e non avranno mai (o quasi) una profondità rilevante.

Tripel duft. Gul uklar kun let boblende skum. Smager især af appelsin men også fersken og abrikos og marzarin tærte. Meget kulsyre. Brusende i munden. Ligger sig som sød marcipan i eftersmagen. Mangler mere gang i den.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottiglia da 75 cl. Bel colore giallo scuro con un buon cappello di schiuma bianca di grana media abbastanza persistente. Il suo aspetto migliore è nei profumi che vanno dalla frutta a polpa gialla alluva matura con un leggero sentore di coriandolo. Al palato si presente con un corpo bello pieno ed un dolce iniziale che lascia spazio ad un fine amaro speziato sul finale.

Assaggiata in bottiglia da 33 cl. Ottimo laspetto con schiuma finissima, vaporosa e persistente. Pure avendo una gradazione alcolica abbastanza elevata, al naso è molto delicata, aromatica e floreale. Dolce al punto giusto,  mai stucchevole, al palato risulta piena e corposa. A questo si aggiunga che il finale è prolungatissimo e piacevole

#1382
Hellgelb, trüb, üppiger Schaum. Frisches Aroma nach grünem Apfel, leicht hefig, minimal spritig. Im Geschmack ebenso: Fruchtig, hefig und im Abgang wärmender Alkohol. Insgesamt ziemlich ausgewogenes Tripel mit guter Süffigkeit.

Bottle at home (Spar, Popperinge) - 22/10/12.
Almost clear golden blonde with a thin off white head that soon clears to form a puddle and to the edge.
Nose comprises caramel, Belgian yeast, a little honey, sweet candied sugar and a touch of spice.
Tastes of dark fruits, Belgian yeast strains, cloves, spice and a little booze.
Medium bodied with some bite but let down by being overly carbonated for this style (in my opinion).
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 33cl bottle. A 8% beer which could be drank easily because it is very tasty. One of the best Abbey beer I ever tasted.

On tap at Belgian Beer Weekend, Brussels. Has an unclear straw-yellow colour with a solid compact off-white head. Aromas of pale malt, coriander, citrus and herbs. Pretty sweet and fruity flavours with pear, belgian yeast, grass, and more spices and herbs, and some hops in the end. Fantastic! Slick and soft mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A wonderful tripel, and would be very good with food and cheeses.
Celkem chutny tripel, s nabehem na psenku. Etiketa pro teply hochy. Lahvac dovezeny z bruselu.
33cl bottle from cervezalandia. Golden color. Medium to large white head. Balanced sweet/bitter taste. Wheat, fruit, malt aroma.
Clove and orange run riot over the palate in the classic Belgian style. Nice well balanced hop to balance this make this new of the more drinkable Tripels. Recommend!

Pours hazy golden with monster head. Smells of belgian spice. Taste is solid, with light feuit and yeast. Good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle 75 cl. Pours hazy pale amber in color with a massive white head. Bread, clove, sweet sugar and yeast in aroma. Sweet malty notes in flavour along with hints of spices and bready malt.

Orange peel, a hint of banana, spices, barnyard, and other yeasty notes in the aroma. The taste is a bit more citrusy than the aroma, with sweet and sour undertones. It finishes like, well, orange peel. Fizzy palate with lively carbonation.

75 cl bottle @ home, no BBE info
Aroma has soapy citrus, floral notes and hints of peppery spices. Very smooth, creamy and somewhat foamy palate. Flavour has soapy citrus, peppery spices, some orange peel, coriander and floral notes. Good and typical tripel.

Bottle at my office. Pours cloudy golden with a small white head. Aroma of bready and caramel malts, fruits, and a trace of yeast. Taste is Moderate sweet malty, mixed with a light alcohol burn, spices and yeast. Well hidden alcohol, sticky/light acidy mouthfeel. Good tripel.

Bottle 330ml @ my parents place
Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, yeast and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long fruity and yeasty finish. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Spicy palate, aroma of licorice, not quite the towering head of a Karmaliet. Body is just about right, almost oily. Nice tripel, but not my favorite....
A little yeast in the aroma.  A little skunky, not unpleasantly so.  Flirts with a hint of sweetness.  Very slightly bitter finish.  Light bodied.  Not bad but nothing special.

0.3l bottle from Brews Bros in Pittsburgh. Served in the glass it came with (gift pack). Appearance: Cloudy orange, fine, frothy beige head. Some visible carbonation. Aroma: lavender, orange, vanilla, plums, hints of raisin, banana. Palate: thick bodied, medium carbonation, dry finish. Taste: Sweet start, moves to very bitter in the finish. Alcohol taste is really prevalent.
Volle body en bijna niet te herkennen bitterzoete afdronk. Bloemig / fruitig aroma, volle schuimkraag. Redelijk
Hazy orange with flocks of yeast, white head. Aroma and taste orange fruits, dough, malt .good body nice carbo.

Bottle at home. 
Dark yellow hazy color with white one finger head. 
Aroma of pepper,honey sugar. 
Spicy taste and yet sweet and some bitteness in the aftertaste. 
Really nice ale. 

Bolton Brew Rocks !!

Very good.  Floral and slightly fruit like aroma, maybe apricots.  Deep golden with a well formed white head.  Sweet with a somewhat sharp bitterness.  Smooth with a medium body and a middle ground finish.
Hazy blond coloured beer with a nice white head.Very good freh and complex aroma. The well balanced flavour is sweet an yeasty. The best tripel I have had already. (Bottle 33cl)

On draught at Global Brew.  Taps a hazy orange color with a full small bead white head.  Aroma is banana and clove.  Taste is sweet pale malt and wheat germ along with the obligatory bananas and cloves once again.  What separates this tripel from the pack is its smoothness, drinkability and balance.  Its not edgy at all and the alcohol is unnoticable.  Great stuff.

75 cl. bottle poured in to a trappist glass. Hazy, golden-orange with a big, fluffy, white head. Sweet aroma with lots of fruits, yeasts, citrus, orange peel, and spices like cloves. Medium sweet taste. Medium to full body, creamy texture, lively carbonation. Long lasting sweet finish with lots of exotic fruit, yeasts and a hint of alcohol. Excellent tripel, highly recommended.

Pours a hazy orange with a small fizzy white head.  Not much retention or lacing.  Aroma is fruit (pear, banana) and spice.  A trace of yeast.  Taste is pear, banana, some lemon and spice.  Decent tripel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled, 0.33l. Clear orange golden color with small frothy tan head, fizzy carbonation and traces of yeast. Aroma of spicy hops, caramel, vanilla, fruity notes and yeast. Taste starts with sweet spiciness, while followed by yeast and strong alcohol note. Mouthfeel is very warm, aftertaste is long and bitter, but not so spicy than grassy. Full bodied, slick, but somehow thinner texture than expected, fizzy carbonation in palate. Could be better, but still top class...

18-AUG-2012, bottle @home, brought by Morten.
Hazy orange with lasting tan head.
Yeast, fruit, apricot, orange, wheaty malt.
Highly carbonated with medium body.
OK, but not one of the best tripels.

330 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a cloudy golden orange colour with large, lasting white head.  Aroma is citrus, banana, pear, dark fruit and spice.  Flavour is quite fruity with banana, lemon zest, apple/pear and a little raisin and a clove-ish spiciness.  Alcohol is very subtle.  Fine, fizzy carbonation.  Quite nice.
Clear golden colour with a medium head, sour fruity like berries and a light sweet smell, bitter caramel medium carbanonation, with a sweet bitter caramel/toffee aftertaste

This Belgium triple has an aroma of perfection with slight seasonal spiced aromas similar to a Christmas seasonal ale, but without the dark barley. It has a dark orange complexion with a thin head that nears perfection. The initial flavor exudes citrus flavors without an overwhelming sourness! The palate lingers with a medium body and long finish! St Bernardus is proof why Belgium is the capital of beer!
It has a beautiful golden color with copper refects. A strong beer with a strong character. The nice bitterness will remain on your tongue for a while and thats probably the best part of it.

Bottle.  Pours hazy dark gold with a large, frothy white head, long retention with excellent lacing.  Aroma is soft Belgian yeast esters, Belgian Candi sugar, light biscuit and cracker malt with spices and spicy hops.  Flavor is malty sweetness with fruity esters and spices, light hops and bitterness and a dry finish.  Medium body, heavy carbonation.

Bottle. Pours a light straw yellow with a slight haze, with a billowing head which calms down quite swiftly and settles on the top. Nose is delightful, sweet bread, grass, a slight citrus nose, spice and a topnote of alcohol, some slight vanillas. In the mouth and theres an immediate doughy sweetness, tempered with some bananas and vanilla, theres a slight sourness along with that sweetness, a little lemon, a touch of raisin. Wonderfully complex, but you can marvel in its delicate touch and bittersweet finish.

Bottle. Cloudy golden liquid with medium, persisting white head with nice lacing. Aroma of bubble gum, sweet red fruit, clove, bread and a bit banana. Taste is light to medium sweet and light bitter with some banana, sweet malt and bubble gum. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Ok, but too sweet for me. I cant stand sweet tripels.

St. Bernardus Tripel has a fizzy, ginger ale-type, white head and a hazy, golden-orange appearance, with lots of champagne fizziness and a plethora of suspended brownish-gray particles floating about. The aroma is of spicy bread, fruit, and sugar candy. Taste is of spicy fruit cake, bread, raisin, malt, and a lot of other stuff I cant pinpoint. Bitterness is low with this one. The mouthfeel is tingly and medium, and St. Bernardus Tripel finishes mostly dry, tasty, and highly drinkable, which could get a drinker into trouble. Overall, it lives up to its reputation. RJT

Keg at North Bar, Leeds. Didnt know it even came in keg! Pours a transparent straw yellow, finger of head that fades quickly. Aroma is wonderful - banana esters, slight tropical fruits, salami, a little smoke, definite emmental cheese (creaminess and nuttiness). Taste is brilliant Tripel - banana fruitless, a little bitter with a slightly salty miso character. Dry, bitter but fruity finish. It doesnt suffer from the overcarbonation issue that plagues many Tripels, either. This is really, really good.

Söt och ljus trappist. En av de sämre trappisterna jag har smakat men ändå OK. "Alkoholhalt: 8,0 %. Pris: 24,90 Kr.  Användning: Serveras vid 8-10°C som sällskapsdryck elller till husmanskost, eller till kittostar.  Smak: Nyanserad, något kryddig smak med inslag av aprikos, honung, pomerans och örter.  Färg: Något oklar, mörk, gul färg. Producent: Brouwerij St Bernard. Råvaror: Maltsorterna alexis och prisma, samt humle av sorterna target och styrian golding. Doft: Nyanserad, något kryddig doft med inslag av aprikos, honung, pomerans och örter. Tillverkning/ Vinifiering: Ale tillverkas genom överjäsning, till skillnad från underjäsning eller den mycket ovanliga spontanjäsningen. Överjäsning sker normalt vid rumstemperatur. Processen har fått sitt namn av att jästen flyter upp till ytan vid jäsningen. Denna öl efterjäste på flaskan. Producenten: Bryggeriet grundades 1946 i staden Watou i Belgien, nära den franska gränsen. Övrigt: Triple är en traditionell belgisk benämning på öl som efterjäst på flaskan." (Från Systembolaget)

Tasted from 11.2oz brown bottle into tulip glass. It poured a light amber/honey color with decent off-white foam and lace. Sweet malt, light bread, caramel, faint earthy and peppery hops, strong Belgian yeast phenols. True-to-style tripel. Good, certainly, but not as great as I expected.

Yeasty, bread aromas, mixed with honey and florals.. Lead to well blended layers of spice, yeast, and citrus. Good palate, with seamless texture and flavors and lingering finish of spice, clove, banana, lemon and apples. Good balanced carbonation.

--- tasted while on a long journey to understand the world around me...

Hazy yellow colour. Bready aroma with a spiced and yeasty note and slight lemon floral note. Highly carbonated mouthfeel with ester and lees. It has a sourness and slightly bitter finish but Im not a fan of the metallic note. An enjoyable brew but rather one dimensional considering the style of beer.

Bottle. Pours hazy dark amber with a thin soapy head that hangs around. Aroma has sweet malty yeast and candied sugar scent. Taste is bitter with yeast sugary malt and raisin subtle spice. Palate is slick and chalky.

pours a clear yellow colour with a thin spotty white head. strong citrus aroma with a bit of yeast hay background. flavour is sweet little sour with light banana and fruit notes. medium sticky body and lots of carbonation.

Hazy orange color. Some bubbles moving in there, big foam.
Smells fresh citrus fruits, banana, coriander and yeast.
Tastes the same. Starts fruity and then finishes sweet/caramel. My god, such a well balanced beer. Lots of carbonation.
Some alcohol is felt, but very subtle. Amazing.
Thanks St. Bernardus!

Poured from a 330 ml bottle into a St. Bernardus branded chalice.

Pours a hazy gold with dark amber accents and a two finger bright white pillowy head. Abundant lacing as the head recedes. Incredible head retention. An amazing aroma of spices, Belgian yeast, and ripe fruit on the nose. Opens with herbs and flora with just a touch of spice, juicy fruit in the middle and finishes dry with some sweetness, extremely mild herbal bitterness and a touch of alcohol. The mouthfeel is mind-blowing. Slightly heavy bodied, however slick with abundant velvet-like creaminess. A very uniquely amazing tripel and a brew everyone should seek out.

Tap. Pours cloudy orange hazy, medium white creamy head that dissipates with nice lacing. Aroma is yeast, coriander, a bit of fruity wheat. Flavor is much the same, with yeast taking center stage. Mildly sweet, mild bitter finish.
Bottle. Yellow, hazy, bottle conditioned. Malty nose, bready, soft. Body is thickish, full. With bready malts. Almost oily. Nice brew. A lot plain maltier than the others Ive tasted.-- bb/h

UPDATED: JUN 23, 2014 33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy light orange with white head. 
Aroma is yeast, apple, banana, citrus, caramel. 
Taste is sweetsour begin going into a bitter finish. 
Mouth-feel creamy. 
Nice tripel.

Pours a cloudy gold with sparse carb and a tremendous white pillow of head that stays well. S[icy saaz aromas and honeydew melon notes. Dry finish with sweet undertones. Delicious complex exemplary belgian tripel.
Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Fruity aroma. Yeasty malt flavour.

A-- Poured a hazy yellowish gold color, lots of floaties in the glass. Nice puffy white head, very nice lacing, got a good 1.5 fingers of foam. Looks almost like a hefe.

S-- Honey being the most dominant smell. Citrus with apple. Just a bit of the sugar smell in the end.

T-- Honey, apples, pear, and citrus. Get the alcohol burn in the very end. Very light to start.

M-- Well carbonated in the mouth. Holds its charistics well. Very well balanced beer. Once warm the candied sugar becomes a little more dominant though.

D-- Quite drinkable, excellent beer and excellent Triple. Once it gets warm it changes a bit and the alchohol becomes more obvious but when a little colder the fruit is much more obvious. Not that that is a bad thing. Easily have 2 of these and want more. Well disguised beer.
bright golden flavor with a thick long-lasting head. spicy taste that leaves a lot of bitterness on your tongue. the spicy taste got a bit in the way but still a good tripel.

A complex and enjoyable brew for sure. The focus is really on the finish, with lots of spices, hops, and earthy notes lingering nicely. A little less yeasty and bready than other representations of the style. An all around classic brew from a great brewery.

Bottle 33cl. Pours a white head with small bubbles, thin layer settles. Rotten peach color. Heavy carbonation, small bubbles (again). Aroma of yeast and pear. Taste of yeast, banana and sugar. Some bitterness in the end and a dry finish. Clever and smooth.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Head: much white colored foam. Color: clear, golden. Aroma: malt, yeast. Taste: some sour bitter. Palate: smooth, dry, medium CO2, lasting body. Overall: nice.
Magnifique bière blonde, un juste équilibre pour une bière triple (palette / alcool). La mousse tient bien, belle couleur. Un classique fruité et très agréable.
Clear golden colour with a large frothy white head. Mediun carbonation. Fresh aroma. Crisp citrus spice flavour. Tangy finish.
Pours a cloudy dull yellow. Sediment. Really nice. Sweet grainy and grassy aromas. Tastes like sweet grains, floweers, bananas, candy, and bubblegum. Medium bodied. Awesome stuff.

Gouden kleur, mistig en een witte schuimkop. Niet veel geur, minder dan de anders Bernardus bieren. Smaak is typisch tripel met een citrus (grapefruit) smaak gemixt met gist, hop en wat brood of banaan.

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

11.2 oz bottle. Best before 2/12/14. I love the happy monk on the labels of these St. Bernardus beers. Pours hazy pale orange with a thick white long-retaining head that leaves lace. Aroma is classic spicy Belgian yeast, with clove, banana, and SweeTarts standing out. Its not quite as aromatic as some other examples, however. Taste is sweet and meaty with no bitterness. A grainy flavor makes itself apparent after it warms a bit. Body is full, mouthfeel creamy. A really nice tripel.
Hazy orange, white foam. Sweet sour smell. Pleasant, sour on tongue. Strong sweet sour taste. Easy to drink, good beer.
Bottle at home in Skövde. Golden beer with a big lacy head. Fruity and hoppyaroma. Sweet, artificial flavour with some spices and fruits. Strange taste..:-( I really wanted to like this beer!

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy brown/yellow with light persistent head. Very malty aroma with yeast and fruit notes. Flavors of toast and bitter marmalade with some bubble gum and  gingerbread thrown   in.    Very nice.

Bottle. Cloudy gold with huge with head. Very yeasty. Sweet, fruity (banana, apple) body with slight alcohol burn. a little bit of funky barnyard in the background. Perfect mouth feel & carbonation. Just get some!
Bottle at home. Hazy golden with corriander nose. Quite dry, yeast esters, spicy, biscuit malt
Hazy orange. Typical tripel head goes away fairly quickly. Bready aroma. Taste is yeasty, white grape juice, spices, mild hops.

Aged under a year. Poured from bottle to wide mouth glass. Off white head which is  creamy thick   pour is light brownish or a dark tan like orangish

Smell is somewhat sweet. Real smooth to start with malty aftertaste  alc is felt in  the stomach  waters my mouth for more.
Bottle in a signature tulip glass at Biercraft on The Drive. Big head. Nose is fruity. Flavor is fruity, citrus, bitter, sweet, complex. I usually prefer dubbels, but this is a great tripel!
Some head. Yellow. Light sugary nose. Simple. Medium body and length. Dry taste with sugar and almost dry grapefruit. Dissapointing.

330ml bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, light yellow with yellow-tinged head that doesnt leave much lace.  Classic tripel style nose, banana, bubblegum, spice, yeast, wheat. Fruit and spice up front, but muted  with a sort of boring mid-palate and bland finish with a little warm. Theres a savoury note as well. Disappointing.
Hefe-liknande utseende med rejäl skumkrona. Bitter jästsmak med alkoholanstrykning (denna är "endast" 8%). Visserligen dracks den för varm, men så här mkt spritsmak brukar inte belgarna ha!

Cloudy golden orange from tap at Somerset Hills Tap Room. Hints of orange peel and coriander, I expected more carbonation as it was the first pour from a fresh keg, I watched them tap it. Crisp, dry, refreshing, sneaky strong. Not my favorite Belgian Tripel (big fan of the style) as this had almost a dirty flavor. But still a great beer.

Det här är en juste och välsmakande öl, skönt välbalanserad smak med en viss bitterhet. Smaken präglas främst av jäst och jag tyckte mig kunna känna lite honung och kanske även lite äpple. Slutsats: en riktigt bra belgare.

UPDATED: MAR 16, 2014 hazy blond whith a white cap, Spicy nose, soap, oak, orange peel. Medium body, well balanced sweet, dry, bitter and sour particles, decent carbon. Palate is overhelmed by quina and citruses peel. Quite bitter and long aftertaste. UPDATED: APR 17, 2014 Hazy orange with big lasting head. Aroma is yeast, fruity. Flavour is fruity, sweet. Long tasty aftertaste. Really great Tripel!
Bottled. Pours golden with a huge with head. Smells and tastes honey and bread malty with a malty mild bitter finish.
Bottle, pours hazy copper/amber with bit frothy white head. Aroma is yeast, sugar, figs. caramel. Taste is sweet with notes as aroma with some banana. Alcohol is noticable.

bottle, consumed at francis kavarna in pilsen square. hayz golden with a persistent head; restrained aroma of orange poppy seed cake; very frothy but in a pleasant way; nice mix of orange zestiness, passionfruit upside-down cake and some vibrant bitterness. very easy to drink

Poured from bottle.  Pours a hazy light gold with nice solid bright white head. Lots of lacing

Aroma is very strong heavy fruit notes raisins and sour cherries.

Flavor is well balanced but alcohol is present.  Almost a, light cruel flavor.  Sour notes are present and very pleasant

Mouthful is a little fizzy

Bottle from SB cons 2012-06-17 Göteborg
AR: roasted malt, melas, à bit spicey
AP: hazy copper, 1 cm fizzy à bit transparent white head
F: belgian yeasty,wee alcholic, caramel, medium plus bitterness, after 10 min it is becoming softer, à bit champagne cream and wee prunes...
A little too much taste of alcohol. Good smooth flavor and truly rich with a high white foam. Slightly malty transient in marked acidity.
UPDATED: FEB 9, 2013 Hazy yellow, a lot of yeast. Im not a fan of triples but i must say i had higher thoughts about this beer. too much sweetnes and too much yeast. doesnt taste much alcohol tho

Bottle.
Straw or dull pale golden with small bubbles rising to the surface, and a white head.
Aroma: fruity and floral, hay, light spiciness, and also pickled anchovies or herring. 
Taste: ripe fruit like pears, a light note of licorice, white wine, banana, a light yeastiness, some kind of candy.
Moving from prickly carbonation towards becoming moussy.
Probably one of my favourite tripels.

Bottle from Systembolaget.
Looked forward to this since Im a fan of tripples but this was too sweet, too yeasty and too much banana.

Hazy golden with a massive belgian style head. Lovely rich aroma with a lot of spices and yeast. The flavor contain the same features but with a disturbing amount of alcohol that bring down the overall impression a bit, still a nice beer.
